		/* <![CDATA[ */
		function addLoadEvent(func) {
			var oldonload = window.onload;
			if (typeof window.onload != 'function') {
				window.onload = func;
			} else {
				window.onload = function () {
					oldonload();
					func();
				}
			}
		}

			a.src=src;var b=document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];b.parentNode.insertBefore(a,b)})("https://dashboard.tinypass.com/xbuilder/experience/load?aid=Fy7FpgyUxA");

  <script>
			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
				// Get all existing values from the cookie
				var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
				// Set the value
				cookieValue[name] = value;

				// Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
				var d = new Date();
				d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
				var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();


									var domain = 'techcrunch.com';
				
				// Write the cookie value
				document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=."+domain;
			}

						

			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
			    // Get all existing values from the cookie
			    var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
			    // Set the value
			    cookieValue[name] = value;

			    // Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
			    var d = new Date();
			    d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
			    var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();

			    // Write the cookie value
			    document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=.tcpreprod.com";
			}

			/**
			 * Read values from cookie and convert them from json
			 * @param specificName (optional) Name specific value from the set
			 * @returns {*} If specificName is specified - returns single value, otherwise returns JSON object with all values
			 */
			function pianoReadCustomVariableCookie(specificName) {
			    var cookieValue;
			    try {
			        // Try to get the cookie value with regexp
			        var match = document.cookie.match(new RegExp('(^| )__pcvc=([^;]+)'));
			        if (match) {
			            // If cookie with this name was found - try to parse the JSON value
			            cookieValue = JSON.parse(match[2]);
			        }
			    }
			    catch (e) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (!cookieValue) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (typeof specificName != "undefined") {
			        // Get the specific value from the set
			        if (typeof cookieValue[specificName] != "undefined") {
			            return cookieValue[specificName];
			        }
			        return null;
			    }
			    return cookieValue;
			}

			/**
			 * Function to send data upstream to Piano template
			 * @param iframeId - Element id of the Piano iframe
			 * @param success - true/false. Status of the message
			 * @param message - Error message text
			 * @param object - Additional data, like the the field that triggered the error
			 */
			function sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, success, message, object) {
			    var iframe = jQuery('#' + iframeId);

			    if (iframe.length) {
			        iframe[0].contentWindow.postMessage({
			            piano: {
			                success: success,
			                message: message,
			                object: object
			            }
			        }, '*');
			    }
			}

			tp = window.tp || [];

			tp.push(["addHandler", "customEvent", function (event, b, c, d) {
			    switch (event.eventName) {
			        // Don't show me this again
			        case 'dont-show':
			            pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('dontshow', 'y');
			            tp.offer.close();
			            break;

			        case 'tc-signup-newsletters':
			            console.log(event);
			            var email = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.email != 'undefined') && (event.params.email.length > 0)) {
			                email = event.params.email;
			            }

			            var object = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.object != 'undefined') && (event.params.object.length > 0)) {
			                object = event.params.object;
			            }

			            var list = [];
			            if ((typeof event.params.list != 'undefined') && (event.params.list.length > 0)) {
			                list = JSON.parse(event.params.list);
			            }

			            var iframeId;

			            // We are parsing the params object sent from the template to find out which iframe triggered it
			            params = JSON.parse(event.params.params);
			            // And here's the iframeId we're looking for
			            iframeId = params.iframeId;

			            //grab the security string from the from the form
			            //on the page, needed for check in the backend
			            var $form = jQuery('.form-newsletters');
			            var url = '/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php';
			            var nonce = $form.data('nonce');


			            if (email == undefined || email == '') {
			                return;
			            }

			            var emailLists = [];
			            for (var i in list){
			                if (list[i]){
			                    emailLists.push(i);
			                }
			            }

			            var jqxhr = jQuery.get(url, {
			                action: "newsletters",
			                subaction: "subscribe",
			                email_lists: emailLists,
			                email: email,
			                tracking_id: event.params.tracking_id,
			                security: nonce
			            }, function (data) {
			                if (!data.success){
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, false, data.data.message, object)
			                }
			                else{
			                    // When the email was added - set the cookie
			                    pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('newsletter', 'y');
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, true, "");
			                }
			            });
			            break;
			    }
			}]);

			// Read all values from cookie
			var cookieValues = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();

			for (var i in cookieValues) {
			    // Set custom variables from cookie
			    tp.push(['setCustomVariable', i, cookieValues[i]]);
			}



		</script> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="author" data-type="string" content="Steve O'Hear"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="post_id" data-type="integer" content="1489929"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="title" data-type="string" content="Notion Capital outs new $80M ‘growth equity’ fund to invest in enterprise Saas and cloud portfolio"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="object_type" data-type="string" content="post"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="url" data-type="enum" content="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/16/notion-capital-outs-new-80m-growth-equity-fund-to-invest-in-enterprise-saas-and-cloud-portfolio/"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="timestamp" data-type="date" content="2017-05-16 01:00:54"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="content" data-type="text" content="Notion Capital, the London-based VC focussed on enterprise SaaS and cloud startups, is announcing a number of updates today. This includes a new later-stage follow-on fund for existing portfolio companies, and the final closing of its third early-stage fund, which now counts Cisco amongst a number of new U.S-based LPs. The firm has also made two internal promotions, with both Chrys Chrysanthou and Patrick Norris making the step up to Partner. Dubbed &quot;Notion Capital Opportunities LP,&quot; the new growth equity fund is targeting a final close of $80 million and will be used by Notion to do later-stage investments -- think Series C and beyond -- in the best performing companies in its current portfolio, and in a way that would not be possible by simply following on out of its existing funds. I understand Notion has already raised 55 per cent of the new fund's target size, whilst the thinking behind the follow-on vehicle is to &quot;augment investment returns&quot; and position the firm as an even more…"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="excerpt" data-type="text" content="Notion Capital, the London-based VC focussed on enterprise SaaS and cloud startups, is announcing a number of updates today, including a new later-stage follow-on fund for existing portfolio companies.">

       <h2>Hi!</h2> 
       <p> You are about to activate our Facebook Messenger news bot. Once subscribed, the bot will send you a digest of trending stories once a day. You can also customize the types of stories it sends you. </p>

       <div class="fb-messenger-iframe"> 
        <div class="fb-send-to-messenger" id="fb-send-to-messenger" messenger_app_id="1678638095724206" page_id="8062627951" color="blue" size="large" data-ref="tcnav"></div> 
        <script>
		  window.fbAsyncInit = function() {
		    FB.init({
		      appId      : '1678638095724206',
		      xfbml      : true,
		      version    : 'v2.6'
		    });
			FB.Event.subscribe('xfbml.render', function() {
				jQuery('.fb-messenger-loading').detach()
			});
		  };

		  (function(d, s, id){
		     var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
		     if (d.getElementById(id)) {return;}
		     js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id;
		     js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_US/sdk.js";
		     fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
		   }(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));

		   function getCookie(name) {
		      var matches = document.cookie.match(new RegExp(
		        "(?:^|; )" + name.replace(/([\.$?*|{}\(\)\[\]\\\/\+^])/g, '\\$1') + "=([^;]*)"
		      ));
		      return matches ? decodeURIComponent(matches[1]) : undefined;
		   }

		   window.onload = function() {
		     var gravity_guid = getCookie('grvinsights');
		     var btn = document.getElementById('fb-send-to-messenger');
		     if (btn != undefined && btn != null) {
			   btn.setAttribute('data-ref', gravity_guid)
			 }
		   }

		</script> 
       </div> 
      </div> 
     </div> 
    </div>
    <!-- /.modal-content --> 
   </div>
   <!-- /.modal-dialog --> 
  </div>
  <!-- /.modal -->

        <!-- End: Article Eyebrows --> 
        <h1 class="alpha tweet-title">Notion Capital outs new $80M ‘growth equity’ fund to invest in enterprise Saas and cloud portfolio</h1> 
        <div class="title-left"> 
         <div class="byline">
           Posted 
          <time datetime="2017-05-16" class="timestamp">10 minutes ago</time> by 
          <a href="/author/steve-ohear/" title="Posts by Steve O'Hear" onclick="s_objectID='river_author';" rel="author">Steve O'Hear</a> 
          <span class="twitter-handle">(<a href="https://twitter.com/sohear" rel="external">@sohear</a>)</span>
         </div> 
         <!-- Begin: Social Share Icons --> 
         <div class="social-share social-share-inline"> 
          <ul class="inline-list social-share-list" id="social-share" data-permalink="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/16/notion-capital-outs-new-80m-growth-equity-fund-to-invest-in-enterprise-saas-and-cloud-portfolio/" data-shortlink="http://tcrn.ch/2rlgHsL" data-sharetitle="Notion Capital outs new $80M ‘growth equity’ fund to invest in enterprise Saas and" data-post-id="1489929" data-twitter-hash=""> 
           <li class="total-shares"> <h5 class="total-shares-count">0</h5><br> <small>SHARES</small> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#comments" rel="external" class="comment icon-comment launch-social-load"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="facebook icon-facebook"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="twitter icon-twitter"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="linkedin icon-linkedin"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="google-plus icon-google-plus"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="reddit icon-reddit"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="stumbleupon icon-stumbleupon"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="email icon-email"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="flipboard icon-flipboard"></a> </li> 
          </ul> 
         </div> 
         <div class="social-share social-share-fixed"> 
          <div class="less"> 
           <a class="blank"></a> 
           <a class="icon-flipboard" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-stumbleupon" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-reddit" href="#"></a>

        </div> 
        <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/16/the-htc-u11s-most-compelling-feature-edge-sense-is-pretty-silly/" class="next-link" data-omni-sm="art_nextstory"> 
         <div class="next-story-link">
          Next Story
         </div> 
         <div class="next-story-full"> 
          <h4 class="next-title">The HTC U11’s most compelling feature, Edge Sense, is pretty&nbsp;silly</h4> 
         </div> </a> 
       </header> 
       <!-- End: Article Header --> 
       <!-- Begin: Article Body --> 
       <div class="l-two-col"> 
        <!-- Begin: Article Body - Main --> 
        <div class="l-main-container"> 
         <div class="l-main"> 
          <div class="article-entry text"> 
           <!-- Begin: Wordpress Article Content --> 
           <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/stephen-chandler-notion-capital.jpg?w=738" class=""> 
           <p id="speakable-summary"><a target="_blank" href="http://www.notioncapital.com/">Notion Capital</a>, the London-based VC focussed on enterprise SaaS and cloud startups, is announcing a number of updates today. This includes a new later-stage follow-on fund for existing portfolio companies, and the final closing of its third early-stage fund, which now counts Cisco amongst a number of new U.S-based LPs. The firm has also made two internal promotions, with both Chrys Chrysanthou and Patrick Norris making the step up to Partner.</p> 
           <p>Dubbed “Notion Capital Opportunities LP,” the new growth equity fund is targeting a final close of $80 million and will be used by Notion to do later-stage investments — think Series C and beyond — in the best performing companies in its current portfolio, and in a way that would not be possible by simply following on out of its existing funds. I understand Notion has already raised 55 per cent of the new fund’s target size, whilst the thinking behind the follow-on vehicle is to “augment investment returns” and position the firm as an even more attractive and long-term funding partner for the companies and founders it backs.</p> 
           <p>Notion is also communicating the final close of “Notional Capital III LP,” its third early-stage fund at $140 million, <a target="_blank" href="https://techcrunch.com/2015/07/23/saas-startups-would-be-idiots-not-to-know-notion-capital-after-150m-fund-raise/">$120 million of which had previously been announced</a>. Notably, new LPs include Cisco Investments, the venture capital arm of Silicon Valley tech giant Cisco, as well as two U.S. university endowments Emory and Texas A&amp;M. Ireland’s Key Capital has also invested in the fund.</p> 
           <p>In a call, Notion Capital Managing Partner Stephen Chandler said the fact that the VC has pulled in U.S.-based LPs for the final closing of fund three is a reflection of the growing interest across the pond in European tech startups. This, he said, was in stark contrast to the state of play back in 2009 when Notion Capital was first started by himself and the two founders of MessageLabs, after it sold for $700 million to Symantec a year earlier.</p> 
           <p>Asked about the trouble other U.K. funds <a target="_blank" href="https://ftalphaville.ft.com/2017/05/10/2188575/brexit-trouble-for-british-venture-capital/">are reportedly having closing</a>, because of uncertainty now that Brexit’s Article 50 has been triggered and in relation to Europe’s largest LP, the partly European tax-payer funded European Investment Fund (EIF), Chandler says that this was something he took into account when actively courting U.S. investors.</p>
           <div>
            <div id="adsDivacc5b65879" class="native-ad-mobile"></div>
           </div> 
           <p>Put simply, given Brexit, he wanted Notion to diversify its LPs away from being so reliant on the EU, and says U.S. LPs now make up 20 per cent of Notion Capital III’s final closing. Investors in the U.K., including the state-backed British Business Bank accounts for 25 per cent, Middle East investors account for 25 per cent, and EU investors, such as the EIF and various European family offices, make up the remaining 30 per cent.</p> 
           <p>Meanwhile, Chandler says the promotion of Chrysanthou and Norris to full Partner roles is a sign that Notion itself is maturing along with its in-house talent. Specifically, it signals that the firm has moved beyond simply being known as the European Saas fund founded by ex-MessageLabs operators and owners.</p> 
           <p>“These developments leave us exceptionally well positioned for 2017 and beyond, so we feel excited about what the future holds for Notion,” he adds in a statement. “From the start we set out to build a genuinely differentiated venture capital firm that would be sustainable across multiple generations. Talent is obviously critical to that mission so it is particularly pleasing to recognise the contribution of our two new partners with these internal promotions.”</p> 
           <!-- End: Wordpress Article Content --> 
          </div> 
          <div id="social-after-wrapper" class="cf social-share social-share-inline">

    <div id="adsDiv007bfd74b0" class=""></div> 
    <script>
/* <![CDATA[ */
if (!ads.isMobile()) {
	(function(window,$){
		window.TechCrunch.loader.on('tc_ads_wrapper_omniture', function(){
			if ( !window.ads.isAdPageSet ){
				if ( typeof window.adSetAdURL == 'function' ) {
					window.adSetAdURL('/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/_uac/adpage.html');
					window.ads.isAdPageSet = true;
				}
				if ( typeof window.adsResizePortrait === 'function' ) {
					window.adsResizePortrait('1');
				}
				window.console.log('ADS WIDTH:');
				window.console.log(ads);
			}
			window.adSetOthAT('kventryid=1489929;kvcmsid=tcr:1489929;kvugc=0;kvsubj=981284:979329:6378547:6379287;kvent=4169517:5155981:5158933:5155982:4102916:4976210:6426735:3496716:3504343:3551768:3683918:3689406:3692216:5089519');
			window.htmlAdWH('93484978', "250", "125", 'f', 'adsDiv007bfd74b0');
		});
	}(this,this.jQuery));
}
/* ]]> */
</script>
    <div id="adsDiv2818a475bd" class=""></div>

  <script type="application/ld+json">
		{"@context":"http:\/\/schema.org","@type":"Article","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2017\/05\/16\/notion-capital-outs-new-80m-growth-equity-fund-to-invest-in-enterprise-saas-and-cloud-portfolio\/","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Steve O'Hear"},"headline":"Notion Capital outs new $80M 'growth equity'","articleBody":"Notion Capital, the London-based VC focussed on enterprise SaaS and cloud startups, is announcing a number of updates today. This includes a new later-stage follow-on fund for existing portfolio companies, and the final closing of its third early-stage fund, which now counts Cisco amongst a number of new U.S-based LPs. The firm has also made two internal promotions, with both Chrys Chrysanthou and Patrick Norris making the step up to Partner.\n\nDubbed \"Notion Capital Opportunities LP,\" the new growth equity fund is targeting a final close of $80 million and will be used by Notion to do later-stage investments -- think Series C and beyond -- in the best performing companies in its current portfolio, and in a way that would not be possible by simply following on out of its existing funds. I understand Notion has already raised 55 per cent of the new fund's target size, whilst the thinking behind the follow-on vehicle is to \"augment investment returns\" and position the firm as an even more attractive and long-term funding partner for the companies and founders it backs.\n\nNotion is also communicating the final close of \"Notional Capital III LP,\" its third early-stage fund at $140 million, $120 million of which had previously been announced. Notably, new LPs include Cisco Investments, the venture capital arm of Silicon Valley tech giant Cisco, as well as two U.S. university endowments Emory and Texas A&amp;M. Ireland's Key Capital has also invested in the fund.\n\nIn a call, Notion Capital Managing Partner Stephen Chandler said the fact that the VC has pulled in U.S.-based LPs for the final closing of fund three is a reflection of the growing interest across the pond in European tech startups. This, he said, was in stark contrast to the state of play back in 2009 when Notion Capital was first started by himself and the two founders of MessageLabs, after it sold for $700 million to Symantec a year earlier.\n\nAsked about the trouble other U.K. funds are reportedly having closing, because of uncertainty now that Brexit's Article 50 has been triggered and in relation to Europe's largest LP, the partly European tax-payer funded European Investment Fund (EIF), Chandler says that this was something he took into account when actively courting U.S. investors.\n\nPut simply, given Brexit, he wanted Notion to diversify its LPs away from being so reliant on the EU, and says U.S. LPs now make up 20 per cent of Notion Capital III's final closing. Investors in the U.K., including the state-backed British Business Bank accounts for 25 per cent, Middle East investors account for 25 per cent, and EU investors, such as the EIF and various European family offices, make up the remaining 30 per cent.\n\nMeanwhile, Chandler says the promotion of Chrysanthou and Norris to full Partner roles is a sign that Notion itself is maturing along with its in-house talent. Specifically, it signals that the firm has moved beyond simply being known as the European Saas fund founded by ex-MessageLabs operators and owners.\n\n\u201cThese developments leave us exceptionally well positioned for 2017 and beyond, so we feel excited about what the future holds for Notion,\" he adds in a statement. \"From the start we set out to build a genuinely differentiated venture capital firm that would be sustainable across multiple generations.  Talent is obviously critical to that mission so it is particularly pleasing to recognise the contribution of our two new partners with these internal promotions.\u201d","datePublished":"2017-05-16T08:00:54+00:00","mainEntityOfPage":"True","image":{"@list":["https:\/\/tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com\/2017\/05\/stephen-chandler-notion-capital.jpg"]},"speakable":{"@type":"SpeakableSpecification","cssSelector":[".alpha","#speakable-summary"]}}	</script>

		function addLoadEvent(func) {
			var oldonload = window.onload;
			if (typeof window.onload != 'function') {
				window.onload = func;
			} else {
				window.onload = function () {
					oldonload();

			a.src=src;var b=document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];b.parentNode.insertBefore(a,b)})("https://dashboard.tinypass.com/xbuilder/experience/load?aid=Fy7FpgyUxA");

  <script>
			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
				// Get all existing values from the cookie
				var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
				// Set the value
				cookieValue[name] = value;

				// Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
				var d = new Date();
				d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
				var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();


									var domain = 'techcrunch.com';
				
				// Write the cookie value
				document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=."+domain;
			}

						

			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
			    // Get all existing values from the cookie
			    var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
			    // Set the value
			    cookieValue[name] = value;

			    // Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
			    var d = new Date();
			    d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
			    var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();

			    // Write the cookie value
			    document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=.tcpreprod.com";
			}

			/**
			 * Read values from cookie and convert them from json
			 * @param specificName (optional) Name specific value from the set
			 * @returns {*} If specificName is specified - returns single value, otherwise returns JSON object with all values
			 */
			function pianoReadCustomVariableCookie(specificName) {
			    var cookieValue;
			    try {
			        // Try to get the cookie value with regexp
			        var match = document.cookie.match(new RegExp('(^| )__pcvc=([^;]+)'));
			        if (match) {
			            // If cookie with this name was found - try to parse the JSON value
			            cookieValue = JSON.parse(match[2]);
			        }
			    }
			    catch (e) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (!cookieValue) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (typeof specificName != "undefined") {
			        // Get the specific value from the set
			        if (typeof cookieValue[specificName] != "undefined") {
			            return cookieValue[specificName];
			        }
			        return null;
			    }
			    return cookieValue;
			}

			/**
			 * Function to send data upstream to Piano template
			 * @param iframeId - Element id of the Piano iframe
			 * @param success - true/false. Status of the message
			 * @param message - Error message text
			 * @param object - Additional data, like the the field that triggered the error
			 */
			function sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, success, message, object) {
			    var iframe = jQuery('#' + iframeId);

			    if (iframe.length) {
			        iframe[0].contentWindow.postMessage({
			            piano: {
			                success: success,
			                message: message,
			                object: object
			            }
			        }, '*');
			    }
			}

			tp = window.tp || [];

			tp.push(["addHandler", "customEvent", function (event, b, c, d) {
			    switch (event.eventName) {
			        // Don't show me this again
			        case 'dont-show':
			            pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('dontshow', 'y');
			            tp.offer.close();
			            break;

			        case 'tc-signup-newsletters':
			            console.log(event);
			            var email = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.email != 'undefined') && (event.params.email.length > 0)) {
			                email = event.params.email;
			            }

			            var object = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.object != 'undefined') && (event.params.object.length > 0)) {
			                object = event.params.object;
			            }

			            var list = [];
			            if ((typeof event.params.list != 'undefined') && (event.params.list.length > 0)) {
			                list = JSON.parse(event.params.list);
			            }

			            var iframeId;

			            // We are parsing the params object sent from the template to find out which iframe triggered it
			            params = JSON.parse(event.params.params);
			            // And here's the iframeId we're looking for
			            iframeId = params.iframeId;

			            //grab the security string from the from the form
			            //on the page, needed for check in the backend
			            var $form = jQuery('.form-newsletters');
			            var url = '/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php';
			            var nonce = $form.data('nonce');


			            if (email == undefined || email == '') {
			                return;
			            }

			            var emailLists = [];
			            for (var i in list){
			                if (list[i]){
			                    emailLists.push(i);
			                }
			            }

			            var jqxhr = jQuery.get(url, {
			                action: "newsletters",
			                subaction: "subscribe",
			                email_lists: emailLists,
			                email: email,
			                tracking_id: event.params.tracking_id,
			                security: nonce
			            }, function (data) {
			                if (!data.success){
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, false, data.data.message, object)
			                }
			                else{
			                    // When the email was added - set the cookie
			                    pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('newsletter', 'y');
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, true, "");
			                }
			            });
			            break;
			    }
			}]);

			// Read all values from cookie
			var cookieValues = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();

			for (var i in cookieValues) {
			    // Set custom variables from cookie
			    tp.push(['setCustomVariable', i, cookieValues[i]]);
			}



		</script>

  <meta class="swiftype" name="timestamp" data-type="date" content="2017-05-16 00:01:58"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="content" data-type="text" content="You can’t really blame HTC for embracing a gimmick. A rough couple of years for the smartphone maker warrants some experimentation to help set its devices apart from myriad other Android manufacturers. Edge Sense, sadly, however, is not going to be that technology. The company teased the handset’s squeezable sides in a handful of short web videos, and now that the U 11 has been officially unveiled, we can confirm that the flagship’s most compelling feature isn’t really all that compelling in its current form. The feature uses sensors built into the sides of the phone to detect pressure as the user squeezes the phone. At present, actual applications for the tech mean that it essentially doubles as something akin to the convenience key that BlackBerry has sported for ages. Basically, you assign functionality to it, so it can, say, launch your favorite app. In a briefing ahead of this morning’s launch in Taiwan, VP of Product Planning, Nigel Newby-House suggested that this is…"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="excerpt" data-type="text" content="You can’t really blame HTC for embracing a gimmick. A rough couple of years for the smartphone maker warrants some experimentation to help set its devices apart from myriad other Android manufacturers. Edge Sense, sadly, however, is not going to be that technology.">

	var setAdblockerCookie = function(adblocker) {
	    var d = new Date();
	    d.setTime(d.getTime() + 60 * 60 * 24 * 30 * 1000);
	    document.cookie = "__adblocker=" + (adblocker ? "true" : "false") + "; expires=" + d.toUTCString() + "; path=/";
	}
	var script = document.createElement("script");
	script.setAttribute("async", true);
	script.setAttribute("src", "//www.npttech.com/advertising.js");
	script.setAttribute("onerror", "setAdblockerCookie(true);");
	script.setAttribute("onload", "setAdblockerCookie(false);");
	document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(script);
</script>

      <div class="modal-body"> 
       <h2>Hi!</h2> 
       <p> You are about to activate our Facebook Messenger news bot. Once subscribed, the bot will send you a digest of trending stories once a day. You can also customize the types of stories it sends you. </p> 
       <p> Click on the button below to subscribe and wait for a new Facebook message from the TC Messenger news bot. </p> 
       <p> Thanks,<br> TC Team </p> 
       <div class="fb-messenger-loading"></div> 
       <div class="fb-messenger-iframe"> 
        <div class="fb-send-to-messenger" id="fb-send-to-messenger" messenger_app_id="1678638095724206" page_id="8062627951" color="blue" size="large" data-ref="tcnav"></div> 
        <script>
		  window.fbAsyncInit = function() {
		    FB.init({
		      appId      : '1678638095724206',
		      xfbml      : true,
		      version    : 'v2.6'
		    });
			FB.Event.subscribe('xfbml.render', function() {
				jQuery('.fb-messenger-loading').detach()
			});
		  };

		  (function(d, s, id){
		     var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
		     if (d.getElementById(id)) {return;}
		     js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id;
		     js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_US/sdk.js";
		     fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
		   }(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));

		   function getCookie(name) {
		      var matches = document.cookie.match(new RegExp(
		        "(?:^|; )" + name.replace(/([\.$?*|{}\(\)\[\]\\\/\+^])/g, '\\$1') + "=([^;]*)"
		      ));
		      return matches ? decodeURIComponent(matches[1]) : undefined;
		   }

		   window.onload = function() {
		     var gravity_guid = getCookie('grvinsights');
		     var btn = document.getElementById('fb-send-to-messenger');
		     if (btn != undefined && btn != null) {
			   btn.setAttribute('data-ref', gravity_guid)
			 }
		   }

		</script> 
       </div>

              <a class="block-wrapper" href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/04/27/lg-reports-10-sales-bump-in-q1-mobile-revenues-up-4-qoq-2-yoy/"> <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/02/lg-g6-1.jpg?w=150" alt="LG reports ~10% sales bump in Q1, mobile revenues up 4% QoQ, 2%&nbsp;YoY">

                <h3>LG reports ~10% sales bump in Q1, mobile revenues up 4% QoQ, 2%&nbsp;YoY</h3> 
                <div class="block-meta"> 
                 <div class="byline"> 
                  <time datetime="2017-04-27 05:35:17"></time> 
                 </div> 
                </div> 
               </div> </a> 
             </div> </li> 
            <li> 
             <div class="block-small"> 
              <a class="block-wrapper" href="https://techcrunch.com/tag/smartphones/"> 
               <div class="block-content"> 
                <h3>Browse more...</h3> 
               </div> </a> 
             </div> </li> 
           </ul> 
          </div> 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <!-- End: Article Eyebrows --> 
        <h1 class="alpha tweet-title">The HTC U11’s most compelling feature, Edge Sense, is pretty silly</h1> 
        <div class="title-left"> 
         <div class="byline">
           Posted 
          <time datetime="2017-05-16" class="timestamp">1 hour ago</time> by 
          <a href="/author/brian-heater/" title="Posts by Brian Heater" onclick="s_objectID='river_author';" rel="author">Brian Heater</a> 
          <span class="twitter-handle">(<a href="https://twitter.com/bheater" rel="external">@bheater</a>)</span>
         </div> 
         <!-- Begin: Social Share Icons --> 
         <div class="social-share social-share-inline"> 
          <ul class="inline-list social-share-list" id="social-share" data-permalink="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/16/the-htc-u11s-most-compelling-feature-edge-sense-is-pretty-silly/" data-shortlink="http://tcrn.ch/2pRxaTk" data-sharetitle="The HTC U11’s most compelling feature, Edge Sense, is pretty&nbsp;silly" data-post-id="1489350" data-twitter-hash=""> 
           <li class="total-shares"> <h5 class="total-shares-count">0</h5><br> <small>SHARES</small> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#comments" rel="external" class="comment icon-comment launch-social-load"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="facebook icon-facebook"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="twitter icon-twitter"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="linkedin icon-linkedin"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="google-plus icon-google-plus"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="reddit icon-reddit"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="stumbleupon icon-stumbleupon"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="email icon-email"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="flipboard icon-flipboard"></a> </li> 
          </ul> 
         </div> 
         <div class="social-share social-share-fixed"> 
          <div class="less"> 
           <a class="blank"></a> 
           <a class="icon-flipboard" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-stumbleupon" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-reddit" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-email" href="#"></a> 
          </div> 
          <div class="shown"> 
           <a class="icon-facebook" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-twitter" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-linkedin" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-whatsapp" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-email" href="#"></a> 
          </div> 
         </div> 
         <!-- End: Social Share Icons --> 
        </div> 
        <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/talentio-grabs-88-million-for-its-recruitment-platform/" class="next-link" data-omni-sm="art_nextstory"> 
         <div class="next-story-link">
          Next Story
         </div> 
         <div class="next-story-full"> 
          <h4 class="next-title">Talent.io grabs $8.8 million for its recruitment&nbsp;platform</h4> 
         </div> </a> 
       </header> 
       <!-- End: Article Header --> 
       <!-- Begin: Article Body --> 
       <div class="l-two-col"> 
        <!-- Begin: Article Body - Main --> 
        <div class="l-main-container"> 
         <div class="l-main"> 
          <div class="article-entry text"> 
           <!-- Begin: Wordpress Article Content --> 
           <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0229.jpg?w=738" class=""> 
           <p id="speakable-summary">You can’t really blame <a target="_blank" href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/04/19/htc-wants-to-be-your-next-squeeze/" rel="noopener noreferrer">HTC for embracing a gimmick</a>. A rough couple of years for the smartphone maker warrants some experimentation to help set its devices apart from myriad other Android manufacturers. Edge Sense, sadly, however, is not going to be that technology. The company teased the handset’s squeezable sides in a handful of short web videos, and now that the U 11 has been officially unveiled, we can confirm that the flagship’s most compelling feature isn’t really all that compelling in its current form.</p> 
           <p>The feature uses sensors built into the sides of the phone to detect pressure as the user squeezes the phone. At present, actual applications for the tech mean that it essentially doubles as something akin to the convenience key that BlackBerry has sported for ages. Basically, you assign functionality to it, so it can, say, launch your favorite app.</p> 
           <p>In a briefing ahead of this morning’s launch in Taiwan, VP of Product Planning, Nigel Newby-House suggested that this is just the first glimpse into future functionality for Edge Sense — and certainly there’s a lot to be done with a new set of on-board sensors. As it stands, however, Edge Sense is really much more than a glorified button with the addition of an actual new physical button like Samsung did with the devoted <a target="_blank" href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/04/18/bixby-debut-samsung/" rel="noopener noreferrer">Bixby</a> key on the S8.</p> 
           <p><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1489463" src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0242.jpg?w=1024&amp;h=682" alt="" width="1024" height="682" srcset="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0242.jpg?w=1024&amp;h=682 1024w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0242.jpg?w=150&amp;h=100 150w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0242.jpg?w=300&amp;h=200 300w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0242.jpg?w=768&amp;h=512 768w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0242.jpg?w=680&amp;h=453 680w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0242.jpg 1400w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px"></p> 
           <p>It probably speaks a bit to the unfulfilled promise of the feature that Newby-House opted not to lead with this feature in our conversation. Most of the talk about the device centered around design decision. And it’s true — the U11 is a good-looking phone, borrowing some cues from the recently announced Ultra. In fact, the company seems to consider the Ultra something of a dry run for the new flagship — or at the very least, a way of introducing the new product line and design language. Probably something you don’t want to hear if you shelled out the $750 for the handset in the last couple of months.</p> 
           <p>The company calls it Liquid Design — a nod to the curvature and the notion that dipping it in liquid would fill in the sorts of gaps you usually get when two different surfaces are juxtaposed. Not the most straightforward idea, but it sounds nice, so fine. And while it looks pretty good, as well, it’s not exactly unique, bringing to mind other flagships like the S8, particularly given the use of a reflective metallic paint job.</p> 
           <p><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1489464" src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0250.jpg?w=1024&amp;h=682" alt="" width="1024" height="682" srcset="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0250.jpg?w=1024&amp;h=682 1024w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0250.jpg?w=150&amp;h=100 150w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0250.jpg?w=300&amp;h=200 300w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0250.jpg?w=768&amp;h=512 768w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0250.jpg?w=680&amp;h=453 680w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0250.jpg 1400w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px"></p> 
           <p>The screen is 5.5-inches, the same size you’ll get on the iPhone 7 Plus. The company says it flirted with the idea of switching up the aspect ratio like LG and Samsung have with their newest flagships (and, according to rumors, like Apple is planning on the 8), but opted to stick with 16:9 for “software reasons” — in other words, it didn’t want to deal with having to rejigger everything on that end. That said, it’s still entertaining the possibility of jumping on the tall phone ship for future devices.</p> 
           <p>The company has already been on the anti-headphone jack train for a little bit. The Ultra found the company planting its flag on that beach. “The headphone jack is going away,” Newby-House told me matter-of-factly. “Let’s just get on with it.” Of course, not everyone concurs, and other companies haven’t aligned themselves with Apple as quickly as many analysts expected. Even Motorola, which joined the part with the Moto Z, appears as if it’s regretting that move.</p> 
           <p>That said, the company is still committed as ever to audio — a welcome change from most companies, for whom audio is a fifth- or sixth-tier priority. The phone features a new version BoomSound, one of the better audio systems presently on handsets — though, weirdly, the company opted against dual front-facing speakers in order to accommodate a fingerprint sensor, even as more and more companies are moving biometrics to the back of the device. The phone also ships with company’s proprietary USonic earbuds, which sport active noise canceling.</p>
           <div>
            <div id="adsDivacc5b65879" class="native-ad-mobile"></div>
           </div> 
           <p><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1489466" src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0235.jpg?w=1024&amp;h=682" alt="" width="1024" height="682" srcset="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0235.jpg?w=1024&amp;h=682 1024w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0235.jpg?w=150&amp;h=100 150w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0235.jpg?w=300&amp;h=200 300w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0235.jpg?w=768&amp;h=512 768w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0235.jpg?w=680&amp;h=453 680w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0235.jpg 1400w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px"></p> 
           <p>The most interesting piece of the audio puzzle, however, is the fact that there are four microphones in the handset. This is largely based on a newfound interest in other people’s smart assistants (though it’s got some positive implication for video recording, as well). HTC has worked directly with Qualcomm to design a device capable of responding to two different wake words for two different assistants — neither of which are the in-house one it announced along with the Ultra.</p> 
           <p>Instead, the company is embracing both Assistant and Alexa. The company says it sees advantages to both and doesn’t want to play favorites. Fair enough. There’s certainly a lot to be said for putting the ultimate decision in the hands of the user. That said, this doesn’t seem to bode well for the company’s faith in its own Sense Companion. And while it says this doesn’t preclude it from going full-on Bixby in the future, it currently views its own play as more of a supplement to Assistant and Alexa.</p> 
           <p>“We’ve never envisioned Companion as a wake word-type assistant,” says Newby-House. The company is more focused on using it to enhance its own software offerings, likely because it simply isn’t robust enough to be considered a standalone. That said, the company’s getting pretty close to a shit-or-get-off-the-pot moment here. The whole idea of a smart assistant has created a single unified experience — having an assistant designed to work with other assistants kind of flies in the face of all of that.</p> 
           <p><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1489467" src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0254.jpg?w=1024&amp;h=682" alt="" width="1024" height="682" srcset="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0254.jpg?w=1024&amp;h=682 1024w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0254.jpg?w=150&amp;h=100 150w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0254.jpg?w=300&amp;h=200 300w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0254.jpg?w=768&amp;h=512 768w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0254.jpg?w=680&amp;h=453 680w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/dsc_0254.jpg 1400w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px"></p> 
           <p>Oh, and Alexa isn’t shipping with the device out of the box. The company says the functionality should arrive within a month. This is kind of par for the course, at this point. Huawei ran up against a similar roadblock. Part of the issue is the fact that companies have to work directly with Amazon to customize the experience. When it does arrive, it will be in the form of an over-the-air update. It will also be in the box for devices later.</p> 
           <p>When that functionality does arrive, however, it will bring more traditional functionality. Calling, texting and the like will come down the road.</p> 
           <p>&nbsp;</p> 
           <!-- End: Wordpress Article Content --> 
          </div> 
          <div id="social-after-wrapper" class="cf social-share social-share-inline">

          <h2 class="section-title collapse-title aside-adjacent"> Newsletter Subscriptions </h2> 
          <div class="collapse-body newsletter-body"> 
           <div class="newsletter newsletter-side-bar-newsletters"> 
            <form method="post" class="inline-form form-newsletters" action="" data-nonce="ac25b1be0d"> 
             <div class="checkboxes cf"> 
              <fieldset class="custom-checkbox"> 
               <input type="checkbox" name="crunchdaily" id="tc-daily-591ab359ec01d1.26435782">

				if ( typeof window.adSetAdURL == 'function' ) {

  <script type="application/ld+json">
		{"@context":"http:\/\/schema.org","@type":"Article","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2017\/05\/16\/the-htc-u11s-most-compelling-feature-edge-sense-is-pretty-silly\/","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Brian Heater"},"headline":"The HTC U11\u2019s most compelling feature, Edge","articleBody":"You can\u2019t really blame HTC for embracing a gimmick. A rough couple of years for the smartphone maker warrants some experimentation to help set its devices apart from myriad other Android manufacturers. Edge Sense, sadly, however, is not going to be that technology. The company teased the handset\u2019s squeezable sides in a handful of short web videos, and now that the U 11 has been officially unveiled, we can confirm that the flagship\u2019s most compelling feature isn\u2019t really all that compelling in its current form.\n\nThe feature uses sensors built into the sides of the phone to detect pressure as the user squeezes the phone. At present, actual applications for the tech mean that it essentially doubles as something akin to the convenience key that BlackBerry has sported for ages. Basically, you assign functionality to it, so it can, say, launch your favorite app.\n\nIn a briefing ahead of this morning\u2019s launch in Taiwan, VP of Product Planning, Nigel Newby-House suggested that this is just the first glimpse into future functionality for Edge Sense -- and certainly there\u2019s a lot to be done with a new set of on-board sensors. As it stands, however, Edge Sense is really much more than a glorified button with the addition of an actual new physical button like Samsung did with the devoted Bixby key on the S8.\n\n\n\nIt probably speaks a bit to the unfulfilled promise of the feature that Newby-House opted not to lead with this feature in our conversation. Most of the talk about the device centered around design decision. And it\u2019s true -- the U11 is a good-looking phone, borrowing some cues from the recently announced Ultra. In fact, the company seems to consider the Ultra something of a dry run for the new flagship -- or at the very least, a way of introducing the new product line and design language. Probably something you don\u2019t want to hear if you shelled out the $750 for the handset in the last couple of months.\n\nThe company calls it Liquid Design -- a nod to the curvature and the notion that dipping it in liquid would fill in the sorts of gaps you usually get when two different surfaces are juxtaposed. Not the most straightforward idea, but it sounds nice, so fine. And while it looks pretty good, as well, it\u2019s not exactly unique, bringing to mind other flagships like the S8, particularly given the use of a reflective metallic paint job.\n\n\n\nThe screen is 5.5-inches, the same size you\u2019ll get on the iPhone 7 Plus. The company says it flirted with the idea of switching up the aspect ratio like LG and Samsung have with their newest flagships (and, according to rumors, like Apple is planning on the 8), but opted to stick with 16:9 for \u201csoftware reasons\u201d -- in other words, it didn\u2019t want to deal with having to rejigger everything on that end. That said, it\u2019s still entertaining the possibility of jumping on the tall phone ship for future devices.\n\nThe company has already been on the anti-headphone jack train for a little bit. The Ultra found the company planting its flag on that beach. \u201cThe headphone jack is going away,\u201d Newby-House told me matter-of-factly. \u201cLet\u2019s just get on with it.\u201d Of course, not everyone concurs, and other companies haven\u2019t aligned themselves with Apple as quickly as many analysts expected. Even Motorola, which joined the part with the Moto Z, appears as if it\u2019s regretting that move.\n\nThat said, the company is still committed as ever to audio -- a welcome change from most companies, for whom audio is a fifth- or sixth-tier priority. The phone features a new version BoomSound, one of the better audio systems presently on handsets -- though, weirdly, the company opted against dual front-facing speakers in order to accommodate a fingerprint sensor, even as more and more companies are moving biometrics to the back of the device. The phone also ships with company\u2019s proprietary USonic earbuds, which sport active noise canceling.\n\n\n\nThe most interesting piece of the audio puzzle, however, is the fact that there are four microphones in the handset. This is largely based on a newfound interest in other people\u2019s smart assistants (though it\u2019s got some positive implication for video recording, as well). HTC has worked directly with Qualcomm to design a device capable of responding to two different wake words for two different assistants -- neither of which are the in-house one it announced along with the Ultra.\n\nInstead, the company is embracing both Assistant and Alexa. The company says it sees advantages to both and doesn\u2019t want to play favorites. Fair enough. There\u2019s certainly a lot to be said for putting the ultimate decision in the hands of the user. That said, this doesn\u2019t seem to bode well for the company\u2019s faith in its own Sense Companion. And while it says this doesn\u2019t preclude it from going full-on Bixby in the future, it currently views its own play as more of a supplement to Assistant and Alexa.\n\n\u201cWe\u2019ve never envisioned Companion as a wake word-type assistant,\u201d says Newby-House. The company is more focused on using it to enhance its own software offerings, likely because it simply isn\u2019t robust enough to be considered a standalone. That said, the company\u2019s getting pretty close to a shit-or-get-off-the-pot moment here. The whole idea of a smart assistant has created a single unified experience -- having an assistant designed to work with other assistants kind of flies in the face of all of that.\n\n\n\nOh, and Alexa isn\u2019t shipping with the device out of the box. The company says the functionality should arrive within a month. This is kind of par for the course, at this point. Huawei ran up against a similar roadblock. Part of the issue is the fact that companies have to work directly with Amazon to customize the experience. When it does arrive, it will be in the form of an over-the-air update. It will also be in the box for devices later.\n\nWhen that functionality does arrive, however, it will bring more traditional functionality. Calling, texting and the like will come down the road.\n\n&nbsp;","datePublished":"2017-05-16T07:01:58+00:00","mainEntityOfPage":"True","image":{"@list":["https:\/\/tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com\/2017\/05\/dsc_0229.jpg","https:\/\/tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com\/2017\/05\/dsc_0242.jpg","https:\/\/tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com\/2017\/05\/dsc_0250.jpg","https:\/\/tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com\/2017\/05\/dsc_0235.jpg","https:\/\/tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com\/2017\/05\/dsc_0254.jpg"]},"speakable":{"@type":"SpeakableSpecification","cssSelector":[".alpha","#speakable-summary"]}}	</script>

			a.src=src;var b=document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];b.parentNode.insertBefore(a,b)})("https://dashboard.tinypass.com/xbuilder/experience/load?aid=Fy7FpgyUxA");

  <script>
			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
				// Get all existing values from the cookie
				var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
				// Set the value
				cookieValue[name] = value;

				// Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
				var d = new Date();
				d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
				var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();


									var domain = 'techcrunch.com';
				
				// Write the cookie value
				document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=."+domain;
			}

						

			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
			    // Get all existing values from the cookie
			    var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
			    // Set the value
			    cookieValue[name] = value;

			    // Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
			    var d = new Date();
			    d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
			    var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();

			    // Write the cookie value
			    document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=.tcpreprod.com";
			}

			/**
			 * Read values from cookie and convert them from json
			 * @param specificName (optional) Name specific value from the set
			 * @returns {*} If specificName is specified - returns single value, otherwise returns JSON object with all values
			 */
			function pianoReadCustomVariableCookie(specificName) {
			    var cookieValue;
			    try {
			        // Try to get the cookie value with regexp
			        var match = document.cookie.match(new RegExp('(^| )__pcvc=([^;]+)'));
			        if (match) {
			            // If cookie with this name was found - try to parse the JSON value
			            cookieValue = JSON.parse(match[2]);
			        }
			    }
			    catch (e) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (!cookieValue) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (typeof specificName != "undefined") {
			        // Get the specific value from the set
			        if (typeof cookieValue[specificName] != "undefined") {
			            return cookieValue[specificName];
			        }
			        return null;
			    }
			    return cookieValue;
			}

			/**
			 * Function to send data upstream to Piano template
			 * @param iframeId - Element id of the Piano iframe
			 * @param success - true/false. Status of the message
			 * @param message - Error message text
			 * @param object - Additional data, like the the field that triggered the error
			 */
			function sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, success, message, object) {
			    var iframe = jQuery('#' + iframeId);

			    if (iframe.length) {
			        iframe[0].contentWindow.postMessage({
			            piano: {
			                success: success,
			                message: message,
			                object: object
			            }
			        }, '*');
			    }
			}

			tp = window.tp || [];

			tp.push(["addHandler", "customEvent", function (event, b, c, d) {
			    switch (event.eventName) {
			        // Don't show me this again
			        case 'dont-show':
			            pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('dontshow', 'y');
			            tp.offer.close();
			            break;

			        case 'tc-signup-newsletters':
			            console.log(event);
			            var email = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.email != 'undefined') && (event.params.email.length > 0)) {
			                email = event.params.email;
			            }

			            var object = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.object != 'undefined') && (event.params.object.length > 0)) {
			                object = event.params.object;
			            }

			            var list = [];
			            if ((typeof event.params.list != 'undefined') && (event.params.list.length > 0)) {
			                list = JSON.parse(event.params.list);
			            }

			            var iframeId;

			            // We are parsing the params object sent from the template to find out which iframe triggered it
			            params = JSON.parse(event.params.params);
			            // And here's the iframeId we're looking for
			            iframeId = params.iframeId;

			            //grab the security string from the from the form
			            //on the page, needed for check in the backend
			            var $form = jQuery('.form-newsletters');
			            var url = '/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php';
			            var nonce = $form.data('nonce');


			            if (email == undefined || email == '') {
			                return;
			            }

			            var emailLists = [];
			            for (var i in list){
			                if (list[i]){
			                    emailLists.push(i);
			                }
			            }

			            var jqxhr = jQuery.get(url, {
			                action: "newsletters",
			                subaction: "subscribe",
			                email_lists: emailLists,
			                email: email,
			                tracking_id: event.params.tracking_id,
			                security: nonce
			            }, function (data) {
			                if (!data.success){
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, false, data.data.message, object)
			                }
			                else{
			                    // When the email was added - set the cookie
			                    pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('newsletter', 'y');
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, true, "");
			                }
			            });
			            break;
			    }
			}]);

			// Read all values from cookie
			var cookieValues = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();

			for (var i in cookieValues) {
			    // Set custom variables from cookie
			    tp.push(['setCustomVariable', i, cookieValues[i]]);
			}



		</script>

  <meta class="swiftype" name="timestamp" data-type="date" content="2017-05-15 22:01:01"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="content" data-type="text" content="French startup Talent.io is turning headhunting into a marketplace by connecting promising engineers with tech companies. The company just raised $8.8 million (€8 million) from existing investors Alven Capital and Ventech. While Talent.io started with Paris, the company is now operating in other major European cities, such as Berlin and London. The startup acquired Webcrowd and Go Digital in order to do this. Engineers sign up when they’re ready to get a new job. Talent.io is going to screen them to keep the most legit candidates. Then, tech companies receive an email every week with new candidates. Those companies can start a conversation with those candidates. After a month, candidates who didn’t find a new job are removed from the platform. Talent.io helps you find full-time employees, freelancers and even interns. So far, Talent.io has attracted 2,000 tech companies, with most of them in Paris — 200 companies in London and 200 companies in Berlin rely on Talent.io for…">

While Talent.io started with Paris, the company is now operating in other major European cities, such as Berlin and London. The startup acquired Webcrowd and Go Digital in…">

	var setAdblockerCookie = function(adblocker) {
	    var d = new Date();
	    d.setTime(d.getTime() + 60 * 60 * 24 * 30 * 1000);
	    document.cookie = "__adblocker=" + (adblocker ? "true" : "false") + "; expires=" + d.toUTCString() + "; path=/";
	}
	var script = document.createElement("script");
	script.setAttribute("async", true);
	script.setAttribute("src", "//www.npttech.com/advertising.js");
	script.setAttribute("onerror", "setAdblockerCookie(true);");
	script.setAttribute("onload", "setAdblockerCookie(false);");
	document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(script);
</script>

             <li id="menu-item-899745" class="menu-item menu-item-type-taxonomy menu-item-object-category current-post-ancestor current-menu-parent current-post-parent menu-item-899745"><a href="https://techcrunch.com/startups/">Startups</a></li>

       <h2>Hi!</h2>

        <div class="fb-send-to-messenger" id="fb-send-to-messenger" messenger_app_id="1678638095724206" page_id="8062627951" color="blue" size="large" data-ref="tcnav"></div> 
        <script>
		  window.fbAsyncInit = function() {
		    FB.init({
		      appId      : '1678638095724206',
		      xfbml      : true,
		      version    : 'v2.6'
		    });
			FB.Event.subscribe('xfbml.render', function() {
				jQuery('.fb-messenger-loading').detach()
			});
		  };

		  (function(d, s, id){
		     var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
		     if (d.getElementById(id)) {return;}
		     js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id;
		     js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_US/sdk.js";
		     fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
		   }(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));

		   function getCookie(name) {
		      var matches = document.cookie.match(new RegExp(
		        "(?:^|; )" + name.replace(/([\.$?*|{}\(\)\[\]\\\/\+^])/g, '\\$1') + "=([^;]*)"
		      ));
		      return matches ? decodeURIComponent(matches[1]) : undefined;
		   }

		   window.onload = function() {
		     var gravity_guid = getCookie('grvinsights');
		     var btn = document.getElementById('fb-send-to-messenger');
		     if (btn != undefined && btn != null) {
			   btn.setAttribute('data-ref', gravity_guid)
			 }
		   }

		</script>

              <a class="block-wrapper" href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/04/30/tempow-turns-your-dumb-bluetooth-speakers-into-a-connected-sound-system/"> <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/04/tempow.png?w=150" alt="Tempow turns your dumb Bluetooth speakers into a connected sound&nbsp;system">

        <!-- End: Article Eyebrows --> 
        <h1 class="alpha tweet-title">Talent.io grabs $8.8 million for its recruitment platform</h1> 
        <div class="title-left"> 
         <div class="byline">
           Posted 
          <time datetime="2017-05-15" class="timestamp">3 hours ago</time> by 
          <a href="/author/romain-dillet/" title="Posts by Romain Dillet" onclick="s_objectID='river_author';" rel="author">Romain Dillet</a> 
          <span class="twitter-handle">(<a href="https://twitter.com/romaindillet" rel="external">@romaindillet</a>)</span>
         </div> 
         <!-- Begin: Social Share Icons --> 
         <div class="social-share social-share-inline"> 
          <ul class="inline-list social-share-list" id="social-share" data-permalink="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/talentio-grabs-88-million-for-its-recruitment-platform/" data-shortlink="http://tcrn.ch/2qmgs2y" data-sharetitle="Talent.io grabs $8.8 million for its recruitment&nbsp;platform" data-post-id="1490135" data-twitter-hash=""> 
           <li class="total-shares"> <h5 class="total-shares-count">0</h5><br> <small>SHARES</small> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#comments" rel="external" class="comment icon-comment launch-social-load"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="facebook icon-facebook"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="twitter icon-twitter"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="linkedin icon-linkedin"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="google-plus icon-google-plus"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="reddit icon-reddit"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="stumbleupon icon-stumbleupon"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="email icon-email"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="flipboard icon-flipboard"></a> </li> 
          </ul> 
         </div> 
         <div class="social-share social-share-fixed"> 
          <div class="less"> 
           <a class="blank"></a> 
           <a class="icon-flipboard" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-stumbleupon" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-reddit" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-email" href="#"></a> 
          </div> 
          <div class="shown">

           <a class="icon-email" href="#"></a> 
          </div> 
         </div> 
         <!-- End: Social Share Icons --> 
        </div> 
        <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/docusign-confirms-customer-emails-were-stolen-and-used-in-phishing-campaign/" class="next-link" data-omni-sm="art_nextstory"> 
         <div class="next-story-link">
          Next Story
         </div> 
         <div class="next-story-full"> 
          <h4 class="next-title">DocuSign confirms customer emails were stolen and used in phishing&nbsp;campaign</h4> 
         </div> </a> 
       </header> 
       <!-- End: Article Header --> 
       <!-- Begin: Article Body --> 
       <div class="l-two-col"> 
        <!-- Begin: Article Body - Main --> 
        <div class="l-main-container"> 
         <div class="l-main"> 
          <div class="article-entry text"> 
           <!-- Begin: Wordpress Article Content --> 
           <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2014/08/old-school-resume.jpg?w=738" class=""> 
           <p id="speakable-summary">French startup <a target="_blank" href="https://www.talent.io">Talent.io</a> is turning headhunting into a marketplace by connecting promising engineers with tech companies. The company just raised $8.8 million (€8 million) from existing investors <a target="_blank" href="https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/alven-capital">Alven Capital</a> and <a target="_blank" href="https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/ventech-capital">Ventech</a>.</p> 
           <p>While Talent.io started with Paris, the company is now operating in other major European cities, such as Berlin and London. The startup acquired Webcrowd and Go Digital in order to do this.</p> 
           <p>Engineers sign up when they’re ready to get a new job. Talent.io is going to screen them to keep the most legit candidates. Then, tech companies receive an email every week with new candidates. Those companies can start a conversation with those candidates.</p> 
           <p>After a month, candidates who didn’t find a new job are removed from the platform. Talent.io helps you find full-time employees, freelancers and even interns.</p>
           <div>
            <div id="adsDivd213bae967" class="native-ad-mobile"></div>
           </div> 
           <p>So far, Talent.io has attracted 2,000 tech companies, with most of them in Paris — 200 companies in London and 200 companies in Berlin rely on Talent.io for now. Around 25 percent of candidates find a new job thanks to the startup.</p> 
           <p>The selection process for candidates is probably the main differentiating factor. If tech companies trust Talent.io that they only select valuable candidates, then you’re going to use it again and again. While 4,500 people sign up every month, only 400 of them get selected. With today’s funding round, Talent.io wants to multiply these numbers by 10.</p> 
           <p>Recruiting startups are not my favorite kind of startups. It feels like they create more turnover and have too big an impact on the job market. And yet, to be fair, recruitment is a lucrative industry. Tech companies spend thousands and thousands of dollars every year on recruitment. And it’s clear that Talent.io plans to take advantage of that.</p> 
           <!-- End: Wordpress Article Content --> 
          </div> 
          <div id="social-after-wrapper" class="cf social-share social-share-inline"> 
           <ul class="inline-list social-share-list" id="social-after" data-permalink="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/talentio-grabs-88-million-for-its-recruitment-platform/" data-shortlink="http://tcrn.ch/2qmgs2y" data-sharetitle="Talent.io grabs $8.8 million for its recruitment&nbsp;platform" data-post-id="1490135"> 
            <li class="total-shares"> <h5 class="total-shares-count">0</h5><br> <small>SHARES</small> </li>

         <div class="mobile-module-list-image">

          <h4>WeWork’s Adam Neumann on how to hit $1B in revenue with a careful&nbsp;balance</h4>

  <script type="application/ld+json">
		{"@context":"http:\/\/schema.org","@type":"Article","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2017\/05\/15\/talentio-grabs-88-million-for-its-recruitment-platform\/","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Romain Dillet"},"headline":"Talent.io grabs $8.8 million for its","articleBody":"French startup Talent.io is turning headhunting into a marketplace by connecting promising engineers with tech companies. The company just raised $8.8 million (\u20ac8 million) from existing investors Alven Capital and Ventech.\n\nWhile Talent.io started with Paris, the company is now operating in other major European cities, such as Berlin and London. The startup acquired Webcrowd and Go Digital in order to do this.\n\nEngineers sign up when they\u2019re ready to get a new job. Talent.io is going to screen them to keep the most legit candidates. Then, tech companies receive an email every week with new candidates. Those companies can start a conversation with those candidates.\n\nAfter a month, candidates who didn\u2019t find a new job are removed from the platform. Talent.io helps you find full-time employees, freelancers and even interns.\n\nSo far, Talent.io has attracted 2,000 tech companies, with most of them in Paris \u2014 200 companies in London and 200 companies in Berlin rely on Talent.io for now. Around 25 percent of candidates find a new job thanks to the startup.\n\nThe selection process for candidates is probably the main differentiating factor. If tech companies trust Talent.io that they only select valuable candidates, then you\u2019re going to use it again and again. While 4,500 people sign up every month, only 400 of them get selected. With today\u2019s funding round, Talent.io wants to multiply these numbers by 10.\n\nRecruiting startups are not my favorite kind of startups. It feels like they create more turnover and have too big an impact on the job market. And yet, to be fair, recruitment is a lucrative industry. Tech companies spend thousands and thousands of dollars every year on recruitment. And it\u2019s clear that Talent.io plans to take advantage of that.","datePublished":"2017-05-16T05:01:01+00:00","mainEntityOfPage":"True","image":{"@list":["https:\/\/tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com\/2014\/08\/old-school-resume.jpg"]},"speakable":{"@type":"SpeakableSpecification","cssSelector":[".alpha","#speakable-summary"]}}	</script>

  <script>
	//append functionality to omniture object
	//method provided by adobe : https://marketing.adobe.com/resources/help/en_US/sc/implement/getVisitNum.html
	/*                                                                 
	* Plugin: getVisitNum - version 3.0
	*/
	var s = window.s_265;
	window.s_265.getVisitNum=new Function("tp","c","c2",""
	+"var s=this,e=new Date,cval,cvisit,ct=e.getTime(),d;if(!tp){tp='m';}"
	+"if(tp=='m'||tp=='w'||tp=='d'){eo=s.endof(tp),y=eo.getTime();e.setTi"
	+"me(y);}else {d=tp*86400000;e.setTime(ct+d);}if(!c){c='s_vnum';}if(!"
	+"c2){c2='s_invisit';}cval=s.c_r(c);if(cval){var i=cval.indexOf('&vn="
	+"'),str=cval.substring(i+4,cval.length),k;}cvisit=s.c_r(c2);if(cvisi"
	+"t){if(str){e.setTime(ct+1800000);s.c_w(c2,'true',e);return str;}els"
	+"e {return 'unknown visit number';}}else {if(str){str++;k=cval.substri"
	+"ng(0,i);e.setTime(k);s.c_w(c,k+'&vn='+str,e);e.setTime(ct+1800000);"
	+"s.c_w(c2,'true',e);return str;}else {s.c_w(c,e.getTime()+'&vn=1',e)"
	+";e.setTime(ct+1800000);s.c_w(c2,'true',e);return 1;}}");
	s.dimo=new Function("m","y",""
	+"var d=new Date(y,m+1,0);return d.getDate();");
	s.endof=new Function("x",""
	+"var t=new Date;t.setHours(0);t.setMinutes(0);t.setSeconds(0);if(x=="
	+"'m'){d=s.dimo(t.getMonth(),t.getFullYear())-t.getDate()+1;}else if("
	+"x=='w'){d=7-t.getDay();}else {d=1;}t.setDate(t.getDate()+d);return "
	+"t;");
</script>

		function addLoadEvent(func) {
			var oldonload = window.onload;
			if (typeof window.onload != 'function') {
				window.onload = func;
			} else {
				window.onload = function () {
					oldonload();
					func();
				}
			}
		}

  <script>
			(function(src){var a=document.createElement("script");a.type="text/javascript";a.async=true;
			a.src=src;var b=document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];b.parentNode.insertBefore(a,b)})("https://dashboard.tinypass.com/xbuilder/experience/load?aid=Fy7FpgyUxA");
