  <script>
			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
				// Get all existing values from the cookie
				var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
				// Set the value
				cookieValue[name] = value;

				// Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
				var d = new Date();
				d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
				var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();


									var domain = 'techcrunch.com';
				
				// Write the cookie value
				document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=."+domain;
			}

						

			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
			    // Get all existing values from the cookie
			    var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
			    // Set the value
			    cookieValue[name] = value;

			    // Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
			    var d = new Date();
			    d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
			    var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();

			    // Write the cookie value
			    document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=.tcpreprod.com";
			}

			/**
			 * Read values from cookie and convert them from json
			 * @param specificName (optional) Name specific value from the set
			 * @returns {*} If specificName is specified - returns single value, otherwise returns JSON object with all values
			 */
			function pianoReadCustomVariableCookie(specificName) {
			    var cookieValue;
			    try {
			        // Try to get the cookie value with regexp
			        var match = document.cookie.match(new RegExp('(^| )__pcvc=([^;]+)'));
			        if (match) {
			            // If cookie with this name was found - try to parse the JSON value
			            cookieValue = JSON.parse(match[2]);
			        }
			    }
			    catch (e) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (!cookieValue) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (typeof specificName != "undefined") {
			        // Get the specific value from the set
			        if (typeof cookieValue[specificName] != "undefined") {
			            return cookieValue[specificName];
			        }
			        return null;
			    }
			    return cookieValue;
			}

			/**
			 * Function to send data upstream to Piano template
			 * @param iframeId - Element id of the Piano iframe
			 * @param success - true/false. Status of the message
			 * @param message - Error message text
			 * @param object - Additional data, like the the field that triggered the error
			 */
			function sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, success, message, object) {
			    var iframe = jQuery('#' + iframeId);

			    if (iframe.length) {
			        iframe[0].contentWindow.postMessage({
			            piano: {
			                success: success,
			                message: message,
			                object: object
			            }
			        }, '*');
			    }
			}

			tp = window.tp || [];

			tp.push(["addHandler", "customEvent", function (event, b, c, d) {
			    switch (event.eventName) {
			        // Don't show me this again
			        case 'dont-show':
			            pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('dontshow', 'y');
			            tp.offer.close();
			            break;

			        case 'tc-signup-newsletters':
			            console.log(event);
			            var email = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.email != 'undefined') && (event.params.email.length > 0)) {
			                email = event.params.email;
			            }

			            var object = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.object != 'undefined') && (event.params.object.length > 0)) {
			                object = event.params.object;
			            }

			            var list = [];
			            if ((typeof event.params.list != 'undefined') && (event.params.list.length > 0)) {
			                list = JSON.parse(event.params.list);
			            }

			            var iframeId;

			            // We are parsing the params object sent from the template to find out which iframe triggered it
			            params = JSON.parse(event.params.params);
			            // And here's the iframeId we're looking for
			            iframeId = params.iframeId;

			            //grab the security string from the from the form
			            //on the page, needed for check in the backend
			            var $form = jQuery('.form-newsletters');
			            var url = '/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php';
			            var nonce = $form.data('nonce');


			            if (email == undefined || email == '') {
			                return;
			            }

			            var emailLists = [];
			            for (var i in list){
			                if (list[i]){
			                    emailLists.push(i);
			                }
			            }

			            var jqxhr = jQuery.get(url, {
			                action: "newsletters",
			                subaction: "subscribe",
			                email_lists: emailLists,
			                email: email,
			                tracking_id: event.params.tracking_id,
			                security: nonce
			            }, function (data) {
			                if (!data.success){
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, false, data.data.message, object)
			                }
			                else{
			                    // When the email was added - set the cookie
			                    pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('newsletter', 'y');
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, true, "");
			                }
			            });
			            break;
			    }
			}]);

			// Read all values from cookie
			var cookieValues = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();

			for (var i in cookieValues) {
			    // Set custom variables from cookie
			    tp.push(['setCustomVariable', i, cookieValues[i]]);
			}



		</script> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="author" data-type="string" content="Catherine Shu"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="post_id" data-type="integer" content="1490876"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="title" data-type="string" content="DocuSign confirms customer emails were stolen and used in phishing campaign"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="object_type" data-type="string" content="post"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="url" data-type="enum" content="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/docusign-confirms-customer-emails-were-stolen-and-used-in-phishing-campaign/"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="timestamp" data-type="date" content="2017-05-15 21:50:37"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="content" data-type="text" content="DocuSign, the owner of eSignature, one of the most popular digital&nbsp;signature services, said today that a database of customer emails was breached and used in a phishing campaign that began last week. The phishing emails were designed&nbsp;to look like they were sent by&nbsp;DocuSign and had subject&nbsp;lines that said &quot;Completed: [domain name]&nbsp; – Wire transfer for recipient-name Document Ready for Signature&quot; or&nbsp;&quot;Completed [domain name/email address] – Accounting Invoice [Number] Document Ready for Signature.&quot; Word Document attachments in the emails installed malware if opened. The company began tracking the phishing campaign on its security site on May 9, though it was not until today that it confirmed its email list had been stolen. In today's post, DocuSign said its eSignature service, envelopes, and customer documents remain secure, but that hackers were able to access customer emails through a &quot;non-core&quot; system that the company uses to send service-related announcements. DocuSign…">

       <div class="fb-messenger-loading"></div> 
       <div class="fb-messenger-iframe"> 
        <div class="fb-send-to-messenger" id="fb-send-to-messenger" messenger_app_id="1678638095724206" page_id="8062627951" color="blue" size="large" data-ref="tcnav"></div> 
        <script>
		  window.fbAsyncInit = function() {
		    FB.init({
		      appId      : '1678638095724206',
		      xfbml      : true,
		      version    : 'v2.6'
		    });
			FB.Event.subscribe('xfbml.render', function() {
				jQuery('.fb-messenger-loading').detach()
			});
		  };

		  (function(d, s, id){
		     var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
		     if (d.getElementById(id)) {return;}
		     js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id;
		     js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_US/sdk.js";
		     fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
		   }(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));

		   function getCookie(name) {
		      var matches = document.cookie.match(new RegExp(
		        "(?:^|; )" + name.replace(/([\.$?*|{}\(\)\[\]\\\/\+^])/g, '\\$1') + "=([^;]*)"
		      ));
		      return matches ? decodeURIComponent(matches[1]) : undefined;
		   }

		   window.onload = function() {
		     var gravity_guid = getCookie('grvinsights');
		     var btn = document.getElementById('fb-send-to-messenger');
		     if (btn != undefined && btn != null) {
			   btn.setAttribute('data-ref', gravity_guid)
			 }
		   }

		</script> 
       </div> 
      </div> 
     </div> 
    </div>

   </div>

        <h1 class="alpha tweet-title">DocuSign confirms customer emails were stolen and used in phishing campaign</h1> 
        <div class="title-left"> 
         <div class="byline">
           Posted 
          <time datetime="2017-05-15" class="timestamp">3 hours ago</time> by 
          <a href="/author/catherine-shu/" title="Posts by Catherine Shu" onclick="s_objectID='river_author';" rel="author">Catherine Shu</a> 
          <span class="twitter-handle">(<a href="https://twitter.com/catherineshu" rel="external">@catherineshu</a>)</span>
         </div> 
         <!-- Begin: Social Share Icons --> 
         <div class="social-share social-share-inline"> 
          <ul class="inline-list social-share-list" id="social-share" data-permalink="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/docusign-confirms-customer-emails-were-stolen-and-used-in-phishing-campaign/" data-shortlink="http://tcrn.ch/2qm7ana" data-sharetitle="DocuSign confirms customer emails were stolen and used in phishing&nbsp;campaign" data-post-id="1490876" data-twitter-hash=""> 
           <li class="total-shares"> <h5 class="total-shares-count">0</h5><br> <small>SHARES</small> </li>

        </div> 
        <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/crunch-report-lyft-and-waymo-partner-up-on-self-driving-cars/" class="next-link" data-omni-sm="art_nextstory"> 
         <div class="next-story-link">
          Next Story
         </div> 
         <div class="next-story-full"> 
          <h4 class="next-title">Crunch Report | Lyft and Waymo Partner Up on Self-Driving&nbsp;Cars</h4> 
         </div> </a> 
       </header> 
       <!-- End: Article Header --> 
       <!-- Begin: Article Body --> 
       <div class="l-two-col"> 
        <!-- Begin: Article Body - Main --> 
        <div class="l-main-container"> 
         <div class="l-main"> 
          <div class="article-entry text"> 
           <!-- Begin: Wordpress Article Content --> 
           <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/gettyimages-691111159.jpg?w=738" class=""> 
           <p id="speakable-summary"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.docusign.com/">DocuSign</a>, the owner of eSignature, one of the most popular digital&nbsp;signature services, <a target="_blank" href="https://trust.docusign.com/en-us/personal-safeguards/">said today that a database of customer emails was breached and used in a phishing campaign that began last week</a>.</p> 
           <p>The phishing emails were designed&nbsp;to look like they were sent by&nbsp;DocuSign and had subject&nbsp;lines that said “Completed: [domain name]&nbsp; – Wire transfer for recipient-name Document Ready for Signature” or&nbsp;“Completed [domain name/email address] – Accounting Invoice [Number] Document Ready for Signature.” Word Document attachments in the emails installed malware if opened.</p> 
           <p>The company began tracking the phishing campaign on its <a target="_blank" href="https://trust.docusign.com">security site </a>on May 9, though it was not until today that it confirmed its email list had been stolen.</p>
           <div>
            <div id="adsDivacc5b65879" class="native-ad-mobile"></div>
           </div> 
           <p>In today’s post, DocuSign said its eSignature service, envelopes, and customer documents remain secure, but that hackers were able to access customer emails through a “non-core” system that the company uses to send service-related announcements. DocuSign added that only emails were stolen&nbsp;and other sensitive information, including names, physical addresses, passwords, social security numbers, credit card data, and documents sent through the eSignature system, were not accessed.</p> 
           <p>DocuSign said it has&nbsp;put more security measures in place and contacted law enforcement agencies. It listed several steps customers should take to protect themselves, including forwarding suspicious emails to spam@docusign.com before deleting them from their computers, updating anti-virus software, and <a target="_blank" href="https://trust.docusign.com/static/downloads/Combating_Phishing_WP_05082017.pdf">reading DocuSign’s white paper on phishing</a>.</p> 
           <!-- End: Wordpress Article Content --> 
           <small>Featured Image: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.gettyimages.com/search/photographer?family=creative&amp;photographer=rolfobrennereyeem&amp;excludenudity=true&amp;sort=best#license">Rolfo Brenner/EyeEm</a>/Getty Images</small> 
          </div> 
          <div id="social-after-wrapper" class="cf social-share social-share-inline"> 
           <ul class="inline-list social-share-list" id="social-after" data-permalink="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/docusign-confirms-customer-emails-were-stolen-and-used-in-phishing-campaign/" data-shortlink="http://tcrn.ch/2qm7ana" data-sharetitle="DocuSign confirms customer emails were stolen and used in phishing&nbsp;campaign" data-post-id="1490876"> 
            <li class="total-shares"> <h5 class="total-shares-count">0</h5><br> <small>SHARES</small> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="facebook icon-facebook"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="twitter icon-twitter"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="linkedin icon-linkedin"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="google-plus icon-google-plus"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="stumbleupon icon-stumbleupon"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="reddit icon-reddit"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="flipboard icon-flipboard"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="email icon-email"></a> </li> 
           </ul> 
          </div> 
          <div id="grv-personalization-56"></div>

           <div id="adsDiv6f1d13e0a4" class=""></div> 
           <script>
/* <![CDATA[ */
if (!ads.isMobile()) {
	(function(window,$){
		window.TechCrunch.loader.on('tc_ads_wrapper_omniture', function(){
			if ( !window.ads.isAdPageSet ){
				if ( typeof window.adSetAdURL == 'function' ) {
					window.adSetAdURL('/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/_uac/adpage.html');

				}
				if ( typeof window.adsResizePortrait === 'function' ) {
					window.adsResizePortrait('1');
				}
				window.console.log('ADS WIDTH:');
				window.console.log(ads);
			}
			window.adSetOthAT('kventryid=1490876;kvcmsid=tcr:1490876;kvugc=0;kvsubj=978794:980487:980524:982665:983462:6375569:980533:6373766:6359463:979432:983515:6325647:983052:978919:979796:981523:981525:984055;kvent=4963914:3689767');
			window.htmlAdWH('93484979', "250", "125", 'f', 'adsDiv6f1d13e0a4');
		});
	}(this,this.jQuery));
}
/* ]]> */
</script>
          </div>

		window.TechCrunch.loader.on('tc_ads_wrapper_omniture', function(){
			if ( !window.ads.isAdPageSet ){
				if ( typeof window.adSetAdURL == 'function' ) {
					window.adSetAdURL('/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/_uac/adpage.html');
					window.ads.isAdPageSet = true;
				}
				if ( typeof window.adsResizePortrait === 'function' ) {
					window.adsResizePortrait('1');
				}
				window.console.log('ADS WIDTH:');
				window.console.log(ads);
			}
			window.adSetOthAT('kventryid=1490876;kvcmsid=tcr:1490876;kvugc=0;kvsubj=978794:980487:980524:982665:983462:6375569:980533:6373766:6359463:979432:983515:6325647:983052:978919:979796:981523:981525:984055;kvent=4963914:3689767');
			window.adSetInView('1');
			window.htmlAdWH('93484973', "mm", "mm", 'f', 'adsDivd413bf0405');
		});
	}(this,this.jQuery));
}
/* ]]> */
</script>
     </div> 
    </div> 
   </div>

  <script type="application/ld+json">
		{"@context":"http:\/\/schema.org","@type":"Article","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2017\/05\/15\/docusign-confirms-customer-emails-were-stolen-and-used-in-phishing-campaign\/","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Catherine Shu"},"headline":"DocuSign confirms security breach","articleBody":"DocuSign, the owner of eSignature, one of the most popular digital\u00a0signature services, said today that a database of customer emails was breached and used in a phishing campaign that began last week.\n\nThe phishing emails were designed\u00a0to look like they were sent by\u00a0DocuSign and had subject\u00a0lines that said \"Completed: [domain name]\u00a0 \u2013 Wire transfer for recipient-name Document Ready for Signature\" or\u00a0\"Completed [domain name\/email address] \u2013 Accounting Invoice [Number] Document Ready for Signature.\" Word Document attachments in the emails installed malware if opened.\n\nThe company began tracking the phishing campaign on its security site on May 9, though it was not until today that it confirmed its email list had been stolen.\n\nIn today's post, DocuSign said its eSignature service, envelopes, and customer documents remain secure, but that hackers were able to access customer emails through a \"non-core\" system that the company uses to send service-related announcements. DocuSign added that only emails were stolen\u00a0and other sensitive information, including names, physical addresses, passwords, social security numbers, credit card data, and documents sent through the eSignature system, were not accessed.\n\nDocuSign said it has\u00a0put more security measures in place and contacted law enforcement agencies. It listed several steps customers should take to protect themselves, including forwarding suspicious emails to spam@docusign.com before deleting them from their computers, updating anti-virus software, and reading DocuSign's white paper on phishing.","datePublished":"2017-05-16T04:50:37+00:00","mainEntityOfPage":"True","image":{"@list":["https:\/\/tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com\/2017\/05\/gettyimages-691111159.jpg"]},"speakable":{"@type":"SpeakableSpecification","cssSelector":[".alpha","#speakable-summary"]}}	</script>

		/* <![CDATA[ */
		function addLoadEvent(func) {
			var oldonload = window.onload;
			if (typeof window.onload != 'function') {
				window.onload = func;
			} else {
				window.onload = function () {
					oldonload();
					func();
				}
			}
		}
		/* ]]> */
	</script>

			a.src=src;var b=document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];b.parentNode.insertBefore(a,b)})("https://dashboard.tinypass.com/xbuilder/experience/load?aid=Fy7FpgyUxA");

  <script>
			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
				// Get all existing values from the cookie
				var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
				// Set the value
				cookieValue[name] = value;

				// Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
				var d = new Date();
				d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
				var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();


									var domain = 'techcrunch.com';
				
				// Write the cookie value
				document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=."+domain;
			}

						

			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
			    // Get all existing values from the cookie
			    var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
			    // Set the value
			    cookieValue[name] = value;

			    // Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
			    var d = new Date();
			    d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
			    var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();

			    // Write the cookie value
			    document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=.tcpreprod.com";
			}

			/**
			 * Read values from cookie and convert them from json
			 * @param specificName (optional) Name specific value from the set
			 * @returns {*} If specificName is specified - returns single value, otherwise returns JSON object with all values
			 */
			function pianoReadCustomVariableCookie(specificName) {
			    var cookieValue;
			    try {
			        // Try to get the cookie value with regexp
			        var match = document.cookie.match(new RegExp('(^| )__pcvc=([^;]+)'));
			        if (match) {
			            // If cookie with this name was found - try to parse the JSON value
			            cookieValue = JSON.parse(match[2]);
			        }
			    }
			    catch (e) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (!cookieValue) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (typeof specificName != "undefined") {
			        // Get the specific value from the set
			        if (typeof cookieValue[specificName] != "undefined") {
			            return cookieValue[specificName];
			        }
			        return null;
			    }
			    return cookieValue;
			}

			/**
			 * Function to send data upstream to Piano template
			 * @param iframeId - Element id of the Piano iframe
			 * @param success - true/false. Status of the message
			 * @param message - Error message text
			 * @param object - Additional data, like the the field that triggered the error
			 */
			function sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, success, message, object) {
			    var iframe = jQuery('#' + iframeId);

			    if (iframe.length) {
			        iframe[0].contentWindow.postMessage({
			            piano: {
			                success: success,
			                message: message,
			                object: object
			            }
			        }, '*');
			    }
			}

			tp = window.tp || [];

			tp.push(["addHandler", "customEvent", function (event, b, c, d) {
			    switch (event.eventName) {
			        // Don't show me this again
			        case 'dont-show':
			            pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('dontshow', 'y');
			            tp.offer.close();
			            break;

			        case 'tc-signup-newsletters':
			            console.log(event);
			            var email = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.email != 'undefined') && (event.params.email.length > 0)) {
			                email = event.params.email;
			            }

			            var object = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.object != 'undefined') && (event.params.object.length > 0)) {
			                object = event.params.object;
			            }

			            var list = [];
			            if ((typeof event.params.list != 'undefined') && (event.params.list.length > 0)) {
			                list = JSON.parse(event.params.list);
			            }

			            var iframeId;

			            // We are parsing the params object sent from the template to find out which iframe triggered it
			            params = JSON.parse(event.params.params);
			            // And here's the iframeId we're looking for
			            iframeId = params.iframeId;

			            //grab the security string from the from the form
			            //on the page, needed for check in the backend
			            var $form = jQuery('.form-newsletters');
			            var url = '/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php';
			            var nonce = $form.data('nonce');


			            if (email == undefined || email == '') {
			                return;
			            }

			            var emailLists = [];
			            for (var i in list){
			                if (list[i]){
			                    emailLists.push(i);
			                }
			            }

			            var jqxhr = jQuery.get(url, {
			                action: "newsletters",
			                subaction: "subscribe",
			                email_lists: emailLists,
			                email: email,
			                tracking_id: event.params.tracking_id,
			                security: nonce
			            }, function (data) {
			                if (!data.success){
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, false, data.data.message, object)
			                }
			                else{
			                    // When the email was added - set the cookie
			                    pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('newsletter', 'y');
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, true, "");
			                }
			            });
			            break;
			    }
			}]);

			// Read all values from cookie
			var cookieValues = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();

			for (var i in cookieValues) {
			    // Set custom variables from cookie
			    tp.push(['setCustomVariable', i, cookieValues[i]]);
			}



		</script>

  <script>
	var setAdblockerCookie = function(adblocker) {
	    var d = new Date();
	    d.setTime(d.getTime() + 60 * 60 * 24 * 30 * 1000);
	    document.cookie = "__adblocker=" + (adblocker ? "true" : "false") + "; expires=" + d.toUTCString() + "; path=/";
	}
	var script = document.createElement("script");
	script.setAttribute("async", true);
	script.setAttribute("src", "//www.npttech.com/advertising.js");
	script.setAttribute("onerror", "setAdblockerCookie(true);");
	script.setAttribute("onload", "setAdblockerCookie(false);");
	document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(script);
</script>

       <h2>Hi!</h2>

        <div class="fb-send-to-messenger" id="fb-send-to-messenger" messenger_app_id="1678638095724206" page_id="8062627951" color="blue" size="large" data-ref="tcnav"></div> 
        <script>
		  window.fbAsyncInit = function() {
		    FB.init({
		      appId      : '1678638095724206',
		      xfbml      : true,
		      version    : 'v2.6'
		    });
			FB.Event.subscribe('xfbml.render', function() {
				jQuery('.fb-messenger-loading').detach()
			});
		  };

		  (function(d, s, id){
		     var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
		     if (d.getElementById(id)) {return;}
		     js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id;
		     js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_US/sdk.js";
		     fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
		   }(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));

		   function getCookie(name) {
		      var matches = document.cookie.match(new RegExp(
		        "(?:^|; )" + name.replace(/([\.$?*|{}\(\)\[\]\\\/\+^])/g, '\\$1') + "=([^;]*)"
		      ));
		      return matches ? decodeURIComponent(matches[1]) : undefined;
		   }

		   window.onload = function() {
		     var gravity_guid = getCookie('grvinsights');
		     var btn = document.getElementById('fb-send-to-messenger');
		     if (btn != undefined && btn != null) {
			   btn.setAttribute('data-ref', gravity_guid)
			 }
		   }

		</script>

	(function(window,$){

			if ( !window.ads.isAdPageSet ){

     <div class="announcement_left"> 
      <a href="https://techcrunch.com/event-info/disrupt-ny-2017/#tickets" data-ga-event="click" data-ga-event-category="Marketing - Internal" data-ga-event-action="Announcement Bar" data-ga-event-label="DisruptNY"> <span class="announcement-text"> <span class="announcement-headline">Disrupt NY</span>The Excitement of Disrupt NY Begins Today <span class="announcement-link-text"> Pick Up Tickets Here <span class="icon-caret-right"></span> </span> </span> </a>

  <!-- Begin: Article Body Content - Main --> 
  <div role="main" class="fluid" style=""> 
   <!-- Begin: Article - Primary --> 
   <article class="article lc"> 
    <div class="l-two-col-expose"> 
     <!-- Begin: Article Content - Body Right Column --> 
     <div class="l-main-container"> 
      <div class="l-main"> 
       <!-- Begin: Article Header --> 
       <header class="article-header page-title"> 
        <!-- Begin: Article Eyebrows --> 
        <div class="tags"> 
         <div class="tag-item"> 
          <a href="https://techcrunch.com/tag/daily/" class="tag" data-omni-sm="art_articlecategory">daily</a> 
          <div class="links" id="tc-tag-item-daily"> 
           <ul class="recirc-river river-small g g-1-2-1"> 
            <li> 
             <div class="block-small"> 
              <a class="block-wrapper" href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/12/crunch-report-waymo-v-uber-is-going-to-trial/"> <img src="https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/assets/images/techcrunch.global.thumb-placeholder.png" alt="Crunch Report | Waymo v. Uber is going to&nbsp;trial"> 
               <div class="block-content"> 
                <h3>Crunch Report | Waymo v. Uber is going to&nbsp;trial</h3> 
                <div class="block-meta">

           <h2><strong>Today’s Stories&nbsp;</strong></h2> 
           <ol> 
            <li><a target="_blank" href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/14/lyft-and-waymo-to-team-up-on-self-driving-cars/" rel="noopener noreferrer">Lyft and Waymo to team up on self-driving cars amid Uber controversy</a></li> 
            <li>Crunch Report Original – Source:&nbsp;<a target="_blank" href="http://www.sfchronicle.com/bayarea/williesworld/article/The-man-President-Trump-fears-most-11144034.php">SF Chronicle&nbsp;</a> </li> 
            <li><a target="_blank" href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/13/apple-acquires-ai-company-lattice-data-a-specialist-in-unstructured-dark-data/" rel="noopener noreferrer">Apple acquires AI company Lattice Data, a specialist in unstructured ‘dark data’, for $200M</a></li> 
           </ol> 
           <h2><strong>Credits</strong></h2> 
           <p id="speakable-summary"><strong>Written by:</strong> Tito Hamze, John Mannes<br><strong>Edited &amp; Hosted by:</strong> Tito Hamze<br><strong>Filmed &amp; Teleprompter:</strong>&nbsp;Gregory Manalo</p>

           <h2><strong>Notes:</strong></h2> 
           <ul> 
            <li>I don’t know what to wear on Crunch Report (It’s a hard decision and I suck at dressing myself). If you are a startup and&nbsp;want to me to wear something mail me an<strong> XL</strong> T-shirt and I’ll wear it in an episode. I’m not going to mention the company on the shirt in the episode but it will be there. No offensive stuff, it’s totally at my discretion if I wear it.&nbsp;Mail it to me. Thanks &lt;3 Ok, bye.</li> 
           </ul>

          <h3 class="section-title collapse-title">Crunchbase</h3>

           <ul class="crunchbase-accordion"> 
            <!-- Begin: Crunchbase Card --> 
            <li class="data-card crunchbase-card active" data-crunchbase-url="https://crunchbase.com/organization/google-s-self-driving-car-project/"> <h4 class="card-title card-acc-handle"> <a class="cb-card-title-link" href="https://crunchbase.com/organization/google-s-self-driving-car-project/"> Waymo </a> </h4>

Waymo is determined to improve transportation for people around the world, building on software and sensor technology developed in Google’s labs since 2009. In October 2015, they achieved the world’s first fully self-driving trip …</span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Location</strong> <span class="value"> <a href="http://crunchbase.com/location/mountain-view/37bfe551197e02269a805d7bec8a50dd">Mountain View, CA</a> </span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Categories</strong> <span class="value"> <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/robotics/421943ef50aec811470ec66a0323cf0d">Robotics</a>, <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/sensor/6f5a43980331880365dec927ab8e5d20">Sensor</a>, <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/autonomous-vehicles/897af4838963a2ab16ff2b3489106f0e">Autonomous Vehicles</a>, <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/transportation/95642ff023e979a3612b50de99f06305">Transportation</a>, <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/automotive/bb2ad65f1009db81c6f683dbcfd64870">Automotive</a> </span> </li>

Lyft is a peer-to-peer transportation platform that connects passengers who need rides with drivers willing to provide rides using their own personal vehicles. Lyft was started in 2012 with the mission of building a peer-to-peer transportation solution that would help make cities safer, more affordable and better connected. Lyft now operates …</span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Location</strong> <span class="value"> <a href="http://crunchbase.com/location/san-francisco/528f5e3c90d111115d1c2e4ff979d58e">San Francisco, CA</a> </span> </li>

		function addLoadEvent(func) {
			var oldonload = window.onload;
			if (typeof window.onload != 'function') {
				window.onload = func;
			} else {
				window.onload = function () {
					oldonload();
					func();
				}
			}
		}

  <script>
			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
				// Get all existing values from the cookie
				var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
				// Set the value
				cookieValue[name] = value;

				// Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
				var d = new Date();
				d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
				var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();


									var domain = 'techcrunch.com';
				
				// Write the cookie value
				document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=."+domain;
			}

						

			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
			    // Get all existing values from the cookie
			    var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
			    // Set the value
			    cookieValue[name] = value;

			    // Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
			    var d = new Date();
			    d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
			    var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();

			    // Write the cookie value
			    document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=.tcpreprod.com";
			}

			/**
			 * Read values from cookie and convert them from json
			 * @param specificName (optional) Name specific value from the set
			 * @returns {*} If specificName is specified - returns single value, otherwise returns JSON object with all values
			 */
			function pianoReadCustomVariableCookie(specificName) {
			    var cookieValue;
			    try {
			        // Try to get the cookie value with regexp
			        var match = document.cookie.match(new RegExp('(^| )__pcvc=([^;]+)'));
			        if (match) {
			            // If cookie with this name was found - try to parse the JSON value
			            cookieValue = JSON.parse(match[2]);
			        }
			    }
			    catch (e) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (!cookieValue) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (typeof specificName != "undefined") {
			        // Get the specific value from the set
			        if (typeof cookieValue[specificName] != "undefined") {
			            return cookieValue[specificName];
			        }
			        return null;
			    }
			    return cookieValue;
			}

			/**
			 * Function to send data upstream to Piano template
			 * @param iframeId - Element id of the Piano iframe
			 * @param success - true/false. Status of the message
			 * @param message - Error message text
			 * @param object - Additional data, like the the field that triggered the error
			 */
			function sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, success, message, object) {
			    var iframe = jQuery('#' + iframeId);

			    if (iframe.length) {
			        iframe[0].contentWindow.postMessage({
			            piano: {
			                success: success,
			                message: message,
			                object: object
			            }
			        }, '*');
			    }
			}

			tp = window.tp || [];

			tp.push(["addHandler", "customEvent", function (event, b, c, d) {
			    switch (event.eventName) {
			        // Don't show me this again
			        case 'dont-show':
			            pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('dontshow', 'y');
			            tp.offer.close();
			            break;

			        case 'tc-signup-newsletters':
			            console.log(event);
			            var email = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.email != 'undefined') && (event.params.email.length > 0)) {
			                email = event.params.email;
			            }

			            var object = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.object != 'undefined') && (event.params.object.length > 0)) {
			                object = event.params.object;
			            }

			            var list = [];
			            if ((typeof event.params.list != 'undefined') && (event.params.list.length > 0)) {
			                list = JSON.parse(event.params.list);
			            }

			            var iframeId;

			            // We are parsing the params object sent from the template to find out which iframe triggered it
			            params = JSON.parse(event.params.params);
			            // And here's the iframeId we're looking for
			            iframeId = params.iframeId;

			            //grab the security string from the from the form
			            //on the page, needed for check in the backend
			            var $form = jQuery('.form-newsletters');
			            var url = '/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php';
			            var nonce = $form.data('nonce');


			            if (email == undefined || email == '') {
			                return;
			            }

			            var emailLists = [];
			            for (var i in list){
			                if (list[i]){
			                    emailLists.push(i);
			                }
			            }

			            var jqxhr = jQuery.get(url, {
			                action: "newsletters",
			                subaction: "subscribe",
			                email_lists: emailLists,
			                email: email,
			                tracking_id: event.params.tracking_id,
			                security: nonce
			            }, function (data) {
			                if (!data.success){
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, false, data.data.message, object)
			                }
			                else{
			                    // When the email was added - set the cookie
			                    pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('newsletter', 'y');
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, true, "");
			                }
			            });
			            break;
			    }
			}]);

			// Read all values from cookie
			var cookieValues = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();

			for (var i in cookieValues) {
			    // Set custom variables from cookie
			    tp.push(['setCustomVariable', i, cookieValues[i]]);
			}



		</script>

  <meta class="swiftype" name="url" data-type="enum" content="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/spacex-successfully-launches-its-heaviest-geostationary-orbital-payload-yet/"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="timestamp" data-type="date" content="2017-05-15 16:37:31"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="content" data-type="text" content="SpaceX launched a Falcon 9 rocket carrying a payload from communications satellite operate Inmarsat, the fourth in a constellation created to provide high-bandwidth broadspeed Internet globally. The payload is the largest ever launched on a Falcon 9, which is why the mission parameters didn't call for an attempt to recover the first stage of the rocket. The launch was originally slated to be done with one of SpaceX's Falcon Heavy rockets, but the company has yet to bring those into commercial operation. Instead, the Falcon 9's top payload capacity has been improved to the point where it can handle delivering the Inmarsat satellite to its target geostationary orbit. SpaceX's launch bring the Boeing-made satellite into operation alongside three previously deployed spacecraft, with the intent of this additional one being to add more load capacity to the existing network, and also to provide some backup options in case one of the other geostationary units encounters a problem. The…"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="excerpt" data-type="text" content="SpaceX launched a Falcon 9 rocket carrying a payload from communications satellite operate Inmarsat, the fourth in a constellation created to provide high-bandwidth broadspeed Internet globally. The payload is the largest ever launched on a Falcon 9, which is why the mission parameters didn’t call for an attempt to recover the first stage of the rocket.
The launch was originally slated to be…">

	var setAdblockerCookie = function(adblocker) {
	    var d = new Date();
	    d.setTime(d.getTime() + 60 * 60 * 24 * 30 * 1000);
	    document.cookie = "__adblocker=" + (adblocker ? "true" : "false") + "; expires=" + d.toUTCString() + "; path=/";
	}
	var script = document.createElement("script");
	script.setAttribute("async", true);
	script.setAttribute("src", "//www.npttech.com/advertising.js");
	script.setAttribute("onerror", "setAdblockerCookie(true);");
	script.setAttribute("onload", "setAdblockerCookie(false);");
	document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(script);
</script>

        <div class="fb-send-to-messenger" id="fb-send-to-messenger" messenger_app_id="1678638095724206" page_id="8062627951" color="blue" size="large" data-ref="tcnav"></div> 
        <script>
		  window.fbAsyncInit = function() {
		    FB.init({
		      appId      : '1678638095724206',
		      xfbml      : true,
		      version    : 'v2.6'
		    });
			FB.Event.subscribe('xfbml.render', function() {
				jQuery('.fb-messenger-loading').detach()
			});
		  };

		  (function(d, s, id){
		     var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
		     if (d.getElementById(id)) {return;}
		     js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id;
		     js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_US/sdk.js";
		     fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
		   }(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));

		   function getCookie(name) {
		      var matches = document.cookie.match(new RegExp(
		        "(?:^|; )" + name.replace(/([\.$?*|{}\(\)\[\]\\\/\+^])/g, '\\$1') + "=([^;]*)"
		      ));
		      return matches ? decodeURIComponent(matches[1]) : undefined;
		   }

		   window.onload = function() {
		     var gravity_guid = getCookie('grvinsights');
		     var btn = document.getElementById('fb-send-to-messenger');
		     if (btn != undefined && btn != null) {
			   btn.setAttribute('data-ref', gravity_guid)
			 }
		   }

		</script>

   <script>
/* <![CDATA[ */
if (!ads.isMobile()) {
	(function(window,$){
		window.TechCrunch.loader.on('tc_ads_wrapper_omniture', function(){
			if ( !window.ads.isAdPageSet ){
				if ( typeof window.adSetAdURL == 'function' ) {
					window.adSetAdURL('/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/_uac/adpage.html');
					window.ads.isAdPageSet = true;
				}
				if ( typeof window.adsResizePortrait === 'function' ) {
					window.adsResizePortrait('1');
				}
				window.console.log('ADS WIDTH:');
				window.console.log(ads);
			}
			window.htmlAdWH('93484975', "LB", "LB", 'f', 'adsDiv6f1d13e0a4');
		});
	}(this,this.jQuery));
}

   <!-- Begin: Article - Primary --> 
   <article class="article lc"> 
    <div class="l-two-col-expose"> 
     <!-- Begin: Article Content - Body Right Column --> 
     <div class="l-main-container"> 
      <div class="l-main"> 
       <!-- Begin: Article Header --> 
       <header class="article-header page-title"> 
        <!-- Begin: Article Eyebrows --> 
        <div class="tags"> 
         <div class="tag-item"> 
          <a href="https://techcrunch.com/space/" class="tag" data-omni-sm="art_articlecategory">Space</a> 
          <div class="links" id="tc-tag-item-space"> 
           <ul class="recirc-river river-small g g-1-2-1"> 
            <li> 
             <div class="block-small"> 
              <a class="block-wrapper" href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/watch-spacexs-inmarsat-5-flight-4-satellite-launch-live-right-here/"> <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/c_4ogwcvoaav4uk-jpg-large.jpeg?w=150" alt="Watch SpaceX’s Inmarsat-5 Flight 4 satellite launch live right&nbsp;here"> 
               <div class="block-content"> 
                <h3>Watch SpaceX’s Inmarsat-5 Flight 4 satellite launch live right&nbsp;here</h3> 
                <div class="block-meta"> 
                 <div class="byline"> 
                  <time datetime="2017-05-15 14:49:09"></time> 
                 </div> 
                </div> 
               </div> </a> 
             </div> </li>

        <h1 class="alpha tweet-title">SpaceX successfully launches its heaviest geostationary orbital payload yet</h1> 
        <div class="title-left"> 
         <div class="byline">
           Posted 
          <time datetime="2017-05-15" class="timestamp">8 hours ago</time> by 
          <a href="/author/darrell-etherington/" title="Posts by Darrell Etherington" onclick="s_objectID='river_author';" rel="author">Darrell Etherington</a> 
          <span class="twitter-handle">(<a href="https://twitter.com/etherington" rel="external">@etherington</a>)</span>
         </div> 
         <!-- Begin: Social Share Icons --> 
         <div class="social-share social-share-inline"> 
          <ul class="inline-list social-share-list" id="social-share" data-permalink="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/spacex-successfully-launches-its-heaviest-geostationary-orbital-payload-yet/" data-shortlink="http://tcrn.ch/2qlCnpU" data-sharetitle="SpaceX successfully launches its heaviest geostationary orbital payload&nbsp;yet" data-post-id="1490790" data-twitter-hash=""> 
           <li class="total-shares"> <h5 class="total-shares-count">0</h5><br> <small>SHARES</small> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#comments" rel="external" class="comment icon-comment launch-social-load"></a> </li>

        <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/savari-works-to-bring-5g-to-connected-cars/" class="next-link" data-omni-sm="art_nextstory"> 
         <div class="next-story-link">
          Next Story

         <div class="next-story-full"> 
          <h4 class="next-title">Savari works to bring 5G to connected&nbsp;cars</h4>

       <!-- End: Article Header --> 
       <!-- Begin: Article Body --> 
       <div class="l-two-col"> 
        <!-- Begin: Article Body - Main --> 
        <div class="l-main-container"> 
         <div class="l-main"> 
          <div class="article-entry text"> 
           <!-- Begin: Wordpress Article Content --> 
           <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/spacex-launch-may-15-17-compressor.gif?w=680" class=""> 
           <p id="speakable-summary">SpaceX launched a Falcon 9 rocket carrying a payload from communications satellite operate Inmarsat, the fourth in a constellation created to provide high-bandwidth broadspeed Internet globally. The payload is the largest ever launched on a Falcon 9, which is why the mission parameters didn’t call for an attempt to recover the first stage of the rocket.</p> 
           <p>The launch was originally slated to be done with one of SpaceX’s Falcon Heavy rockets, but the company has yet to bring those into commercial operation. Instead, the Falcon 9’s top payload capacity has been improved to the point where it can handle delivering the Inmarsat satellite to its target geostationary orbit.</p> 
           <p>SpaceX’s launch bring the Boeing-made satellite into operation alongside three previously deployed spacecraft, with the intent of this additional one being to add more load capacity to the existing network, and also to provide some backup options in case one of the other geostationary units encounters a problem.</p> 
           <p>The launch took place at SpaceX’s LC-39A complex at Kennedy in Florida, which SpaceX has leased and repurposed to support Falcon 9 and future Falcon Heavy crewed launches.</p>
           <div>
            <div id="adsDivd213bae967" class="native-ad-mobile"></div>
           </div> 
           <p>The rocket successfully completed its initial second stage burn, after which it’ll initiate a second in order to move into the correct place in orbit. Once in position, it’ll deploy its satellite payload. We’ll update this story when they return to broadcasting to let you know if the post-launch mission was a success as well.</p> 
           <p>Update: Total mission success with full satellite deployment achieved.</p> 
           <!-- End: Wordpress Article Content --> 
          </div> 
          <div id="social-after-wrapper" class="cf social-share social-share-inline"> 
           <ul class="inline-list social-share-list" id="social-after" data-permalink="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/spacex-successfully-launches-its-heaviest-geostationary-orbital-payload-yet/" data-shortlink="http://tcrn.ch/2qlCnpU" data-sharetitle="SpaceX successfully launches its heaviest geostationary orbital payload&nbsp;yet" data-post-id="1490790"> 
            <li class="total-shares"> <h5 class="total-shares-count">0</h5><br> <small>SHARES</small> </li>

         <div class="section aside crunchbase-cluster collapse"> 
          <h3 class="section-title collapse-title">Crunchbase</h3> 
          <div class="collapse-body"> 
           <ul class="crunchbase-accordion"> 
            <!-- Begin: Crunchbase Card --> 
            <li class="data-card crunchbase-card active" data-crunchbase-url="https://crunchbase.com/organization/hyperloop-technolgies/"> <h4 class="card-title card-acc-handle"> <a class="cb-card-title-link" href="https://crunchbase.com/organization/hyperloop-technolgies/"> Hyperloop One </a> </h4> 
             <div class="card-acc-panel"> 
              <ul class="card-info"> 
               <li> <strong class="key">Founded</strong> <span class="value">2014</span> </li> 
               <li class="cb-card-description full"> <strong class="key">Overview</strong> <span class="value">Hyperloop builds incredible pieces of advanced machinery. They are inventing the technology of the future of transportation and to make sure we get it right we have developed unique testing capabilities.Whether it is state of the art wind tunnels, levitation rigs or electromagnetic test stands our world-class engineering team has built them in record time. We’re building the 5th mode of transportation …</span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Location</strong> <span class="value"> <a href="http://crunchbase.com/location/los-angeles/4ce61f42f6c4e7ec798d44813b58856b">Los Angeles, CA</a> </span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Categories</strong> <span class="value"> <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/travel/8672f521ce9ae851adffc35d2441a0ad">Travel</a>, <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/transportation/95642ff023e979a3612b50de99f06305">Transportation</a>, <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/manufacturing/e811671c168d1fd236e5df4e08a09f7c">Manufacturing</a> </span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Founders</strong> <span class="value"><a href="https://crunchbase.com/person/person/josh-giegel" target="_blank">Josh Giegel</a>, <a href="https://crunchbase.com/person/person/shervin-pishevar" target="_blank">Shervin Pishevar</a></span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Website</strong> <span class="value"> <a href="https://hyperloop-one.com/" target="_blank">https://hyperloop-one.com/</a> </span> </li> 
               <li class="full profile"> <a href="https://crunchbase.com/organization/hyperloop-technolgies" target="_blank">Full profile for Hyperloop One</a> </li> 
              </ul> 
             </div> </li> 
            <!-- End: Crunchbase Card --> 
            <!-- Begin: Crunchbase Card --> 
            <li class="data-card crunchbase-card" data-crunchbase-url="https://crunchbase.com/organization/space-exploration-technologies/"> <h4 class="card-title card-acc-handle"> <a class="cb-card-title-link" href="https://crunchbase.com/organization/space-exploration-technologies/"> SpaceX </a> </h4> 
             <div class="card-acc-panel"> 
              <ul class="card-info"> 
               <li> <strong class="key">Founded</strong> <span class="value">2002</span> </li> 
               <li class="cb-card-description full"> <strong class="key">Overview</strong> <span class="value">Space Exploration Technologies Corporation (SpaceX) is a space-transportation startup company founded by Elon Musk. It is developing the partially reusable launch vehicles Falcon 1 and Falcon 9. Originally based in El Segundo, SpaceX now operates out of Hawthorne, California, USA. SpaceX was founded in June 2002 by Musk who had invested $100 million of his own money in the company as of March 2006. …</span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Location</strong> <span class="value"> <a href="http://crunchbase.com/location/hawthorne/ed19e5bfbec449efd87e5979a1a7c0c8">Hawthorne, CA</a> </span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Categories</strong> <span class="value"> <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/aerospace/8a20023f3e3220bbb6abe824a0386367">Aerospace</a>, <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/transportation/95642ff023e979a3612b50de99f06305">Transportation</a>, <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/space-travel/b59073949837f1907ecaa27462666650">Space Travel</a> </span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Founders</strong> <span class="value"><a href="https://crunchbase.com/person/person/elon-musk" target="_blank">Elon Musk</a></span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Website</strong> <span class="value"> <a href="http://www.spacex.com" target="_blank">http://www.spacex.com</a> </span> </li> 
               <li class="full profile"> <a href="https://crunchbase.com/organization/space-exploration-technologies" target="_blank">Full profile for SpaceX</a> </li> 
              </ul> 
             </div> </li> 
            <!-- End: Crunchbase Card --> 
           </ul> 
          </div>

           <a href="https://www.brandbastion.com" target="_blank"><img src="https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/assets/images/brandbastion_logo.png" alt="BrandBastion"></a> 
          </div>

  <script type="application/ld+json">
		{"@context":"http:\/\/schema.org","@type":"Article","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2017\/05\/15\/spacex-successfully-launches-its-heaviest-geostationary-orbital-payload-yet\/","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Darrell Etherington"},"headline":"SpaceX successfully launches its largest","articleBody":"SpaceX launched a Falcon 9 rocket carrying a payload from communications satellite operate Inmarsat, the fourth in a constellation created to provide high-bandwidth broadspeed Internet globally. The payload is the largest ever launched on a Falcon 9, which is why the mission parameters didn't call for an attempt to recover the first stage of the rocket.\n\nThe launch was originally slated to be done with one of SpaceX's Falcon Heavy rockets, but the company has yet to bring those into commercial operation. Instead, the Falcon 9's top payload capacity has been improved to the point where it can handle delivering the Inmarsat satellite to its target geostationary orbit.\n\nSpaceX's launch bring the Boeing-made satellite into operation alongside three previously deployed spacecraft, with the intent of this additional one being to add more load capacity to the existing network, and also to provide some backup options in case one of the other geostationary units encounters a problem.\n\nThe launch took place at SpaceX's LC-39A complex at Kennedy in Florida, which SpaceX has leased and repurposed to support Falcon 9 and future Falcon Heavy crewed launches.\n\nThe rocket successfully completed its initial second stage burn, after which it'll initiate a second in order to move into the correct place in orbit. Once in position, it'll deploy its satellite payload. We'll update this story when they return to broadcasting to let you know if the post-launch mission was a success as well.\n\nUpdate: Total mission success with full satellite deployment achieved.","datePublished":"2017-05-15T23:37:31+00:00","mainEntityOfPage":"True","image":{"@list":["https:\/\/tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com\/2017\/05\/spacex-launch-may-15-17-compressor.gif"]},"speakable":{"@type":"SpeakableSpecification","cssSelector":[".alpha","#speakable-summary"]}}	</script>

	if( wpcom_mobile_user_agent_info.isIPad() )
		mobileStatsQueryString += "&x_" + 'ipad_views' + '=' + 'views';

	if( "" != mobileStatsQueryString ) {
		new Image().src = document.location.protocol + '//pixel.wp.com/g.gif?v=wpcom-no-pv' + mobileStatsQueryString + '&baba=' + Math.random();
	}
	
}
</script>

				var e = document.createElement('script'),
					url = ("https:" === document.location.protocol) ? "https://s3.amazonaws.com/" : "http://";

				e.setAttribute('language', 'javascript');
				e.setAttribute('type', 'text/javascript');

  <script>
	//append functionality to omniture object
	//method provided by adobe : https://marketing.adobe.com/resources/help/en_US/sc/implement/getVisitNum.html
	/*                                                                 
	* Plugin: getVisitNum - version 3.0
	*/
	var s = window.s_265;
	window.s_265.getVisitNum=new Function("tp","c","c2",""
	+"var s=this,e=new Date,cval,cvisit,ct=e.getTime(),d;if(!tp){tp='m';}"
	+"if(tp=='m'||tp=='w'||tp=='d'){eo=s.endof(tp),y=eo.getTime();e.setTi"
	+"me(y);}else {d=tp*86400000;e.setTime(ct+d);}if(!c){c='s_vnum';}if(!"
	+"c2){c2='s_invisit';}cval=s.c_r(c);if(cval){var i=cval.indexOf('&vn="
	+"'),str=cval.substring(i+4,cval.length),k;}cvisit=s.c_r(c2);if(cvisi"
	+"t){if(str){e.setTime(ct+1800000);s.c_w(c2,'true',e);return str;}els"
	+"e {return 'unknown visit number';}}else {if(str){str++;k=cval.substri"
	+"ng(0,i);e.setTime(k);s.c_w(c,k+'&vn='+str,e);e.setTime(ct+1800000);"
	+"s.c_w(c2,'true',e);return str;}else {s.c_w(c,e.getTime()+'&vn=1',e)"
	+";e.setTime(ct+1800000);s.c_w(c2,'true',e);return 1;}}");
	s.dimo=new Function("m","y",""
	+"var d=new Date(y,m+1,0);return d.getDate();");
	s.endof=new Function("x",""
	+"var t=new Date;t.setHours(0);t.setMinutes(0);t.setSeconds(0);if(x=="
	+"'m'){d=s.dimo(t.getMonth(),t.getFullYear())-t.getDate()+1;}else if("
	+"x=='w'){d=7-t.getDay();}else {d=1;}t.setDate(t.getDate()+d);return "
	+"t;");
</script>

		function addLoadEvent(func) {
			var oldonload = window.onload;
			if (typeof window.onload != 'function') {
				window.onload = func;
			} else {
				window.onload = function () {
					oldonload();

  <script>
			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
				// Get all existing values from the cookie
				var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
				// Set the value
				cookieValue[name] = value;

				// Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
				var d = new Date();
				d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
				var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();


									var domain = 'techcrunch.com';
				
				// Write the cookie value
				document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=."+domain;
			}

						

			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
			    // Get all existing values from the cookie
			    var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
			    // Set the value
			    cookieValue[name] = value;

			    // Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
			    var d = new Date();
			    d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
			    var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();

			    // Write the cookie value
			    document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=.tcpreprod.com";
			}

			/**
			 * Read values from cookie and convert them from json
			 * @param specificName (optional) Name specific value from the set
			 * @returns {*} If specificName is specified - returns single value, otherwise returns JSON object with all values
			 */
			function pianoReadCustomVariableCookie(specificName) {
			    var cookieValue;
			    try {
			        // Try to get the cookie value with regexp
			        var match = document.cookie.match(new RegExp('(^| )__pcvc=([^;]+)'));
			        if (match) {
			            // If cookie with this name was found - try to parse the JSON value
			            cookieValue = JSON.parse(match[2]);
			        }
			    }
			    catch (e) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (!cookieValue) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (typeof specificName != "undefined") {
			        // Get the specific value from the set
			        if (typeof cookieValue[specificName] != "undefined") {
			            return cookieValue[specificName];
			        }
			        return null;
			    }
			    return cookieValue;
			}

			/**
			 * Function to send data upstream to Piano template
			 * @param iframeId - Element id of the Piano iframe
			 * @param success - true/false. Status of the message
			 * @param message - Error message text
			 * @param object - Additional data, like the the field that triggered the error
			 */
			function sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, success, message, object) {
			    var iframe = jQuery('#' + iframeId);

			    if (iframe.length) {
			        iframe[0].contentWindow.postMessage({
			            piano: {
			                success: success,
			                message: message,
			                object: object
			            }
			        }, '*');
			    }
			}

			tp = window.tp || [];

			tp.push(["addHandler", "customEvent", function (event, b, c, d) {
			    switch (event.eventName) {
			        // Don't show me this again
			        case 'dont-show':
			            pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('dontshow', 'y');
			            tp.offer.close();
			            break;

			        case 'tc-signup-newsletters':
			            console.log(event);
			            var email = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.email != 'undefined') && (event.params.email.length > 0)) {
			                email = event.params.email;
			            }

			            var object = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.object != 'undefined') && (event.params.object.length > 0)) {
			                object = event.params.object;
			            }

			            var list = [];
			            if ((typeof event.params.list != 'undefined') && (event.params.list.length > 0)) {
			                list = JSON.parse(event.params.list);
			            }

			            var iframeId;

			            // We are parsing the params object sent from the template to find out which iframe triggered it
			            params = JSON.parse(event.params.params);
			            // And here's the iframeId we're looking for
			            iframeId = params.iframeId;

			            //grab the security string from the from the form
			            //on the page, needed for check in the backend
			            var $form = jQuery('.form-newsletters');
			            var url = '/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php';
			            var nonce = $form.data('nonce');


			            if (email == undefined || email == '') {
			                return;
			            }

			            var emailLists = [];
			            for (var i in list){
			                if (list[i]){
			                    emailLists.push(i);
			                }
			            }

			            var jqxhr = jQuery.get(url, {
			                action: "newsletters",
			                subaction: "subscribe",
			                email_lists: emailLists,
			                email: email,
			                tracking_id: event.params.tracking_id,
			                security: nonce
			            }, function (data) {
			                if (!data.success){
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, false, data.data.message, object)
			                }
			                else{
			                    // When the email was added - set the cookie
			                    pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('newsletter', 'y');
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, true, "");
			                }
			            });
			            break;
			    }
			}]);

			// Read all values from cookie
			var cookieValues = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();

			for (var i in cookieValues) {
			    // Set custom variables from cookie
			    tp.push(['setCustomVariable', i, cookieValues[i]]);
			}



		</script>

  <meta class="swiftype" name="timestamp" data-type="date" content="2017-05-15 16:07:12"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="content" data-type="text" content="In these early days of smart cities and connected cars, Savari has emerged as a V2X (that's vehicle-to-everything) innovator. Now it's joined the 5G Automotive Association to bring cellular communications to connected cars. This technology doesn't merely provide faster cell service on the morning commute. Cellular-V2X (C-V2X) is a communications system for connected cars to share data with each other and with&nbsp;the surrounding infrastructure -- no humans required. With 5G, cars can send and receive messages 10 times per second. The data can be analyzed quickly enough to provide as much as 3 seconds' advance warning before an accident might happen, according to Savari. Using 5G communications means that the collected data can also be uploaded to the cloud and distributed via the cellular network to other cars using 5G. This will give other drivers more information even earlier. Rather than relying on the data to avoid an imminent crash, the network can tell traffic to avoid that…"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="excerpt" data-type="text" content="In these early days of smart cities and connected cars, Savari has emerged as a V2X (that’s vehicle-to-everything) innovator. Now it’s joined the 5G Automotive Association to bring cellular communications to connected cars.
This technology doesn’t merely provide faster cell service on the morning commute. Cellular-V2X (C-V2X) is a communications system for connected cars to share data with…">

	var setAdblockerCookie = function(adblocker) {
	    var d = new Date();
	    d.setTime(d.getTime() + 60 * 60 * 24 * 30 * 1000);
	    document.cookie = "__adblocker=" + (adblocker ? "true" : "false") + "; expires=" + d.toUTCString() + "; path=/";
	}

	script.setAttribute("onload", "setAdblockerCookie(false);");

      <div class="modal-body"> 
       <h2>Hi!</h2> 
       <p> You are about to activate our Facebook Messenger news bot. Once subscribed, the bot will send you a digest of trending stories once a day. You can also customize the types of stories it sends you. </p> 
       <p> Click on the button below to subscribe and wait for a new Facebook message from the TC Messenger news bot. </p> 
       <p> Thanks,<br> TC Team </p> 
       <div class="fb-messenger-loading"></div> 
       <div class="fb-messenger-iframe"> 
        <div class="fb-send-to-messenger" id="fb-send-to-messenger" messenger_app_id="1678638095724206" page_id="8062627951" color="blue" size="large" data-ref="tcnav"></div> 
        <script>
		  window.fbAsyncInit = function() {
		    FB.init({
		      appId      : '1678638095724206',
		      xfbml      : true,
		      version    : 'v2.6'
		    });
			FB.Event.subscribe('xfbml.render', function() {
				jQuery('.fb-messenger-loading').detach()
			});
		  };

		  (function(d, s, id){
		     var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
		     if (d.getElementById(id)) {return;}
		     js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id;
		     js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_US/sdk.js";
		     fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
		   }(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));

		   function getCookie(name) {
		      var matches = document.cookie.match(new RegExp(
		        "(?:^|; )" + name.replace(/([\.$?*|{}\(\)\[\]\\\/\+^])/g, '\\$1') + "=([^;]*)"
		      ));
		      return matches ? decodeURIComponent(matches[1]) : undefined;
		   }

		   window.onload = function() {
		     var gravity_guid = getCookie('grvinsights');
		     var btn = document.getElementById('fb-send-to-messenger');
		     if (btn != undefined && btn != null) {
			   btn.setAttribute('data-ref', gravity_guid)
			 }
		   }

		</script> 
       </div> 
      </div>

           <ul class="recirc-river river-small g g-1-2-1"> 
            <li> 
             <div class="block-small"> 
              <a class="block-wrapper" href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/03/27/toyota-and-ntt-to-collaborate-on-connected-car-tech-including-ai/"> <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/01/147a0183.jpg?w=150" alt="Toyota and NTT to collaborate on connected car tech, including&nbsp;AI">

                 </div> 
                </div> 
               </div> </a> 
             </div> </li> 
            <li> 
             <div class="block-small"> 
              <a class="block-wrapper" href="https://techcrunch.com/2016/07/06/volkswagen-lg-connected-car-platform/"> <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2016/07/budd-e_concept_5785.jpg?w=150" alt="Volkswagen throws in with LG on ‘Cross-Over’ connected car&nbsp;platform"> 
               <div class="block-content"> 
                <h3>Volkswagen throws in with LG on ‘Cross-Over’ connected car&nbsp;platform</h3> 
                <div class="block-meta"> 
                 <div class="byline"> 
                  <time datetime="2016-07-06 09:44:26"></time> 
                 </div> 
                </div> 
               </div> </a> 
             </div> </li>

        <!-- End: Article Eyebrows --> 
        <h1 class="alpha tweet-title">Savari works to bring 5G to connected cars</h1> 
        <div class="title-left"> 
         <div class="byline">
           Posted 
          <time datetime="2017-05-15" class="timestamp">9 hours ago</time> by 
          <a href="/author/kristen-hall-geisler/" title="Posts by Kristen Hall-Geisler" onclick="s_objectID='river_author';" rel="author">Kristen Hall-Geisler</a> 
          <span class="twitter-handle">(<a href="https://twitter.com/kristenhg" rel="external">@kristenhg</a>)</span>
         </div> 
         <!-- Begin: Social Share Icons --> 
         <div class="social-share social-share-inline"> 
          <ul class="inline-list social-share-list" id="social-share" data-permalink="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/savari-works-to-bring-5g-to-connected-cars/" data-shortlink="http://tcrn.ch/2rali3q" data-sharetitle="Savari works to bring 5G to connected&nbsp;cars" data-post-id="1490833" data-twitter-hash=""> 
           <li class="total-shares"> <h5 class="total-shares-count">0</h5><br> <small>SHARES</small> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#comments" rel="external" class="comment icon-comment launch-social-load"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="facebook icon-facebook"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="twitter icon-twitter"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="linkedin icon-linkedin"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="google-plus icon-google-plus"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="reddit icon-reddit"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="stumbleupon icon-stumbleupon"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="email icon-email"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="flipboard icon-flipboard"></a> </li> 
          </ul> 
         </div> 
         <div class="social-share social-share-fixed"> 
          <div class="less"> 
           <a class="blank"></a> 
           <a class="icon-flipboard" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-stumbleupon" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-reddit" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-email" href="#"></a> 
          </div> 
          <div class="shown"> 
           <a class="icon-facebook" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-twitter" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-linkedin" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-whatsapp" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-email" href="#"></a> 
          </div> 
         </div> 
         <!-- End: Social Share Icons --> 
        </div> 
        <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/recordgram-thinks-your-phone-is-the-new-recording-studio/" class="next-link" data-omni-sm="art_nextstory"> 
         <div class="next-story-link">
          Next Story
         </div> 
         <div class="next-story-full"> 
          <h4 class="next-title">RecordGram thinks your phone is the new recording&nbsp;studio</h4> 
         </div> </a> 
       </header> 
       <!-- End: Article Header --> 
       <!-- Begin: Article Body --> 
       <div class="l-two-col"> 
        <!-- Begin: Article Body - Main --> 
        <div class="l-main-container"> 
         <div class="l-main"> 
          <div class="article-entry text"> 
           <!-- Begin: Wordpress Article Content --> 
           <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/04/11.jpg?w=738" class=""> 
           <p id="speakable-summary">In these early days of<a target="_blank" href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/02/21/v2x-tech-makes-tampa-commutes-safer-faster-less-confusing/" rel="noopener noreferrer"> smart cities</a> and connected cars, Savari has emerged as a V2X (that’s vehicle-to-everything) innovator. Now it’s joined the <a target="_blank" href="http://5gaa.org/" rel="noopener noreferrer">5G Automotive Association</a> to bring cellular communications to connected cars.</p> 
           <p>This technology doesn’t merely provide faster cell service on the morning commute. Cellular-V2X (C-V2X) is a communications system for connected cars to share data with each other and with&nbsp;the surrounding infrastructure — no humans required. With 5G, cars can send and receive messages 10 times per second. The data can be analyzed quickly enough to provide as much as 3 seconds’ advance warning before an accident might happen, according to Savari.</p> 
           <p>Using 5G communications means that the collected data can also be uploaded to the cloud and distributed via the cellular network to other cars using 5G. This will give other drivers more information even earlier. Rather than relying on the data to avoid an imminent crash, the network can tell traffic to avoid that stretch of road altogether until the accident is cleared.</p> 
           <p>The 5G Automotive Association already has a few dozen members, including OEMs like Audi, Ford, and Daimler, automotive suppliers like Bosch, Denso, and Continental, and cellular industry companies like Verizon, Samsung, and LG. Savari says its role in the group will be to help create standards that work across the industry as semi-autonomous cars and fully autonomous cars are tested and eventually sold.</p>
           <div>
            <div id="adsDivd213bae967" class="native-ad-mobile"></div>
           </div> 
           <p>You may be wondering about dedicated short-range communications, or DSRC, technology, which is already being tested in V2X communications for vehicles and infrastructure. It sends&nbsp;simple radio signals based on wifi technology. While cellular carriers are <a target="_blank" href="http://www.fiercewireless.com/wireless/5gaa-ngmn-argue-for-cellular-over-dscr-nhtsa-proposal" rel="noopener noreferrer">pushing</a> the National Transportation Highway Safety Administration (NHTSA) to adopt 5G over DSRC for V2X programs going forward, other companies, like <a target="_blank" href="https://www.qualcomm.com/news/onq/2016/11/23/dsrc80211p-or-cellular-qualcomm-technologies-can-bring-direct-v2x-communications" rel="noopener noreferrer">Qualcomm</a>, say they’re ready to roll with either communications technology.</p> 
           <p>Right now, <a target="_blank" href="https://technology.ihs.com/579612/c-v2x-offers-a-cellular-alternative-to-ieee-80211pdsrc" rel="noopener noreferrer">neither technology</a> is very widely deployed. The main advantage of C-V2X is that it’s nearly twice as fast as DSRC. When a self-driving car is gathering data to prevent crashes, that speed is going to be crucial. The main advantage of DSRC is that it’s been developed and tested for more than a decade; its stability and familiarity is likely to appeal to <a target="_blank" href="https://techcrunch.com/2016/10/04/what-the-new-nhtsa-guidelines-mean-for-self-driving-cars/" rel="noopener noreferrer">NHTSA</a>, which will issue a mandate on V2X communications.</p> 
           <!-- End: Wordpress Article Content --> 
           <small>Featured Image: Driving-Tests.org</small> 
          </div> 
          <div id="social-after-wrapper" class="cf social-share social-share-inline"> 
           <ul class="inline-list social-share-list" id="social-after" data-permalink="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/savari-works-to-bring-5g-to-connected-cars/" data-shortlink="http://tcrn.ch/2rali3q" data-sharetitle="Savari works to bring 5G to connected&nbsp;cars" data-post-id="1490833"> 
            <li class="total-shares"> <h5 class="total-shares-count">0</h5><br> <small>SHARES</small> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="facebook icon-facebook"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="twitter icon-twitter"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="linkedin icon-linkedin"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="google-plus icon-google-plus"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="stumbleupon icon-stumbleupon"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="reddit icon-reddit"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="flipboard icon-flipboard"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="email icon-email"></a> </li> 
           </ul> 
          </div> 
          <div id="grv-personalization-56"></div>

            <!-- Begin: Crunchbase Card --> 
            <li class="data-card crunchbase-card" data-crunchbase-url="https://crunchbase.com/organization/bosch/"> <h4 class="card-title card-acc-handle"> <a class="cb-card-title-link" href="https://crunchbase.com/organization/bosch/"> Bosch </a> </h4>
