              <ul class="card-info"> 
               <li> <strong class="key">Founded</strong> <span class="value">1886</span> </li> 
               <li class="cb-card-description full"> <strong class="key">Overview</strong> <span class="value">The Bosch Group is a leading global supplier of technology and services. Its operations are divided into four business sectors: Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. As a leading …</span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Location</strong> <span class="value"> <a href="http://crunchbase.com/location/stuttgart/682ccb52b8cd267dfef40a7c26f5396d">Stuttgart, 01</a> </span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Categories</strong> <span class="value"> <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/energy/0ff04f3a4264226a9c03a481554b637d">Energy</a>, <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/sensor/6f5a43980331880365dec927ab8e5d20">Sensor</a>, <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/automotive/bb2ad65f1009db81c6f683dbcfd64870">Automotive</a>, <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/electronics/e173f2553db19d0274cbf58a1f45b483">Electronics</a>, <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/manufacturing/e811671c168d1fd236e5df4e08a09f7c">Manufacturing</a> </span> </li>

           <a href="https://www.brandbastion.com" target="_blank"><img src="https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/assets/images/brandbastion_logo.png" alt="BrandBastion"></a> 
          </div>

  <script type="application/ld+json">
		{"@context":"http:\/\/schema.org","@type":"Article","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2017\/05\/15\/savari-works-to-bring-5g-to-connected-cars\/","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Kristen Hall-Geisler"},"headline":"Savari works to bring 5G to connected cars","articleBody":"In these early days of smart cities and connected cars, Savari has emerged as a V2X (that's vehicle-to-everything) innovator. Now it's joined the 5G Automotive Association to bring cellular communications to connected cars.\n\nThis technology doesn't merely provide faster cell service on the morning commute. Cellular-V2X (C-V2X) is a communications system for connected cars to share data with each other and with\u00a0the surrounding infrastructure -- no humans required. With 5G, cars can send and receive messages 10 times per second. The data can be analyzed quickly enough to provide as much as 3 seconds' advance warning before an accident might happen, according to Savari.\n\nUsing 5G communications means that the collected data can also be uploaded to the cloud and distributed via the cellular network to other cars using 5G. This will give other drivers more information even earlier. Rather than relying on the data to avoid an imminent crash, the network can tell traffic to avoid that stretch of road altogether until the accident is cleared.\n\nThe 5G Automotive Association already has a few dozen members, including OEMs like Audi, Ford, and Daimler, automotive suppliers like Bosch, Denso, and Continental, and cellular industry companies like Verizon, Samsung, and LG. Savari says its role in the group will be to help create standards that work across the industry as semi-autonomous cars and fully autonomous cars are tested and eventually sold.\n\nYou may be wondering about dedicated short-range communications, or DSRC, technology, which is already being tested in V2X communications for vehicles and infrastructure. It sends\u00a0simple radio signals based on wifi technology. While cellular carriers are pushing the National Transportation Highway Safety Administration (NHTSA) to adopt 5G over DSRC for V2X programs going forward, other companies, like Qualcomm, say they're ready to roll with either communications technology.\n\nRight now, neither technology is very widely deployed. The main advantage of C-V2X is that it's nearly twice as fast as DSRC. When a self-driving car is gathering data to prevent crashes, that speed is going to be crucial. The main advantage of DSRC is that it's been developed and tested for more than a decade; its stability and familiarity is likely to appeal to NHTSA, which will issue a mandate on V2X communications.","datePublished":"2017-05-15T23:07:12+00:00","mainEntityOfPage":"True","image":{"@list":["https:\/\/tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com\/2017\/04\/11.jpg"]},"speakable":{"@type":"SpeakableSpecification","cssSelector":[".alpha","#speakable-summary"]}}	</script>

  <script>
if ( 'object' === typeof wpcom_mobile_user_agent_info ) {

	wpcom_mobile_user_agent_info.init();
	var mobileStatsQueryString = "";
	
	if( false !== wpcom_mobile_user_agent_info.matchedPlatformName )
		mobileStatsQueryString += "&x_" + 'mobile_platforms' + '=' + wpcom_mobile_user_agent_info.matchedPlatformName;
	
	if( false !== wpcom_mobile_user_agent_info.matchedUserAgentName )
		mobileStatsQueryString += "&x_" + 'mobile_devices' + '=' + wpcom_mobile_user_agent_info.matchedUserAgentName;
	
	if( wpcom_mobile_user_agent_info.isIPad() )
		mobileStatsQueryString += "&x_" + 'ipad_views' + '=' + 'views';

	if( "" != mobileStatsQueryString ) {
		new Image().src = document.location.protocol + '//pixel.wp.com/g.gif?v=wpcom-no-pv' + mobileStatsQueryString + '&baba=' + Math.random();
	}
	
}
</script>

			var document = window.document;

			function loadChartbeat() {
				window._sf_endpt = (new Date()).getTime();
				var e = document.createElement('script'),
					url = ("https:" === document.location.protocol) ? "https://s3.amazonaws.com/" : "http://";

				e.setAttribute('type', 'text/javascript');

	//append functionality to omniture object
	//method provided by adobe : https://marketing.adobe.com/resources/help/en_US/sc/implement/getVisitNum.html
	/*                                                                 
	* Plugin: getVisitNum - version 3.0
	*/
	var s = window.s_265;
	window.s_265.getVisitNum=new Function("tp","c","c2",""
	+"var s=this,e=new Date,cval,cvisit,ct=e.getTime(),d;if(!tp){tp='m';}"
	+"if(tp=='m'||tp=='w'||tp=='d'){eo=s.endof(tp),y=eo.getTime();e.setTi"
	+"me(y);}else {d=tp*86400000;e.setTime(ct+d);}if(!c){c='s_vnum';}if(!"
	+"c2){c2='s_invisit';}cval=s.c_r(c);if(cval){var i=cval.indexOf('&vn="
	+"'),str=cval.substring(i+4,cval.length),k;}cvisit=s.c_r(c2);if(cvisi"
	+"t){if(str){e.setTime(ct+1800000);s.c_w(c2,'true',e);return str;}els"
	+"e {return 'unknown visit number';}}else {if(str){str++;k=cval.substri"
	+"ng(0,i);e.setTime(k);s.c_w(c,k+'&vn='+str,e);e.setTime(ct+1800000);"
	+"s.c_w(c2,'true',e);return str;}else {s.c_w(c,e.getTime()+'&vn=1',e)"
	+";e.setTime(ct+1800000);s.c_w(c2,'true',e);return 1;}}");
	s.dimo=new Function("m","y",""
	+"var d=new Date(y,m+1,0);return d.getDate();");
	s.endof=new Function("x",""
	+"var t=new Date;t.setHours(0);t.setMinutes(0);t.setSeconds(0);if(x=="
	+"'m'){d=s.dimo(t.getMonth(),t.getFullYear())-t.getDate()+1;}else if("
	+"x=='w'){d=7-t.getDay();}else {d=1;}t.setDate(t.getDate()+d);return "
	+"t;");

		function addLoadEvent(func) {
			var oldonload = window.onload;
			if (typeof window.onload != 'function') {
				window.onload = func;
			} else {
				window.onload = function () {
					oldonload();
					func();
				}
			}

  <script>
			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
				// Get all existing values from the cookie
				var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
				// Set the value
				cookieValue[name] = value;

				// Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
				var d = new Date();
				d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
				var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();


									var domain = 'techcrunch.com';
				
				// Write the cookie value
				document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=."+domain;
			}

						

			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
			    // Get all existing values from the cookie
			    var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
			    // Set the value
			    cookieValue[name] = value;

			    // Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
			    var d = new Date();
			    d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
			    var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();

			    // Write the cookie value
			    document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=.tcpreprod.com";
			}

			/**
			 * Read values from cookie and convert them from json
			 * @param specificName (optional) Name specific value from the set
			 * @returns {*} If specificName is specified - returns single value, otherwise returns JSON object with all values
			 */
			function pianoReadCustomVariableCookie(specificName) {
			    var cookieValue;
			    try {
			        // Try to get the cookie value with regexp
			        var match = document.cookie.match(new RegExp('(^| )__pcvc=([^;]+)'));
			        if (match) {
			            // If cookie with this name was found - try to parse the JSON value
			            cookieValue = JSON.parse(match[2]);
			        }
			    }
			    catch (e) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (!cookieValue) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (typeof specificName != "undefined") {
			        // Get the specific value from the set
			        if (typeof cookieValue[specificName] != "undefined") {
			            return cookieValue[specificName];
			        }
			        return null;
			    }
			    return cookieValue;
			}

			/**
			 * Function to send data upstream to Piano template
			 * @param iframeId - Element id of the Piano iframe
			 * @param success - true/false. Status of the message
			 * @param message - Error message text
			 * @param object - Additional data, like the the field that triggered the error
			 */
			function sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, success, message, object) {
			    var iframe = jQuery('#' + iframeId);

			    if (iframe.length) {
			        iframe[0].contentWindow.postMessage({
			            piano: {
			                success: success,
			                message: message,
			                object: object
			            }
			        }, '*');
			    }
			}

			tp = window.tp || [];

			tp.push(["addHandler", "customEvent", function (event, b, c, d) {
			    switch (event.eventName) {
			        // Don't show me this again
			        case 'dont-show':
			            pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('dontshow', 'y');
			            tp.offer.close();
			            break;

			        case 'tc-signup-newsletters':
			            console.log(event);
			            var email = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.email != 'undefined') && (event.params.email.length > 0)) {
			                email = event.params.email;
			            }

			            var object = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.object != 'undefined') && (event.params.object.length > 0)) {
			                object = event.params.object;
			            }

			            var list = [];
			            if ((typeof event.params.list != 'undefined') && (event.params.list.length > 0)) {
			                list = JSON.parse(event.params.list);
			            }

			            var iframeId;

			            // We are parsing the params object sent from the template to find out which iframe triggered it
			            params = JSON.parse(event.params.params);
			            // And here's the iframeId we're looking for
			            iframeId = params.iframeId;

			            //grab the security string from the from the form
			            //on the page, needed for check in the backend
			            var $form = jQuery('.form-newsletters');
			            var url = '/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php';
			            var nonce = $form.data('nonce');


			            if (email == undefined || email == '') {
			                return;
			            }

			            var emailLists = [];
			            for (var i in list){
			                if (list[i]){
			                    emailLists.push(i);
			                }
			            }

			            var jqxhr = jQuery.get(url, {
			                action: "newsletters",
			                subaction: "subscribe",
			                email_lists: emailLists,
			                email: email,
			                tracking_id: event.params.tracking_id,
			                security: nonce
			            }, function (data) {
			                if (!data.success){
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, false, data.data.message, object)
			                }
			                else{
			                    // When the email was added - set the cookie
			                    pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('newsletter', 'y');
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, true, "");
			                }
			            });
			            break;
			    }
			}]);

			// Read all values from cookie
			var cookieValues = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();

			for (var i in cookieValues) {
			    // Set custom variables from cookie
			    tp.push(['setCustomVariable', i, cookieValues[i]]);
			}



		</script>

  <meta class="swiftype" name="content" data-type="text" content="If RecordGram has its way, top record producers will all turn to their app, a kind of mobile recording studio, to find the next Justin Bieber or Nicki Minaj. And aspiring artists will all find beats, create songs and get signed to their first label through RecordGram. The company is an alumnus of the Nashville-based music accelerator Project Music, and was co-founded by Grammy-winning music producer Winston &quot;DJ Blackout” Thomas; Erik Mendelson, a veteran of radio and digital music; and hip-hop’s Shawn Mims, who is best known for his song “This is Why I’m Hot.” Aspiring musicians open RecordGram, land on a music page where they can search for beats by genre, tempo or mood. When they find one they like, they can upload it&nbsp;to a virtual, private recording studio with a notepad. There they can write lyrics as the beat loops. They push a button to start recording vocals into a multi-track system. The RecordGram app merges up to six tracks to record a professional-sounding audio…">

  <script>
	var setAdblockerCookie = function(adblocker) {
	    var d = new Date();
	    d.setTime(d.getTime() + 60 * 60 * 24 * 30 * 1000);
	    document.cookie = "__adblocker=" + (adblocker ? "true" : "false") + "; expires=" + d.toUTCString() + "; path=/";
	}
	var script = document.createElement("script");
	script.setAttribute("async", true);
	script.setAttribute("src", "//www.npttech.com/advertising.js");
	script.setAttribute("onerror", "setAdblockerCookie(true);");
	script.setAttribute("onload", "setAdblockerCookie(false);");
	document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(script);
</script> 
  <header class="header header-fixed-mobile cf header-context-news" role="banner">

	(function(window,$){

			if ( !window.ads.isAdPageSet ){
				if ( typeof window.adSetAdURL == 'function' ) {
					window.adSetAdURL('/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/_uac/adpage.html');

					window.adsResizePortrait('1');

       <h2>Hi!</h2> 
       <p> You are about to activate our Facebook Messenger news bot. Once subscribed, the bot will send you a digest of trending stories once a day. You can also customize the types of stories it sends you. </p>

       <div class="fb-messenger-iframe"> 
        <div class="fb-send-to-messenger" id="fb-send-to-messenger" messenger_app_id="1678638095724206" page_id="8062627951" color="blue" size="large" data-ref="tcnav"></div> 
        <script>
		  window.fbAsyncInit = function() {
		    FB.init({
		      appId      : '1678638095724206',
		      xfbml      : true,
		      version    : 'v2.6'
		    });
			FB.Event.subscribe('xfbml.render', function() {
				jQuery('.fb-messenger-loading').detach()
			});
		  };

		  (function(d, s, id){
		     var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
		     if (d.getElementById(id)) {return;}
		     js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id;
		     js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_US/sdk.js";
		     fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
		   }(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));

		   function getCookie(name) {
		      var matches = document.cookie.match(new RegExp(
		        "(?:^|; )" + name.replace(/([\.$?*|{}\(\)\[\]\\\/\+^])/g, '\\$1') + "=([^;]*)"
		      ));
		      return matches ? decodeURIComponent(matches[1]) : undefined;
		   }

		   window.onload = function() {
		     var gravity_guid = getCookie('grvinsights');
		     var btn = document.getElementById('fb-send-to-messenger');
		     if (btn != undefined && btn != null) {
			   btn.setAttribute('data-ref', gravity_guid)
			 }
		   }

		</script> 
       </div>

    <!-- Begin: Article - Primary --> 
    <article class="article lc"> 
     <div class="l-two-col-expose"> 
      <!-- Begin: Article Content - Body Right Column --> 
      <div class="l-main-container"> 
       <div class="l-main"> 
        <!-- Begin: Article Header --> 
        <header class="article-header page-title"> 
         <!-- Begin: Article Eyebrows --> 
         <div class="tags"> 
          <div class="tag-item"> 
           <a href="https://techcrunch.com/apps/" class="tag" data-omni-sm="art_articlecategory">Apps</a> 
           <div class="links" id="tc-tag-item-apps"> 
            <ul class="recirc-river river-small g g-1-2-1"> 
             <li> 
              <div class="block-small"> 
               <a class="block-wrapper" href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/deepmind-nhs-health-data-deal-had-no-lawful-basis/"> <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2016/05/p1040482.jpg?w=150" alt="DeepMind NHS health data deal had ‘no lawful&nbsp;basis’"> 
                <div class="block-content"> 
                 <h3>DeepMind NHS health data deal had ‘no lawful&nbsp;basis’</h3> 
                 <div class="block-meta"> 
                  <div class="byline"> 
                   <time datetime="2017-05-15 14:54:21"></time> 
                  </div> 
                 </div> 
                </div> </a> 
              </div> </li> 
             <li>

         <!-- End: Article Eyebrows --> 
         <h1 class="alpha tweet-title">RecordGram thinks your phone is the new recording studio</h1> 
         <div class="title-left"> 
          <div class="byline">
            Posted 
           <time datetime="2017-05-15" class="timestamp">10 hours ago</time> by 
           <a href="/author/lora-kolodny/" title="Posts by Lora Kolodny" onclick="s_objectID='river_author';" rel="author">Lora Kolodny</a> 
           <span class="twitter-handle">(<a href="https://twitter.com/lorakolodny" rel="external">@lorakolodny</a>)</span>
          </div> 
          <!-- Begin: Social Share Icons --> 
          <div class="social-share social-share-inline"> 
           <ul class="inline-list social-share-list" id="social-share" data-permalink="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/recordgram-thinks-your-phone-is-the-new-recording-studio/" data-shortlink="http://tcrn.ch/2pP4lYA" data-sharetitle="RecordGram thinks your phone is the new recording&nbsp;studio" data-post-id="1490621" data-twitter-hash="#TCDisrupt"> 
            <li class="total-shares"> <h5 class="total-shares-count">0</h5><br> <small>SHARES</small> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#comments" rel="external" class="comment icon-comment launch-social-load"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="facebook icon-facebook"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="twitter icon-twitter"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="linkedin icon-linkedin"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="google-plus icon-google-plus"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="reddit icon-reddit"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="stumbleupon icon-stumbleupon"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="email icon-email"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="flipboard icon-flipboard"></a> </li> 
           </ul> 
          </div> 
          <div class="social-share social-share-fixed"> 
           <div class="less"> 
            <a class="blank"></a> 
            <a class="icon-flipboard" href="#"></a> 
            <a class="icon-stumbleupon" href="#"></a> 
            <a class="icon-reddit" href="#"></a> 
            <a class="icon-email" href="#"></a>

            <a class="icon-whatsapp" href="#"></a> 
            <a class="icon-email" href="#"></a> 
           </div> 
          </div> 
          <!-- End: Social Share Icons --> 
         </div> 
         <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/uploadvr-sued-over-rampant-sexual-behavior-in-the-workplace-and-wrongful-termination/" class="next-link" data-omni-sm="art_nextstory"> 
          <div class="next-story-link">
           Next Story
          </div> 
          <div class="next-story-full"> 
           <h4 class="next-title">UploadVR sued over ‘rampant’ sexual behavior in the workplace and wrongful&nbsp;termination</h4> 
          </div> </a> 
        </header> 
        <!-- End: Article Header --> 
        <!-- Begin: Article Body --> 
        <div class="l-two-col"> 
         <!-- Begin: Article Body - Main --> 
         <div class="l-main-container"> 
          <div class="l-main"> 
           <div class="article-entry text"> 
            <!-- Begin: Wordpress Article Content --> 
            <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8922.jpg?w=738" class=""> 
            <p id="speakable-summary">If <a target="_blank" href="https://www.recordgram.com" rel="noopener noreferrer">RecordGram</a> has its way, top record producers will all turn to their app, a kind of mobile recording studio, to find the next Justin Bieber or Nicki Minaj. And aspiring artists will all find beats, create songs and get signed to their first label through RecordGram.</p> 
            <p>The company is an alumnus of the Nashville-based music accelerator <a target="_blank" href="http://www.ec.co/projectmusic/" rel="noopener noreferrer">Project Music</a>, and was co-founded by Grammy-winning music producer Winston “<a target="_blank" href="http://djblackout.com" rel="noopener noreferrer">DJ Blackout</a>” Thomas; Erik Mendelson, a veteran of radio and digital music; and hip-hop’s Shawn Mims, who is best known for his song “<a target="_blank" href="http://djblackout.com" rel="noopener noreferrer">This is Why I’m Hot.</a>”</p> 
            <p>Aspiring musicians open RecordGram, land on a music page where they can search for beats by genre, tempo or mood. When they find one they like, they can upload it&nbsp;to a virtual, private recording studio with a notepad. There they can write lyrics as the beat loops. They push a button to start recording vocals into a multi-track system.</p> 
            <p>The RecordGram app merges up to six tracks to record a professional-sounding audio file. Musicians also can use the app to make a professional-looking music video to accompany their songs, and share those on platforms like Instagram or YouTube, or privately with producers.</p> 
            <div class="slideshow slideshowify"> 
             <ol>
              <li> 
               <div class="image">
                <img data-thumb="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8915.jpg?w=80&amp;h=60&amp;crop=1" data-full-size-image="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8915.jpg" data-large-size-image="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8915.jpg?w=1&amp;h=1" data-trigger-notification="1" data-scalable="false" alt="" data-src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8915.jpg?w=1&amp;h=1" data-tc-lazyload="deferred" src="https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/assets/images/1x1.png" width="1" height="1">

               <div class="image">

                RecordGram presents at Startup Battlefield at TechCrunch Disrupt NY 2017
               </div> 
               <div class="credit"></div> </li>
              <li> 
               <div class="image">
                <img data-thumb="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8919.jpg?w=80&amp;h=60&amp;crop=1" data-full-size-image="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8919.jpg" data-large-size-image="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8919.jpg?w=1&amp;h=1" data-trigger-notification="1" data-scalable="false" alt="" data-src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8919.jpg?w=1&amp;h=1" data-tc-lazyload="deferred" src="https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/assets/images/1x1.png" width="1" height="1">

               <div class="image">

                RecordGram presents at Startup Battlefield at TechCrunch Disrupt NY 2017
               </div> 
               <div class="credit"></div> </li>
              <li> 
               <div class="image">
                <img data-thumb="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8909.jpg?w=80&amp;h=60&amp;crop=1" data-full-size-image="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8909.jpg" data-large-size-image="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8909.jpg?w=1&amp;h=1" data-trigger-notification="1" data-scalable="false" alt="" data-src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8909.jpg?w=1&amp;h=1" data-tc-lazyload="deferred" src="https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/assets/images/1x1.png" width="1" height="1">
               </div> <h3 class="title">RecordGram presents at Startup Battlefield at TechCrunch Disrupt NY 2017</h3> 
               <div class="caption">
                RecordGram presents at Startup Battlefield at TechCrunch Disrupt NY 2017
               </div> 
               <div class="credit"></div> </li>
              <li> 
               <div class="image">
                <img data-thumb="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8912.jpg?w=80&amp;h=60&amp;crop=1" data-full-size-image="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8912.jpg" data-large-size-image="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8912.jpg?w=1&amp;h=1" data-trigger-notification="1" data-scalable="false" alt="" data-src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8912.jpg?w=1&amp;h=1" data-tc-lazyload="deferred" src="https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/assets/images/1x1.png" width="1" height="1">
               </div> <h3 class="title">RecordGram presents at Startup Battlefield at TechCrunch Disrupt NY 2017</h3> 
               <div class="caption">
                RecordGram presents at Startup Battlefield at TechCrunch Disrupt NY 2017
               </div> 
               <div class="credit"></div> </li>
             </ol> 
             <div class="enter-wrapper"> 
              <a class="enter" href="#">&nbsp;<span class="enter-text">View Slideshow</span></a> 
             </div> 
             <div class="controls"> 
              <a class="prev icon-arrow-left" href="#"><span class="is-vishidden">Previous</span></a> 
              <a class="next icon-arrow" href="#"><span class="is-vishidden">Next</span></a> 
              <a class="exit" href="#">Exit</a> 
             </div> 
            </div> 
            <p>Mendelson said the company plans to generate revenue by charging producers a $90 annual subscription, or $9.99 monthly fee, to upload to their platform 15 beats (songs without lyrics) per month. Producers can offer to lease the tracks, non-exclusively, for up to $4.99 to aspiring artists.</p> 
            <p>Producers like this app, the founders said, because they retain 100 percent of the copyrights on their own beats, while hearing how they sound paired with fresh voices and new talents who they may not have met offline.</p>
            <div>
             <div id="adsDivacc5b65879" class="native-ad-mobile"></div>
            </div> 
            <p>Producers already participating in RecordGram include Streetrunner, who is known for his work with Eminem, and Supa Dupa, who is known for his work with Drake and Bruno Mars, and Lex Luger, a co-founder of 808 Mafia.</p> 
            <p>RecordGram pitched judges at TechCrunch’s Startup Battlefield in New York today. The company was a “wildcard” contender; when they woke up today they didn’t know they’d be appearing onstage in front of seasoned venture capitalists.</p> 
            <p>We asked the founders why, given their success in the creative side of the music industry, they wanted to get involved in running a tech startup. Mendelson said, “It’s par for the course. Music is always changing and we’re riding the wave. People forget that YouTube sounded horrible and was relatively new when Justin Bieber was discovered there.”</p> 
            <p>Thomas added, “You’ll notice more than a few musicians jumping into tech, Nas, Chamillionaire, Pharrell… There’s a lot of talent out there in search of help creating a sound and getting discovered. And there are producers trying to figure out how to make a living in a post-Spotify, post-Apple world of streaming music.”</p> 
            <p>The company thinks of its app as a platform that singers and rappers can use if karaoke and lip dub apps, like&nbsp;Musical.ly and Smule, don’t fulfill all their creative dreams.</p> 
            <div class="vdb_player vdb_56df4e9de4b0c9c31d626c18564f313b67b6231408bc51ee" vdb_params=""> 
             <script type="text/javascript" src="//delivery.vidible.tv/jsonp/pid=56df4e9de4b0c9c31d626c18/vid=591a28c78c08e06cefdeef5d/564f313b67b6231408bc51ee.js"></script> 
            </div>

			$('.article-entry').append($(document.getElementById('taboola-below-article-thumbnails')).detach());
		}

		_taboola.push(
			{ mode: 'thumbnails-a', container: 'taboola-below-article-thumbnails', placement: 'Below Article Thumbnails', target_type: 'mix' }
		);
	})(window.jQuery);
</script>
           <div class="ad-cluster-container">

       <div id="adsDivd413bf0405" class="mobile-ads-center"></div> 
       <script>
/* <![CDATA[ */
if (ads.isMobile()) {
	(function(window,$){
		window.TechCrunch.loader.on('tc_ads_wrapper_omniture', function(){
			if ( !window.ads.isAdPageSet ){
				if ( typeof window.adSetAdURL == 'function' ) {
					window.adSetAdURL('/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/_uac/adpage.html');
					window.ads.isAdPageSet = true;
				}
				if ( typeof window.adsResizePortrait === 'function' ) {
					window.adsResizePortrait('1');
				}
				window.console.log('ADS WIDTH:');
				window.console.log(ads);
			}
			window.adSetOthAT('kventryid=1490621;kvcmsid=tcr:1490621;kvugc=0;kvsubj=979432:981391:981411:982340:982665:6325647:978489:982087:6379724:6379725:983462;kvent=6081317:5995830:3829539:5970758:5992875:6066823:1004200:2781735:4183472:4960730:4993220:5502849:5763664:5774317:5885315:5995418:6079559');
			window.adSetInView('1');
			window.htmlAdWH('93484973', "mm", "mm", 'f', 'adsDivd413bf0405');
		});
	}(this,this.jQuery));
}
/* ]]> */
</script>
      </div> 
     </div> 
    </div>

  <script type="application/ld+json">
		{"@context":"http:\/\/schema.org","@type":"Article","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2017\/05\/15\/recordgram-thinks-your-phone-is-the-new-recording-studio\/","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Lora Kolodny"},"headline":"RecordGram is a mobile recording studio","articleBody":"If RecordGram has its way, top record producers will all turn to their app, a kind of mobile recording studio, to find the next Justin Bieber or Nicki Minaj. And aspiring artists will all find beats, create songs and get signed to their first label through RecordGram.\n\nThe company is an alumnus of the Nashville-based music accelerator Project Music, and was co-founded by Grammy-winning music producer Winston \"DJ Blackout\u201d Thomas; Erik Mendelson, a veteran of radio and digital music; and hip-hop\u2019s Shawn Mims, who is best known for his song \u201cThis is Why I\u2019m Hot.\u201d\n\nAspiring musicians open RecordGram, land on a music page where they can search for beats by genre, tempo or mood. When they find one they like, they can upload it\u00a0to a virtual, private recording studio with a notepad. There they can write lyrics as the beat loops. They push a button to start recording vocals into a multi-track system.\n\nThe RecordGram app merges up to six tracks to record a professional-sounding audio file. Musicians also can use the app to make a professional-looking music video to accompany their songs, and share those on platforms like Instagram or YouTube, or privately with producers.\n\n\n\nMendelson said the company plans to generate revenue by charging producers a $90 annual subscription, or $9.99 monthly fee, to upload to their platform 15 beats (songs without lyrics) per month. Producers can offer to lease the tracks, non-exclusively, for up to $4.99 to aspiring artists.\n\nProducers like this app, the founders said, because they retain 100 percent of the copyrights on their own beats, while hearing how they sound paired with fresh voices and new talents who they may not have met offline.\n\nProducers already participating in RecordGram include Streetrunner, who is known for his work with Eminem, and Supa Dupa, who is known for his work with Drake and Bruno Mars, and Lex Luger, a co-founder of 808 Mafia.\n\nRecordGram pitched judges at TechCrunch's Startup Battlefield in New York today. The company was a \u201cwildcard\u201d contender; when they woke up today they didn\u2019t know they\u2019d be appearing onstage in front of seasoned venture capitalists.\n\nWe asked the founders why, given their success in the creative side of the music industry, they wanted to get involved in running a tech startup. Mendelson said, \u201cIt\u2019s par for the course. Music is always changing and we\u2019re riding the wave. People forget that YouTube sounded horrible and was relatively new when Justin Bieber was discovered there.\u201d\n\nThomas added, \u201cYou\u2019ll notice more than a few musicians jumping into tech, Nas, Chamillionaire, Pharrell\u2026 There\u2019s a lot of talent out there in search of help creating a sound and getting discovered. And there are producers trying to figure out how to make a living in a post-Spotify, post-Apple world of streaming music.\u201d\n\nThe company thinks of its app as a platform that singers and rappers can use if karaoke and lip dub apps, like\u00a0Musical.ly and Smule, don't fulfill all their creative dreams.\n\n","datePublished":"2017-05-15T22:06:18+00:00","mainEntityOfPage":"True","image":{"@list":["https:\/\/tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com\/2017\/05\/tcdisrupt-ny17-8922.jpg"]},"speakable":{"@type":"SpeakableSpecification","cssSelector":[".alpha","#speakable-summary"]}}	</script>

	//method provided by adobe : https://marketing.adobe.com/resources/help/en_US/sc/implement/getVisitNum.html
	/*                                                                 
	* Plugin: getVisitNum - version 3.0
	*/
	var s = window.s_265;
	window.s_265.getVisitNum=new Function("tp","c","c2",""
	+"var s=this,e=new Date,cval,cvisit,ct=e.getTime(),d;if(!tp){tp='m';}"
	+"if(tp=='m'||tp=='w'||tp=='d'){eo=s.endof(tp),y=eo.getTime();e.setTi"
	+"me(y);}else {d=tp*86400000;e.setTime(ct+d);}if(!c){c='s_vnum';}if(!"
	+"c2){c2='s_invisit';}cval=s.c_r(c);if(cval){var i=cval.indexOf('&vn="
	+"'),str=cval.substring(i+4,cval.length),k;}cvisit=s.c_r(c2);if(cvisi"
	+"t){if(str){e.setTime(ct+1800000);s.c_w(c2,'true',e);return str;}els"
	+"e {return 'unknown visit number';}}else {if(str){str++;k=cval.substri"
	+"ng(0,i);e.setTime(k);s.c_w(c,k+'&vn='+str,e);e.setTime(ct+1800000);"
	+"s.c_w(c2,'true',e);return str;}else {s.c_w(c,e.getTime()+'&vn=1',e)"
	+";e.setTime(ct+1800000);s.c_w(c2,'true',e);return 1;}}");
	s.dimo=new Function("m","y",""
	+"var d=new Date(y,m+1,0);return d.getDate();");
	s.endof=new Function("x",""
	+"var t=new Date;t.setHours(0);t.setMinutes(0);t.setSeconds(0);if(x=="
	+"'m'){d=s.dimo(t.getMonth(),t.getFullYear())-t.getDate()+1;}else if("
	+"x=='w'){d=7-t.getDay();}else {d=1;}t.setDate(t.getDate()+d);return "
	+"t;");

		function addLoadEvent(func) {
			var oldonload = window.onload;
			if (typeof window.onload != 'function') {
				window.onload = func;
			} else {
				window.onload = function () {
					oldonload();
					func();
				}
			}
		}

  <script>
			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
				// Get all existing values from the cookie
				var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
				// Set the value
				cookieValue[name] = value;

				// Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
				var d = new Date();
				d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
				var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();


									var domain = 'techcrunch.com';
				
				// Write the cookie value
				document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=."+domain;
			}

						

			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
			    // Get all existing values from the cookie
			    var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
			    // Set the value
			    cookieValue[name] = value;

			    // Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
			    var d = new Date();
			    d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
			    var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();

			    // Write the cookie value
			    document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=.tcpreprod.com";
			}

			/**
			 * Read values from cookie and convert them from json
			 * @param specificName (optional) Name specific value from the set
			 * @returns {*} If specificName is specified - returns single value, otherwise returns JSON object with all values
			 */
			function pianoReadCustomVariableCookie(specificName) {
			    var cookieValue;
			    try {
			        // Try to get the cookie value with regexp
			        var match = document.cookie.match(new RegExp('(^| )__pcvc=([^;]+)'));
			        if (match) {
			            // If cookie with this name was found - try to parse the JSON value
			            cookieValue = JSON.parse(match[2]);
			        }
			    }
			    catch (e) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (!cookieValue) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (typeof specificName != "undefined") {
			        // Get the specific value from the set
			        if (typeof cookieValue[specificName] != "undefined") {
			            return cookieValue[specificName];
			        }
			        return null;
			    }
			    return cookieValue;
			}

			/**
			 * Function to send data upstream to Piano template
			 * @param iframeId - Element id of the Piano iframe
			 * @param success - true/false. Status of the message
			 * @param message - Error message text
			 * @param object - Additional data, like the the field that triggered the error
			 */
			function sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, success, message, object) {
			    var iframe = jQuery('#' + iframeId);

			    if (iframe.length) {
			        iframe[0].contentWindow.postMessage({
			            piano: {
			                success: success,
			                message: message,
			                object: object
			            }
			        }, '*');
			    }
			}

			tp = window.tp || [];

			tp.push(["addHandler", "customEvent", function (event, b, c, d) {
			    switch (event.eventName) {
			        // Don't show me this again
			        case 'dont-show':
			            pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('dontshow', 'y');
			            tp.offer.close();
			            break;

			        case 'tc-signup-newsletters':
			            console.log(event);
			            var email = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.email != 'undefined') && (event.params.email.length > 0)) {
			                email = event.params.email;
			            }

			            var object = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.object != 'undefined') && (event.params.object.length > 0)) {
			                object = event.params.object;
			            }

			            var list = [];
			            if ((typeof event.params.list != 'undefined') && (event.params.list.length > 0)) {
			                list = JSON.parse(event.params.list);
			            }

			            var iframeId;

			            // We are parsing the params object sent from the template to find out which iframe triggered it
			            params = JSON.parse(event.params.params);
			            // And here's the iframeId we're looking for
			            iframeId = params.iframeId;

			            //grab the security string from the from the form
			            //on the page, needed for check in the backend
			            var $form = jQuery('.form-newsletters');
			            var url = '/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php';
			            var nonce = $form.data('nonce');


			            if (email == undefined || email == '') {
			                return;
			            }

			            var emailLists = [];
			            for (var i in list){
			                if (list[i]){
			                    emailLists.push(i);
			                }
			            }

			            var jqxhr = jQuery.get(url, {
			                action: "newsletters",
			                subaction: "subscribe",
			                email_lists: emailLists,
			                email: email,
			                tracking_id: event.params.tracking_id,
			                security: nonce
			            }, function (data) {
			                if (!data.success){
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, false, data.data.message, object)
			                }
			                else{
			                    // When the email was added - set the cookie
			                    pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('newsletter', 'y');
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, true, "");
			                }
			            });
			            break;
			    }
			}]);

			// Read all values from cookie
			var cookieValues = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();

			for (var i in cookieValues) {
			    // Set custom variables from cookie
			    tp.push(['setCustomVariable', i, cookieValues[i]]);
			}



		</script>

The virtual reality startup, with offices in San Francisco and Los Angeles, consists of&nbsp;co-working spaces, training courses and a media publication, and has received funding from General Catalyst,&nbsp;Greycroft, Colopl and others. Other defendants named in the suit include&nbsp;UploadVR co-founders Will Mason and Taylor Freeman. Freeman currently serves as CEO. Mason holds the role of president; previously he was&nbsp;editor-in-chief of the company’s&nbsp;publication. Mason and Freeman were recently named in the media section of Forbes’ 30 under 30 list. The lawsuit alleges that UploadVR’s co-founders sought to create a “boy’s club” environment and that the virtual reality startup’s SF office was a hostile environment for female employees. &quot;The atmosphere and work environment at UploadVR was…">

		//function to be used by google recaptcha
		var newsletterRecaptchaClbk = function(){
			jQuery( ".form-newsletters" ).submit();
		}	
	</script> 
 </head> 
 <body class="post-template-default single single-post postid-1490412 single-format-standard mobile-header-ad mp6 customizer-styles-applied highlander-enabled highlander-light single-post-mobile-collapse single-post-standard">

	var setAdblockerCookie = function(adblocker) {
	    var d = new Date();
	    d.setTime(d.getTime() + 60 * 60 * 24 * 30 * 1000);
	    document.cookie = "__adblocker=" + (adblocker ? "true" : "false") + "; expires=" + d.toUTCString() + "; path=/";
	}
	var script = document.createElement("script");
	script.setAttribute("async", true);
	script.setAttribute("src", "//www.npttech.com/advertising.js");
	script.setAttribute("onerror", "setAdblockerCookie(true);");
	script.setAttribute("onload", "setAdblockerCookie(false);");
	document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(script);
</script>

       <h2>Hi!</h2> 
       <p> You are about to activate our Facebook Messenger news bot. Once subscribed, the bot will send you a digest of trending stories once a day. You can also customize the types of stories it sends you. </p>

       <div class="fb-messenger-loading"></div> 
       <div class="fb-messenger-iframe"> 
        <div class="fb-send-to-messenger" id="fb-send-to-messenger" messenger_app_id="1678638095724206" page_id="8062627951" color="blue" size="large" data-ref="tcnav"></div> 
        <script>
		  window.fbAsyncInit = function() {
		    FB.init({
		      appId      : '1678638095724206',
		      xfbml      : true,
		      version    : 'v2.6'
		    });
			FB.Event.subscribe('xfbml.render', function() {
				jQuery('.fb-messenger-loading').detach()
			});
		  };

		  (function(d, s, id){
		     var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
		     if (d.getElementById(id)) {return;}
		     js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id;
		     js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_US/sdk.js";
		     fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
		   }(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));

		   function getCookie(name) {
		      var matches = document.cookie.match(new RegExp(
		        "(?:^|; )" + name.replace(/([\.$?*|{}\(\)\[\]\\\/\+^])/g, '\\$1') + "=([^;]*)"
		      ));
		      return matches ? decodeURIComponent(matches[1]) : undefined;
		   }

		   window.onload = function() {
		     var gravity_guid = getCookie('grvinsights');
		     var btn = document.getElementById('fb-send-to-messenger');
		     if (btn != undefined && btn != null) {
			   btn.setAttribute('data-ref', gravity_guid)
			 }
		   }

		</script> 
       </div> 
      </div>

  <div role="main" class="fluid" style=""> 
   <!-- Begin: Article - Primary --> 
   <article class="article lc"> 
    <div class="l-two-col-expose"> 
     <!-- Begin: Article Content - Body Right Column --> 
     <div class="l-main-container"> 
      <div class="l-main"> 
       <!-- Begin: Article Header --> 
       <header class="article-header page-title"> 
        <!-- Begin: Article Eyebrows --> 
        <div class="tags"> 
         <div class="tag-item"> 
          <a href="https://techcrunch.com/startups/" class="tag" data-omni-sm="art_articlecategory">Startups</a> 
          <div class="links" id="tc-tag-item-startups"> 
           <ul class="recirc-river river-small g g-1-2-1"> 
            <li> 
             <div class="block-small"> 
              <a class="block-wrapper" href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/talentio-grabs-88-million-for-its-recruitment-platform/"> <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2014/08/old-school-resume.jpg?w=150" alt="Talent.io grabs $8.8 million for its recruitment&nbsp;platform"> 
               <div class="block-content"> 
                <h3>Talent.io grabs $8.8 million for its recruitment&nbsp;platform</h3> 
                <div class="block-meta"> 
                 <div class="byline"> 
                  <time datetime="2017-05-15 22:01:01"></time> 
                 </div> 
                </div> 
               </div> </a> 
             </div> </li> 
            <li> 
             <div class="block-small"> 
              <a class="block-wrapper" href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/credithero-wants-to-help-fix-credit-scores-for-those-afraid-to-even-look/"> <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/147a1308.jpg?w=150" alt="CreditHero wants to help fix credit scores for those afraid to even&nbsp;look"> 
               <div class="block-content">

        <!-- End: Article Eyebrows --> 
        <h1 class="alpha tweet-title">UploadVR sued over ‘rampant’ sexual behavior in the workplace and wrongful termination</h1> 
        <div class="title-left"> 
         <div class="byline">
           Posted 
          <time datetime="2017-05-15" class="timestamp">10 hours ago</time> by 
          <a href="/author/lucas-matney/" title="Posts by Lucas Matney" onclick="s_objectID='river_author';" rel="author">Lucas Matney</a> 
          <span class="twitter-handle">(<a href="https://twitter.com/lucas_matney" rel="external">@lucas_matney</a>)</span>
         </div> 
         <!-- Begin: Social Share Icons --> 
         <div class="social-share social-share-inline"> 
          <ul class="inline-list social-share-list" id="social-share" data-permalink="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/uploadvr-sued-over-rampant-sexual-behavior-in-the-workplace-and-wrongful-termination/" data-shortlink="http://tcrn.ch/2qliznc" data-sharetitle="UploadVR sued over ‘rampant’ sexual behavior in the workplace and wrongful" data-post-id="1490412" data-twitter-hash=""> 
           <li class="total-shares"> <h5 class="total-shares-count">0</h5><br> <small>SHARES</small> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#comments" rel="external" class="comment icon-comment launch-social-load"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="facebook icon-facebook"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="twitter icon-twitter"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="linkedin icon-linkedin"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="google-plus icon-google-plus"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="reddit icon-reddit"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="stumbleupon icon-stumbleupon"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="email icon-email"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="flipboard icon-flipboard"></a> </li> 
          </ul> 
         </div> 
         <div class="social-share social-share-fixed"> 
          <div class="less"> 
           <a class="blank"></a> 
           <a class="icon-flipboard" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-stumbleupon" href="#"></a>

         <!-- End: Social Share Icons --> 
        </div> 
        <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/hackers-claim-to-have-looted-some-treasure-from-disneys-magic-kingdom/" class="next-link" data-omni-sm="art_nextstory"> 
         <div class="next-story-link">
          Next Story
         </div> 
         <div class="next-story-full"> 
          <h4 class="next-title">Hackers claim to have looted some treasure from Disney’s ‘Magic&nbsp;Kingdom’</h4> 
         </div> </a> 
       </header> 
       <!-- End: Article Header --> 
       <!-- Begin: Article Body --> 
       <div class="l-two-col"> 
        <!-- Begin: Article Body - Main --> 
        <div class="l-main-container"> 
         <div class="l-main"> 
          <div class="article-entry text"> 
           <!-- Begin: Wordpress Article Content --> 
           <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/upload_office.jpeg?w=738" class=""> 
           <p class="p1"><a target="_blank" href="https://upload.io/" rel="noopener noreferrer">UploadVR</a>&nbsp;is being sued by the company’s former Director of Digital and Social Media for sexual harassment, sex and gender discrimination and wrongful termination, TechCrunch has learned.</p> 
           <p class="p1">The virtual reality startup, with offices in San Francisco and Los Angeles, consists of&nbsp;co-working spaces, training courses and a media publication, and has received funding from General Catalyst,&nbsp;Greycroft, Colopl and others.</p> 
           <p class="p1">Other defendants named in the suit include&nbsp;UploadVR co-founders Will Mason and Taylor Freeman. Freeman currently serves as CEO. Mason holds the role of president; previously he was&nbsp;editor-in-chief of the company’s&nbsp;<a target="_blank" href="https://uploadvr.com/" rel="noopener noreferrer">publication</a>.</p> 
           <p class="p1">Mason and Freeman were <a target="_blank" href="https://www.forbes.com/pictures/gfgl45glef/taylor-freeman-26-will/#96349453f971" rel="noopener noreferrer">recently named</a> in the media section of Forbes’ 30 under 30 list.</p> 
           <p class="p1">The <a target="_blank" href="https://webapps.sftc.org/ci/CaseInfo.dll?CaseNum=CGC17558730&amp;SessionID=424848876680F7E1AFC350467248DC004D237286" rel="noopener noreferrer">lawsuit</a> alleges that UploadVR’s co-founders sought to create a “boy’s club” environment and that the virtual reality startup’s SF office was a hostile environment for female employees.</p> 
           <blockquote> 
            <p class="p1">“The atmosphere and work environment at UploadVR was marked by rampant sexual behavior and focus, creating an unbearable environment for Plaintiff and other female employees.</p> 
            <p class="p1">“Defendants purposefully and expressly created a ‘boy’s club environment at work, focused on sex and degrading women, including female employees.”</p> 
           </blockquote> 
           <p class="p1">UploadVR hosts a number of parties&nbsp;at the startup’s offices and at other venues during conferences. The startup&nbsp;has collaborated with a number of high-profile tech companies to host many of these parties.</p> 
           <p class="p1">The lawsuit alleges that Upload VR’s co-founders would discuss “how many girls they were going to have sex with” at the company’s parties. A room in the office with a bed was allegedly designated as the “kink room,” where employees would have sex.</p> 
           <blockquote> 
            <p class="p1">“In the office, Defendants would frequently talk about how much sex they were going to have at each party, and how many girls they were going to have sex with. UploadVR even set up a room to encourage sexual intercourse at the workplace. The room was referred to as the “kink room” and contained a bed. Male employees used that room to have sexual intercourse, which was disruptive and inappropriate. Often, underwear and condom wrappers would be found in the room.”</p> 
           </blockquote> 
           <p class="p1">The lawsuit describes another incident where the company rented a home for its employees to stay during a conference in LA and a party was thrown where one of the male employees invited prostitutes and strippers.</p>
           <div>
            <div id="adsDivd213bae967" class="native-ad-mobile"></div>
           </div> 
           <p class="p1">There are numerous other encounters described in the suit:</p> 
           <blockquote> 
            <p class="p1">“Male employees, including Mason and Freeman, would even speak sexually about women that worked in the office, right in front of them. For example, male employees stated how they were sexually aroused by female employees and how it was hard to concentrate and be productive when all they could think about was having sex with them.”</p> 
           </blockquote> 
           <p class="p1">Aside from the accusations that the co-founders were operating a “sexually-focused” work environment, the lawsuit also alleges that women were&nbsp;discriminated against in the office, given menial tasks and were not reimbursed for necessary business expenses. The suit also claims that the company paid male employees more despite sharing the same roles and responsibilities.</p> 
           <p class="p1">In addition to&nbsp;raising many of the issues above, the plaintiff says she was wrongfully terminated. The plaintiff&nbsp;is suing for&nbsp;damages of an unspecified amount.</p> 
           <p class="p1">The plaintiff did not respond to a request for comment. We have reached out to her lawyers and will update if they respond. TechCrunch has&nbsp;reached out for comment from UploadVR.</p> 
           <p class="p1"><strong>Update: TechCrunch has been provided the following statement from defendants Mason and Freeman:</strong></p> 
           <blockquote> 
            <p class="p1">“We cannot comment directly on any pending litigation. What we want to express is that our employees are our greatest asset and the sole reason for the success of this company. We are committed to creating a positive community in VR/AR as well as within our company culture and will work to further develop that mission in the future. We are confident that the true nature of how we treat our employees and how we operate as leaders will shine through this unfortunate situation and confirm that these allegations are&nbsp;entirely&nbsp;without merit.”</p> 
           </blockquote> 
           <p class="p1">You can read the full filing below.</p> 
           <form id="wpcom-iframe-form-1f61d5469c3b8b8b001f2b8ac18d10a8-591ab3a9926d2" target="wpcom-iframe-1f61d5469c3b8b8b001f2b8ac18d10a8-591ab3a9926d2" method="post" action="//wpcomwidgets.com/?wpcom_origin=https%3A%2F%2Ftctechcrunch2011.wordpress.com" style="display: none">

            <input type="hidden" name="webkitallowfullscreen" value="">

            <input type="hidden" name="resize" value="0"> 
            <input type="hidden" name="replace_attributes" value="1"> 
            <input type="hidden" name="fallback" value="<p class=&quot;protected-embed-fallback&quot;>This embed is invalid</p>"> 
            <input type="hidden" name="_data" value=",556a03175cc6c96fab248a4fa5b1037c51d263fe"> 
            <input type="hidden" name="_tag" value="protected-iframe"> 
            <input type="hidden" name="_hash" value="1f61d5469c3b8b8b001f2b8ac18d10a8"> 
           </form> 
           <iframe name="wpcom-iframe-1f61d5469c3b8b8b001f2b8ac18d10a8-591ab3a9926d2" id="wpcom-iframe-1f61d5469c3b8b8b001f2b8ac18d10a8-591ab3a9926d2" frameborder="0" scrolling="no" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen class="wpcom-protected-iframe DC-embed DC-embed-document DV-container"></iframe> 
           <script type="text/javascript">
		( function() {
			var func = function() {
				var iframe_form = document.getElementById('wpcom-iframe-form-1f61d5469c3b8b8b001f2b8ac18d10a8-591ab3a9926d2');
				var iframe = document.getElementById('wpcom-iframe-1f61d5469c3b8b8b001f2b8ac18d10a8-591ab3a9926d2');
				if ( iframe_form && iframe ) {
					iframe_form.submit();
					iframe.onload = function() {
						iframe.contentWindow.postMessage( {
							'msg_type': 'poll_size',
							'frame_id': 'wpcom-iframe-1f61d5469c3b8b8b001f2b8ac18d10a8-591ab3a9926d2'
						}, window.location.protocol + '//wpcomwidgets.com' );
					}
				}

				// Autosize iframe
				var funcSizeResponse = function( e ) {
					var origin = document.createElement( 'a' );
					origin.href = e.origin;

					// Verify message origin
					if ( 'wpcomwidgets.com' !== origin.host )
						return;

					// Verify message is in a format we expect
					if ( 'object' !== typeof e.data || undefined === e.data.msg_type )
						return;

					switch ( e.data.msg_type ) {
						case 'poll_size:response':
							var iframe = document.getElementById( e.data._request.frame_id );

							if ( iframe && '' === iframe.width )
								iframe.width = '100%';
							if ( iframe && '' === iframe.height )
								iframe.height = parseInt( e.data.height );

							return;
						default:
							return;
					}
				}

				if ( 'function' === typeof window.addEventListener ) {
					window.addEventListener( 'message', funcSizeResponse, false );
				} else if ( 'function' === typeof window.attachEvent ) {
					window.attachEvent( 'onmessage', funcSizeResponse );
				}
			}
			if (document.readyState === 'complete') { func.apply(); /* compat for infinite scroll */ }
			else if ( document.addEventListener ) { document.addEventListener( 'DOMContentLoaded', func, false ); }
			else if ( document.attachEvent ) { document.attachEvent( 'onreadystatechange', func ); }
		} )();
		</script>

  <script type="application/ld+json">
		{"@context":"http:\/\/schema.org","@type":"Article","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2017\/05\/15\/uploadvr-sued-over-rampant-sexual-behavior-in-the-workplace-and-wrongful-termination\/","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Lucas Matney"},"headline":"VR startup","articleBody":"UploadVR\u00a0is being sued by the company\u2019s former Director of Digital and Social Media for sexual harassment, sex and gender discrimination and wrongful termination, TechCrunch has learned.\n\nThe virtual reality startup, with offices in San Francisco and Los Angeles, consists of\u00a0co-working spaces, training courses and a media publication, and has received funding from General Catalyst,\u00a0Greycroft, Colopl and others.\n\nOther defendants named in the suit include\u00a0UploadVR co-founders Will Mason and Taylor Freeman. Freeman currently serves as CEO. Mason holds the role of president; previously he was\u00a0editor-in-chief of the company\u2019s\u00a0publication.\n\nMason and Freeman were recently named in the media section of Forbes\u2019 30 under 30 list.\n\nThe lawsuit alleges that UploadVR\u2019s co-founders sought to create a \u201cboy\u2019s club\u201d environment and that the virtual reality startup\u2019s SF office was a hostile environment for female employees.\n\n\n\"The atmosphere and work environment at UploadVR was marked by rampant sexual behavior and focus, creating an unbearable environment for Plaintiff and other female employees.\n\"Defendants purposefully and expressly created a 'boy's club environment at work, focused on sex and degrading women, including female employees.\"\n\n\nUploadVR hosts a number of parties\u00a0at the startup\u2019s offices and at other venues during conferences. The startup\u00a0has collaborated with a number of high-profile tech companies to host many of these parties.\n\nThe lawsuit alleges that Upload VR\u2019s co-founders would discuss \u201chow many girls they were going to have sex with\u201d at the company\u2019s parties. A room in the office with a bed was allegedly designated as the \u201ckink room,\u201d where employees would have sex.\n\n\n\u201cIn the office, Defendants would frequently talk about how much sex they were going to have at each party, and how many girls they were going to have sex with. UploadVR even set up a room to encourage sexual intercourse at the workplace. The room was referred to as the \u201ckink room\u201d and contained a bed. Male employees used that room to have sexual intercourse, which was disruptive and inappropriate. Often, underwear and condom wrappers would be found in the room.\"\n\n\nThe lawsuit describes another incident where the company rented a home for its employees to stay during a conference in LA and a party was thrown where one of the male employees invited prostitutes and strippers.\n\nThere are numerous other encounters described in the suit:\n\n\n\"Male employees, including Mason and Freeman, would even speak sexually about women that worked in the office, right in front of them. For example, male employees stated how they were sexually aroused by female employees and how it was hard to concentrate and be productive when all they could think about was having sex with them.\"\n\n\nAside from the accusations that the co-founders were operating a \u201csexually-focused\u201d work environment, the lawsuit also alleges that women were\u00a0discriminated against in the office, given menial tasks and were not reimbursed for necessary business expenses. The suit also claims that the company paid male employees more despite sharing the same roles and responsibilities.\n\nIn addition to\u00a0raising many of the issues above, the plaintiff says she was wrongfully terminated. The plaintiff\u00a0is suing for\u00a0damages of an unspecified amount.\n\nThe plaintiff did not respond to a request for comment. We have reached out to her lawyers and will update if they respond. TechCrunch has\u00a0reached out for comment from UploadVR.\n\nUpdate: TechCrunch has been provided the following statement from defendants Mason and Freeman:\n\n\n\"We cannot comment directly on any pending litigation. What we want to express is that our employees are our greatest asset and the sole reason for the success of this company. We are committed to creating a positive community in VR\/AR as well as within our company culture and will work to further develop that mission in the future. We are confident that the true nature of how we treat our employees and how we operate as leaders will shine through this unfortunate situation and confirm that these allegations are\u00a0entirely\u00a0without merit.\"\n\n\nYou can read the full filing below.\n\n","datePublished":"2017-05-15T22:04:00+00:00","mainEntityOfPage":"True","image":{"@list":["https:\/\/tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com\/2017\/05\/upload_office.jpeg"]},"speakable":{"@type":"SpeakableSpecification","cssSelector":[".alpha","#speakable-summary"]}}	</script>

			var oldonload = window.onload;
			if (typeof window.onload != 'function') {

			} else {

  <script>
			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
				// Get all existing values from the cookie
				var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
				// Set the value
				cookieValue[name] = value;

				// Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
				var d = new Date();
				d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
				var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();


									var domain = 'techcrunch.com';
				
				// Write the cookie value
				document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=."+domain;
			}

						

			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
			    // Get all existing values from the cookie
			    var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
			    // Set the value
			    cookieValue[name] = value;

			    // Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
			    var d = new Date();
			    d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
			    var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();

			    // Write the cookie value
			    document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=.tcpreprod.com";
			}

			/**
			 * Read values from cookie and convert them from json
			 * @param specificName (optional) Name specific value from the set
			 * @returns {*} If specificName is specified - returns single value, otherwise returns JSON object with all values
			 */
			function pianoReadCustomVariableCookie(specificName) {
			    var cookieValue;
			    try {
			        // Try to get the cookie value with regexp
			        var match = document.cookie.match(new RegExp('(^| )__pcvc=([^;]+)'));
			        if (match) {
			            // If cookie with this name was found - try to parse the JSON value
			            cookieValue = JSON.parse(match[2]);
			        }
			    }
			    catch (e) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (!cookieValue) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (typeof specificName != "undefined") {
			        // Get the specific value from the set
			        if (typeof cookieValue[specificName] != "undefined") {
			            return cookieValue[specificName];
			        }
			        return null;
			    }
			    return cookieValue;
			}

			/**
			 * Function to send data upstream to Piano template
			 * @param iframeId - Element id of the Piano iframe
			 * @param success - true/false. Status of the message
			 * @param message - Error message text
			 * @param object - Additional data, like the the field that triggered the error
			 */
			function sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, success, message, object) {
			    var iframe = jQuery('#' + iframeId);

			    if (iframe.length) {
			        iframe[0].contentWindow.postMessage({
			            piano: {
			                success: success,
			                message: message,
			                object: object
			            }
			        }, '*');
			    }
			}

			tp = window.tp || [];

			tp.push(["addHandler", "customEvent", function (event, b, c, d) {
			    switch (event.eventName) {
			        // Don't show me this again
			        case 'dont-show':
			            pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('dontshow', 'y');
			            tp.offer.close();
			            break;

			        case 'tc-signup-newsletters':
			            console.log(event);
			            var email = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.email != 'undefined') && (event.params.email.length > 0)) {
			                email = event.params.email;
			            }

			            var object = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.object != 'undefined') && (event.params.object.length > 0)) {
			                object = event.params.object;
			            }

			            var list = [];
			            if ((typeof event.params.list != 'undefined') && (event.params.list.length > 0)) {
			                list = JSON.parse(event.params.list);
			            }

			            var iframeId;

			            // We are parsing the params object sent from the template to find out which iframe triggered it
			            params = JSON.parse(event.params.params);
			            // And here's the iframeId we're looking for
			            iframeId = params.iframeId;

			            //grab the security string from the from the form
			            //on the page, needed for check in the backend
			            var $form = jQuery('.form-newsletters');
			            var url = '/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php';
			            var nonce = $form.data('nonce');


			            if (email == undefined || email == '') {
			                return;
			            }

			            var emailLists = [];
			            for (var i in list){
			                if (list[i]){
			                    emailLists.push(i);
			                }
			            }

			            var jqxhr = jQuery.get(url, {
			                action: "newsletters",
			                subaction: "subscribe",
			                email_lists: emailLists,
			                email: email,
			                tracking_id: event.params.tracking_id,
			                security: nonce
			            }, function (data) {
			                if (!data.success){
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, false, data.data.message, object)
			                }
			                else{
			                    // When the email was added - set the cookie
			                    pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('newsletter', 'y');
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, true, "");
			                }
			            });
			            break;
			    }
			}]);

			// Read all values from cookie
			var cookieValues = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();

			for (var i in cookieValues) {
			    // Set custom variables from cookie
			    tp.push(['setCustomVariable', i, cookieValues[i]]);
			}



		</script>

  <meta class="swiftype" name="title" data-type="string" content="Hackers claim to have looted some treasure from Disney’s ‘Magic Kingdom’"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="object_type" data-type="string" content="post"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="url" data-type="enum" content="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/hackers-claim-to-have-looted-some-treasure-from-disneys-magic-kingdom/"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="timestamp" data-type="date" content="2017-05-15 14:58:26"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="content" data-type="text" content="At a town hall meeting in New York earlier today, Disney chief executive Bob Iger said hackers are claiming to have&nbsp;stolen an undisclosed new film from Disney's upcoming slate, according to a report in The Hollywood Reporter.

Needless to say, the king of Disney's castle is refusing to pay the demanded ransom.

Instead, the company is working with federal investigators and holding their breath to see if the online pirates will release their booty into the wild, according to the report.

Citing multiple sources,&nbsp;The Hollywood Reporter wrote that the hackers were demanding a huge ransom in bitcoin be paid out or they'd release the film into the wild.

Specifically, the hackers threatened to release the first five minutes of the film and then the rest of the film in 20-minute sections.

Iger's response? Basically... &quot;Come at me.&quot;



&nbsp;">

	var setAdblockerCookie = function(adblocker) {
	    var d = new Date();
	    d.setTime(d.getTime() + 60 * 60 * 24 * 30 * 1000);
	    document.cookie = "__adblocker=" + (adblocker ? "true" : "false") + "; expires=" + d.toUTCString() + "; path=/";
	}
	var script = document.createElement("script");
	script.setAttribute("async", true);
	script.setAttribute("src", "//www.npttech.com/advertising.js");
	script.setAttribute("onerror", "setAdblockerCookie(true);");
	script.setAttribute("onload", "setAdblockerCookie(false);");
	document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(script);
</script>

        <div class="fb-send-to-messenger" id="fb-send-to-messenger" messenger_app_id="1678638095724206" page_id="8062627951" color="blue" size="large" data-ref="tcnav"></div> 
        <script>
		  window.fbAsyncInit = function() {
		    FB.init({
		      appId      : '1678638095724206',
		      xfbml      : true,
		      version    : 'v2.6'
		    });
			FB.Event.subscribe('xfbml.render', function() {
				jQuery('.fb-messenger-loading').detach()
			});
		  };

		  (function(d, s, id){
		     var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
		     if (d.getElementById(id)) {return;}
		     js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id;
		     js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_US/sdk.js";
		     fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
		   }(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));

		   function getCookie(name) {
		      var matches = document.cookie.match(new RegExp(
		        "(?:^|; )" + name.replace(/([\.$?*|{}\(\)\[\]\\\/\+^])/g, '\\$1') + "=([^;]*)"
		      ));
		      return matches ? decodeURIComponent(matches[1]) : undefined;
		   }

		   window.onload = function() {
		     var gravity_guid = getCookie('grvinsights');
		     var btn = document.getElementById('fb-send-to-messenger');
		     if (btn != undefined && btn != null) {
			   btn.setAttribute('data-ref', gravity_guid)
			 }
		   }

		</script>

        <h1 class="alpha tweet-title">Hackers claim to have looted some treasure from Disney’s ‘Magic Kingdom’</h1> 
        <div class="title-left"> 
         <div class="byline">
           Posted 
          <time datetime="2017-05-15" class="timestamp">10 hours ago</time> by

          <h4 class="next-title">DeepMind NHS health data deal had ‘no lawful&nbsp;basis’</h4>

       <!-- Begin: Article Body --> 
       <div class="l-two-col"> 
        <!-- Begin: Article Body - Main --> 
        <div class="l-main-container"> 
         <div class="l-main"> 
          <div class="article-entry text"> 
           <!-- Begin: Wordpress Article Content --> 
           <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2016/04/shutterstock_313425050.jpg?w=738" class=""> 
           <p id="speakable-summary">At a town hall meeting in New York earlier today, <a target="_blank" href="http://www.disney.com/" rel="noopener noreferrer">Disney</a> chief executive Bob Iger said hackers are claiming to have&nbsp;stolen an undisclosed new film from Disney’s upcoming slate, according to a report in <a target="_blank" href="http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/disney-chief-bob-iger-says-hackers-claim-have-stolen-a-disney-movie-1003949" rel="noopener noreferrer"><em>The Hollywood Reporter</em></a>.</p> 
           <p>Needless to say, the king of Disney’s castle is refusing to pay the demanded ransom.</p> 
           <p>Instead, the company is working with federal investigators and holding their breath to see if the online pirates will release their booty into the wild, according to the report.</p> 
           <p>Citing multiple sources,&nbsp;<em>The Hollywood Reporter</em> wrote that the hackers were demanding a huge ransom in bitcoin be paid out or they’d release the film into the wild.</p> 
           <p>Specifically, the hackers threatened to release the first five minutes of the film and then the rest of the film in 20-minute sections.</p>
           <div>
            <div id="adsDivacc5b65879" class="native-ad-mobile"></div>
           </div> 
           <p>Iger’s response? Basically… “Come at me.”</p> 
           <p><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1236451 img-full" src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2015/11/yoda-disney-infinity.jpg?w=1024&amp;h=490" alt="" width="1024" height="490" srcset="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2015/11/yoda-disney-infinity.jpg?w=1024&amp;h=490 1024w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2015/11/yoda-disney-infinity.jpg?w=150&amp;h=72 150w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2015/11/yoda-disney-infinity.jpg?w=300&amp;h=144 300w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2015/11/yoda-disney-infinity.jpg?w=768&amp;h=367 768w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2015/11/yoda-disney-infinity.jpg?w=680&amp;h=325 680w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2015/11/yoda-disney-infinity.jpg 1112w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px"></p> 
           <p>&nbsp;</p> 
           <!-- End: Wordpress Article Content --> 
           <small>Featured Image: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.shutterstock.com/gallery-631318p1.html">chrisdorney</a>/<a target="_blank" href="http://www.shutterstock.com">Shutterstock</a></small> 
          </div>

			(function(window){
				try {

							window.adSetInView('1');

          <ul class="recirc-river river-small" data-omni-sm-delegate="art_recircbottom"> 
           <div id="grv-personalization-14"></div> 
           <script>if( !ads.isMobile() ){ window.TechCrunch.loader.on( 'gravity-beacon', function(){ window.tc_loadGravityScript( 'recirculation-accordion' ); } ); }</script> 
          </ul> 
         </div> </li> 
       </ul> 
      </div> 
      <!-- End: Recirculation Accordion --> 
     </div> 
     <!-- End: Article Recirculation - Body Left Column --> 
    </div> 
   </article>

	(function(window,$){

			if ( !window.ads.isAdPageSet ){
				if ( typeof window.adSetAdURL == 'function' ) {
					window.adSetAdURL('/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/_uac/adpage.html');
					window.ads.isAdPageSet = true;
				}
				if ( typeof window.adsResizePortrait === 'function' ) {
					window.adsResizePortrait('1');
				}
				window.console.log('ADS WIDTH:');
				window.console.log(ads);
			}

					url = ("https:" === document.location.protocol) ? "https://s3.amazonaws.com/" : "http://";

	/*                                                                 
	* Plugin: getVisitNum - version 3.0
	*/
	var s = window.s_265;
	window.s_265.getVisitNum=new Function("tp","c","c2",""
	+"var s=this,e=new Date,cval,cvisit,ct=e.getTime(),d;if(!tp){tp='m';}"
