	+"c2){c2='s_invisit';}cval=s.c_r(c);if(cval){var i=cval.indexOf('&vn="
	+"'),str=cval.substring(i+4,cval.length),k;}cvisit=s.c_r(c2);if(cvisi"
	+"t){if(str){e.setTime(ct+1800000);s.c_w(c2,'true',e);return str;}els"
	+"e {return 'unknown visit number';}}else {if(str){str++;k=cval.substri"
	+"ng(0,i);e.setTime(k);s.c_w(c,k+'&vn='+str,e);e.setTime(ct+1800000);"
	+"s.c_w(c2,'true',e);return str;}else {s.c_w(c,e.getTime()+'&vn=1',e)"
	+";e.setTime(ct+1800000);s.c_w(c2,'true',e);return 1;}}");
	s.dimo=new Function("m","y",""
	+"var d=new Date(y,m+1,0);return d.getDate();");
	s.endof=new Function("x",""
	+"var t=new Date;t.setHours(0);t.setMinutes(0);t.setSeconds(0);if(x=="
	+"'m'){d=s.dimo(t.getMonth(),t.getFullYear())-t.getDate()+1;}else if("
	+"x=='w'){d=7-t.getDay();}else {d=1;}t.setDate(t.getDate()+d);return "
	+"t;");
</script>

			var oldonload = window.onload;
			if (typeof window.onload != 'function') {
				window.onload = func;
			} else {
				window.onload = function () {
					oldonload();

			(function(src){var a=document.createElement("script");a.type="text/javascript";a.async=true;
			a.src=src;var b=document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];b.parentNode.insertBefore(a,b)})("https://dashboard.tinypass.com/xbuilder/experience/load?aid=Fy7FpgyUxA");

  <script>
			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
				// Get all existing values from the cookie
				var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
				// Set the value
				cookieValue[name] = value;

				// Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
				var d = new Date();
				d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
				var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();


									var domain = 'techcrunch.com';
				
				// Write the cookie value
				document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=."+domain;
			}

						

			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
			    // Get all existing values from the cookie
			    var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
			    // Set the value
			    cookieValue[name] = value;

			    // Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
			    var d = new Date();
			    d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
			    var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();

			    // Write the cookie value
			    document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=.tcpreprod.com";
			}

			/**
			 * Read values from cookie and convert them from json
			 * @param specificName (optional) Name specific value from the set
			 * @returns {*} If specificName is specified - returns single value, otherwise returns JSON object with all values
			 */
			function pianoReadCustomVariableCookie(specificName) {
			    var cookieValue;
			    try {
			        // Try to get the cookie value with regexp
			        var match = document.cookie.match(new RegExp('(^| )__pcvc=([^;]+)'));
			        if (match) {
			            // If cookie with this name was found - try to parse the JSON value
			            cookieValue = JSON.parse(match[2]);
			        }
			    }
			    catch (e) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (!cookieValue) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (typeof specificName != "undefined") {
			        // Get the specific value from the set
			        if (typeof cookieValue[specificName] != "undefined") {
			            return cookieValue[specificName];
			        }
			        return null;
			    }
			    return cookieValue;
			}

			/**
			 * Function to send data upstream to Piano template
			 * @param iframeId - Element id of the Piano iframe
			 * @param success - true/false. Status of the message
			 * @param message - Error message text
			 * @param object - Additional data, like the the field that triggered the error
			 */
			function sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, success, message, object) {
			    var iframe = jQuery('#' + iframeId);

			    if (iframe.length) {
			        iframe[0].contentWindow.postMessage({
			            piano: {
			                success: success,
			                message: message,
			                object: object
			            }
			        }, '*');
			    }
			}

			tp = window.tp || [];

			tp.push(["addHandler", "customEvent", function (event, b, c, d) {
			    switch (event.eventName) {
			        // Don't show me this again
			        case 'dont-show':
			            pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('dontshow', 'y');
			            tp.offer.close();
			            break;

			        case 'tc-signup-newsletters':
			            console.log(event);
			            var email = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.email != 'undefined') && (event.params.email.length > 0)) {
			                email = event.params.email;
			            }

			            var object = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.object != 'undefined') && (event.params.object.length > 0)) {
			                object = event.params.object;
			            }

			            var list = [];
			            if ((typeof event.params.list != 'undefined') && (event.params.list.length > 0)) {
			                list = JSON.parse(event.params.list);
			            }

			            var iframeId;

			            // We are parsing the params object sent from the template to find out which iframe triggered it
			            params = JSON.parse(event.params.params);
			            // And here's the iframeId we're looking for
			            iframeId = params.iframeId;

			            //grab the security string from the from the form
			            //on the page, needed for check in the backend
			            var $form = jQuery('.form-newsletters');
			            var url = '/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php';
			            var nonce = $form.data('nonce');


			            if (email == undefined || email == '') {
			                return;
			            }

			            var emailLists = [];
			            for (var i in list){
			                if (list[i]){
			                    emailLists.push(i);
			                }
			            }

			            var jqxhr = jQuery.get(url, {
			                action: "newsletters",
			                subaction: "subscribe",
			                email_lists: emailLists,
			                email: email,
			                tracking_id: event.params.tracking_id,
			                security: nonce
			            }, function (data) {
			                if (!data.success){
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, false, data.data.message, object)
			                }
			                else{
			                    // When the email was added - set the cookie
			                    pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('newsletter', 'y');
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, true, "");
			                }
			            });
			            break;
			    }
			}]);

			// Read all values from cookie
			var cookieValues = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();

			for (var i in cookieValues) {
			    // Set custom variables from cookie
			    tp.push(['setCustomVariable', i, cookieValues[i]]);
			}



		</script> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="author" data-type="string" content="Natasha Lomas"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="post_id" data-type="integer" content="1490477"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="title" data-type="string" content="DeepMind NHS health data deal had ‘no lawful basis’"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="object_type" data-type="string" content="post"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="url" data-type="enum" content="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/deepmind-nhs-health-data-deal-had-no-lawful-basis/"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="timestamp" data-type="date" content="2017-05-15 14:54:21"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="content" data-type="text" content="DeepMind's inaugural data-sharing deal with the UK's National Health Service looks to be coming firmly unstuck. The partnership&nbsp;attracted controversy last year, when the scope of the behind-the-scenes data-sharing was revealed by a New Scientist investigation.&nbsp;The personally identifiable health data of some 1.6 million NHS patients was&nbsp;used to develop&nbsp;an app for the early detection of a kidney condition. Now&nbsp;the patient data safety advisory body to the UK government, the National Data Guadian (NDG), has weighed in with an opinion that there was -- contrary to DeepMind's repeat insistence -- no lawful basis for the&nbsp;data transfer of 1.6 million patients' medical records to the Google-owned company during a development / piloting phase of the app. The arrangement remains&nbsp;under investigation by the UK's data protection watchdog, the ICO. Sky News has today obtained and published&nbsp;(embedded in the below tweet) a letter sent by the NDG to the Royal Free NHS Trust and to DeepMind…"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="excerpt" data-type="text" content="DeepMind’s inaugural data-sharing deal with the UK’s National Health Service looks to be coming firmly unstuck.">

       </form> 
      </div> 
     </div> 
    </div> 
   </div> 
  </header>

        <script>
		  window.fbAsyncInit = function() {
		    FB.init({
		      appId      : '1678638095724206',
		      xfbml      : true,
		      version    : 'v2.6'
		    });
			FB.Event.subscribe('xfbml.render', function() {
				jQuery('.fb-messenger-loading').detach()
			});
		  };

		  (function(d, s, id){
		     var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
		     if (d.getElementById(id)) {return;}
		     js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id;
		     js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_US/sdk.js";
		     fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
		   }(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));

		   function getCookie(name) {
		      var matches = document.cookie.match(new RegExp(
		        "(?:^|; )" + name.replace(/([\.$?*|{}\(\)\[\]\\\/\+^])/g, '\\$1') + "=([^;]*)"
		      ));
		      return matches ? decodeURIComponent(matches[1]) : undefined;
		   }

		   window.onload = function() {
		     var gravity_guid = getCookie('grvinsights');
		     var btn = document.getElementById('fb-send-to-messenger');
		     if (btn != undefined && btn != null) {
			   btn.setAttribute('data-ref', gravity_guid)
			 }
		   }

		</script>

        <!-- End: Article Eyebrows --> 
        <h1 class="alpha tweet-title">DeepMind NHS health data deal had ‘no lawful basis’</h1> 
        <div class="title-left"> 
         <div class="byline">
           Posted 
          <time datetime="2017-05-15" class="timestamp">10 hours ago</time> by 
          <a href="/author/natasha-lomas/" title="Posts by Natasha Lomas" onclick="s_objectID='river_author';" rel="author">Natasha Lomas</a> 
          <span class="twitter-handle">(<a href="https://twitter.com/riptari" rel="external">@riptari</a>)</span>
         </div> 
         <!-- Begin: Social Share Icons --> 
         <div class="social-share social-share-inline"> 
          <ul class="inline-list social-share-list" id="social-share" data-permalink="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/deepmind-nhs-health-data-deal-had-no-lawful-basis/" data-shortlink="http://tcrn.ch/2pQ9uis" data-sharetitle="DeepMind NHS health data deal had ‘no lawful&nbsp;basis’" data-post-id="1490477" data-twitter-hash=""> 
           <li class="total-shares"> <h5 class="total-shares-count">0</h5><br> <small>SHARES</small> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#comments" rel="external" class="comment icon-comment launch-social-load"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="facebook icon-facebook"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="twitter icon-twitter"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="linkedin icon-linkedin"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="google-plus icon-google-plus"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="reddit icon-reddit"></a> </li>

           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="flipboard icon-flipboard"></a> </li> 
          </ul>

        </div> 
        <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/watch-spacexs-inmarsat-5-flight-4-satellite-launch-live-right-here/" class="next-link" data-omni-sm="art_nextstory"> 
         <div class="next-story-link">
          Next Story
         </div> 
         <div class="next-story-full"> 
          <h4 class="next-title">Watch SpaceX’s Inmarsat-5 Flight 4 satellite launch live right&nbsp;here</h4> 
         </div> </a> 
       </header> 
       <!-- End: Article Header --> 
       <!-- Begin: Article Body --> 
       <div class="l-two-col"> 
        <!-- Begin: Article Body - Main --> 
        <div class="l-main-container"> 
         <div class="l-main"> 
          <div class="article-entry text"> 
           <!-- Begin: Wordpress Article Content --> 
           <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2016/05/p1040482.jpg?w=738" class=""> 
           <p id="speakable-summary">DeepMind’s inaugural data-sharing deal with the UK’s National Health Service looks to be coming firmly unstuck.</p> 
           <p>The partnership&nbsp;<a target="_blank" href="https://techcrunch.com/2016/05/04/concerns-raised-over-broad-scope-of-deepmind-nhs-health-data-sharing-deal/" rel="noopener noreferrer">attracted controversy last year</a>, when the scope of the behind-the-scenes data-sharing was revealed by a <em>New Scientist</em> investigation.&nbsp;The personally identifiable health data of some 1.6 million NHS patients was&nbsp;used to develop&nbsp;an app for the early detection of a kidney condition.</p> 
           <p>Now&nbsp;the patient data safety advisory body to the UK government, the National Data Guadian (NDG), has weighed in with an opinion that there was — contrary to DeepMind’s repeat insistence — no lawful basis for the&nbsp;data transfer of 1.6 million patients’ medical records to the Google-owned company during a development / piloting phase of the app.</p> 
           <p>The arrangement remains&nbsp;<a target="_blank" href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/03/16/uk-watchdog-close-to-verdict-in-deepmind-health-data-consent-probe/" rel="noopener noreferrer">under investigation by the UK’s data protection watchdog</a>, the ICO.</p> 
           <p>Sky News has today obtained and published&nbsp;(embedded in the below tweet) a letter sent by the NDG to the Royal Free NHS Trust and to DeepMind co-founder Mustafa Suleyman. A spokeswoman for the NDG confirmed to TechCrunch&nbsp;that the letter is authentic.</p> 
           <blockquote class="twitter-tweet">
            <p>Full copies of National Data Guardian's letter sent to @<a href="https://twitter.com/SkyNews">SkyNews</a> warning of legal basis re: @<a href="https://twitter.com/DeepMindAI">DeepMindAI</a> + 1.6 millio… <a href="https://twitter.com/i/web/status/864183460478541825"> twitter.com/i/web/status/8…</a>— <br>Alexander J. Martin (@lexanderjmartin) <a href="http://twitter.com/#!/lexanderjmartin/status/864183460478541825" data-datetime="2017-05-15T18:19:27+00:00">May 15, 2017</a></p>
           </blockquote> 
           <p>In the&nbsp;letter, which was sent on&nbsp;February 2017, Dame Fiona Caldicott, the NDG,&nbsp;writes:</p> 
           <blockquote>
            <p>It is my view and that of my panel that the purpose for the transfer of 1.6 million identifiable patient records to Google DeepMind was for the testing of the Streams application, and not for the provision of direct care to patients. &nbsp;Given that Streams was going through testing and therefore could not be relied upon for patient care, any role the application might have played in supporting the provision of direct care would have been limited and secondary to the purpose of the data transfer. My considered opinion therefore remains that it would not have been within the reasonable expectation of patients that their records would have been shared for this purpose.</p>
           </blockquote> 
           <p>She&nbsp;goes on to state that she is writing to the ICO to communicate her&nbsp;advice to feed into its ingoing investigation of the data-sharing arrangement.</p> 
           <p>The NDG also provided us with the following statement regarding the letter:</p> 
           <blockquote>
            <p>The National Data Guardian for Health and Care, Dame Fiona Caldicott, and her panel of advisors have been considering how patient data was shared by the Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust with DeepMind under the ‘Streams’ project to improve the detection and management of acute kidney failure. In discussions with the ICO about this, the NDG agreed to provide advice on the use of implied consent for direct care as a legal basis for the sharing of data by the Royal Free with DeepMind. While the ICO investigation is ongoing the NDG will provide any further assistance to the ICO as required, but will not be commenting further on the matter at this point.</p>
           </blockquote> 
           <p>During the development of the Streams app last year, DeepMind and the Royal Free consistently claimed patient consent was not needed to share their medical records for the Streams app project as the app&nbsp;was being used for so-called ‘direct patient care’. Although during 2016 the app was never&nbsp;actually being used for direct&nbsp;care — it was merely being sporadically tested alongside normal&nbsp;clinical practices.</p>
           <div>
            <div id="adsDivacc5b65879" class="native-ad-mobile"></div>
           </div> 
           <p><a target="_blank" href="https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007%2Fs12553-017-0179-1" rel="noopener noreferrer">Critics have also disputed their ‘direct care’&nbsp;argument</a>&nbsp;for the app — pointing out, for example, that not all the patients whose data is&nbsp;being shared with DeepMind for Streams will&nbsp;go on to develop Acute Kidney Injury, the condition the app is intended to detect. And therefore that some will&nbsp;never be in a direct care relationship for this condition.</p> 
           <p>The NDG’s assessment here is not weighing in on that wider point. But the letter does make it clear that in Caldicott’s&nbsp;view DeepMind and the Royal Free were not&nbsp;justified in their use of live patient data during&nbsp;the testing/development phase of the&nbsp;Streams app.</p> 
           <p>The&nbsp;spokeswoman confirmed to us that the&nbsp;scope of the review was limited to the appropriateness of implied consent for direct care “as the legal basis when the data was shared”.</p> 
           <p>“As the letter states, this was the legal basis that the Royal Free had confirmed that they had used. The NDG&nbsp;has not considered or been asked to consider the appropriateness of any other legal bases,” she added.</p> 
           <p>At the time of writing neither DeepMind nor the Royal Free NHS Trust had responded to our questions or request for comment.</p> 
           <p>But responding to&nbsp;the NDG’s letter in&nbsp;a statement, health data privacy group medConfidential’s coordinator, Phil Booth, told us:&nbsp;“This letter shows that Google DeepMind must know it had to delete the 1.6 million patient medical records it should never have had in the first place. There were legitimate ways for DeepMind to develop the app they wanted to sell. Instead they broke the law, and then lied to the public about it.”</p> 
           <p>Despite the controversy around the data-sharing arrangement underpinning Streams, DeepMind and its&nbsp;partner NHS Trust for this deal, the Royal Free, pushed ahead deploying&nbsp;the app in several London hospitals earlier this year — but only after&nbsp;<a target="_blank" href="https://techcrunch.com/2016/11/21/deepmind-health-inks-new-deal-with-uks-nhs-to-deploy-streams-app-in-early-2017/" rel="noopener noreferrer">inking a new data-sharing deal last year</a>.</p> 
           <p>That second data-sharing arrangement is not currently being reviewed by the NDG, according to the spokeswoman.</p> 
           <p>At the time of writing the ICO could not be reached for comment.</p> 
           <!-- End: Wordpress Article Content --> 
          </div> 
          <div id="social-after-wrapper" class="cf social-share social-share-inline">

         </div> </a> </li> 
       <li> <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/aol-co-founder-steve-case-on-why-vcs-need-to-look-beyond-silicon-valley/?ncid=mobilerecirc_featured"> 
         <div class="mobile-module-list-image"> 
          <img alt="AOL co-founder Steve Case on why VCs need to look beyond Silicon&nbsp;Valley" data-src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8644.jpg?w=100&amp;h=75&amp;crop=1&amp;quality=85&amp;strip=all" data-tc-lazyload="deferred" src="https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/assets/images/100x75.png" width="100" height="75"> 
         </div>

  <script type="application/ld+json">
		{"@context":"http:\/\/schema.org","@type":"Article","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2017\/05\/15\/deepmind-nhs-health-data-deal-had-no-lawful-basis\/","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Natasha Lomas"},"headline":"DeepMind NHS health data deal had 'no lawful","articleBody":"DeepMind's inaugural data-sharing deal with the UK's National Health Service looks to be coming firmly unstuck.\n\nThe partnership\u00a0attracted controversy last year, when the scope of the behind-the-scenes data-sharing was revealed by a New Scientist investigation.\u00a0The personally identifiable health data of some 1.6 million NHS patients was\u00a0used to develop\u00a0an app for the early detection of a kidney condition.\n\nNow\u00a0the patient data safety advisory body to the UK government, the National Data Guadian (NDG), has weighed in with an opinion that there was -- contrary to DeepMind's repeat insistence -- no lawful basis for the\u00a0data transfer of 1.6 million patients' medical records to the Google-owned company during a development \/ piloting phase of the app.\n\nThe arrangement remains\u00a0under investigation by the UK's data protection watchdog, the ICO.\n\nSky News has today obtained and published\u00a0(embedded in the below tweet) a letter sent by the NDG to the Royal Free NHS Trust and to DeepMind co-founder Mustafa Suleyman. A spokeswoman for the NDG confirmed to TechCrunch\u00a0that the letter is authentic.\n\nhttps:\/\/twitter.com\/lexanderjmartin\/status\/864183460478541825\/photo\/1\n\nIn the\u00a0letter, which was sent on\u00a0February 2017, Dame Fiona Caldicott, the NDG,\u00a0writes:\n\nIt is my view and that of my panel that the purpose for the transfer of 1.6 million identifiable patient records to Google DeepMind was for the testing of the Streams application, and not for the provision of direct care to patients. \u00a0Given that Streams was going through testing and therefore could not be relied upon for patient care, any role the application might have played in supporting the provision of direct care would have been limited and secondary to the purpose of the data transfer. My considered opinion therefore remains that it would not have been within the reasonable expectation of patients that their records would have been shared for this purpose.\n\nShe\u00a0goes on to state that she is writing to the ICO to communicate her\u00a0advice to feed into its ingoing investigation of the data-sharing arrangement.\n\nThe NDG also provided us with the following statement regarding the letter:\n\nThe National Data Guardian for Health and Care, Dame Fiona Caldicott, and her panel of advisors have been considering how patient data was shared by the Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust with DeepMind under the \u2018Streams\u2019 project to improve the detection and management of acute kidney failure. In discussions with the ICO about this, the NDG agreed to provide advice on the use of implied consent for direct care as a legal basis for the sharing of data by the Royal Free with DeepMind. While the ICO investigation is ongoing the NDG will provide any further assistance to the ICO as required, but will not be commenting further on the matter at this point.\n\nDuring the development of the Streams app last year, DeepMind and the Royal Free consistently claimed patient consent was not needed to share their medical records for the Streams app project as the app\u00a0was being used for so-called 'direct patient care'. Although during 2016 the app was never\u00a0actually being used for direct\u00a0care -- it was merely being sporadically tested alongside normal\u00a0clinical practices.\n\nCritics have also disputed their 'direct care'\u00a0argument\u00a0for the app -- pointing out, for example, that not all the patients whose data is\u00a0being shared with DeepMind for Streams will\u00a0go on to develop Acute Kidney Injury, the condition the app is intended to detect. And therefore that some will\u00a0never be in a direct care relationship for this condition.\n\nThe NDG's assessment here is not weighing in on that wider point. But the letter does make it clear that in Caldicott's\u00a0view DeepMind and the Royal Free were not\u00a0justified in their use of live patient data during\u00a0the testing\/development phase of the\u00a0Streams app.\n\nThe\u00a0spokeswoman confirmed to us that the\u00a0scope of the review was limited to the appropriateness of implied consent for direct care \"as the legal basis when the data was shared\".\n\n\"As the letter states, this was the legal basis that the Royal Free had confirmed that they had used. The NDG\u00a0has not considered or been asked to consider the appropriateness of any other legal bases,\" she added.\n\nAt the time of writing neither DeepMind nor the Royal Free NHS Trust had responded to our questions or request for comment.\n\nBut responding to\u00a0the NDG's letter in\u00a0a statement, health data privacy group medConfidential's coordinator, Phil Booth, told us:\u00a0\"This letter shows that Google DeepMind must know it had to delete the 1.6 million patient medical records it should never have had in the first place. There were legitimate ways for DeepMind to develop the app they wanted to sell. Instead they broke the law, and then lied to the public about it.\"\n\nDespite the controversy around the data-sharing arrangement underpinning Streams, DeepMind and its\u00a0partner NHS Trust for this deal, the Royal Free, pushed ahead deploying\u00a0the app in several London hospitals earlier this year -- but only after\u00a0inking a new data-sharing deal last year.\n\nThat second data-sharing arrangement is not currently being reviewed by the NDG, according to the spokeswoman.\n\nAt the time of writing the ICO could not be reached for comment.","datePublished":"2017-05-15T21:54:21+00:00","mainEntityOfPage":"True","image":{"@list":["https:\/\/tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com\/2016\/05\/p1040482.jpg"]},"speakable":{"@type":"SpeakableSpecification","cssSelector":[".alpha","#speakable-summary"]}}	</script>

		(function (window, $, undefined) {
			var document = window.document;

			function loadChartbeat() {
				window._sf_endpt = (new Date()).getTime();
				var e = document.createElement('script'),
					url = ("https:" === document.location.protocol) ? "https://s3.amazonaws.com/" : "http://";
				url += "static.chartbeat.com/js/chartbeat.js";
				e.setAttribute('language', 'javascript');
				e.setAttribute('type', 'text/javascript');
				e.async = true;
				e.setAttribute('src', url);
				document.body.appendChild(e);
			}

			$(loadChartbeat);
		}(this, this.jQuery));
	</script>

  <script>
			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
				// Get all existing values from the cookie
				var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
				// Set the value
				cookieValue[name] = value;

				// Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
				var d = new Date();
				d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
				var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();


									var domain = 'techcrunch.com';
				
				// Write the cookie value
				document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=."+domain;
			}

						

			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
			    // Get all existing values from the cookie
			    var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
			    // Set the value
			    cookieValue[name] = value;

			    // Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
			    var d = new Date();
			    d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
			    var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();

			    // Write the cookie value
			    document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=.tcpreprod.com";
			}

			/**
			 * Read values from cookie and convert them from json
			 * @param specificName (optional) Name specific value from the set
			 * @returns {*} If specificName is specified - returns single value, otherwise returns JSON object with all values
			 */
			function pianoReadCustomVariableCookie(specificName) {
			    var cookieValue;
			    try {
			        // Try to get the cookie value with regexp
			        var match = document.cookie.match(new RegExp('(^| )__pcvc=([^;]+)'));
			        if (match) {
			            // If cookie with this name was found - try to parse the JSON value
			            cookieValue = JSON.parse(match[2]);
			        }
			    }
			    catch (e) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (!cookieValue) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (typeof specificName != "undefined") {
			        // Get the specific value from the set
			        if (typeof cookieValue[specificName] != "undefined") {
			            return cookieValue[specificName];
			        }
			        return null;
			    }
			    return cookieValue;
			}

			/**
			 * Function to send data upstream to Piano template
			 * @param iframeId - Element id of the Piano iframe
			 * @param success - true/false. Status of the message
			 * @param message - Error message text
			 * @param object - Additional data, like the the field that triggered the error
			 */
			function sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, success, message, object) {
			    var iframe = jQuery('#' + iframeId);

			    if (iframe.length) {
			        iframe[0].contentWindow.postMessage({
			            piano: {
			                success: success,
			                message: message,
			                object: object
			            }
			        }, '*');
			    }
			}

			tp = window.tp || [];

			tp.push(["addHandler", "customEvent", function (event, b, c, d) {
			    switch (event.eventName) {
			        // Don't show me this again
			        case 'dont-show':
			            pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('dontshow', 'y');
			            tp.offer.close();
			            break;

			        case 'tc-signup-newsletters':
			            console.log(event);
			            var email = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.email != 'undefined') && (event.params.email.length > 0)) {
			                email = event.params.email;
			            }

			            var object = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.object != 'undefined') && (event.params.object.length > 0)) {
			                object = event.params.object;
			            }

			            var list = [];
			            if ((typeof event.params.list != 'undefined') && (event.params.list.length > 0)) {
			                list = JSON.parse(event.params.list);
			            }

			            var iframeId;

			            // We are parsing the params object sent from the template to find out which iframe triggered it
			            params = JSON.parse(event.params.params);
			            // And here's the iframeId we're looking for
			            iframeId = params.iframeId;

			            //grab the security string from the from the form
			            //on the page, needed for check in the backend
			            var $form = jQuery('.form-newsletters');
			            var url = '/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php';
			            var nonce = $form.data('nonce');


			            if (email == undefined || email == '') {
			                return;
			            }

			            var emailLists = [];
			            for (var i in list){
			                if (list[i]){
			                    emailLists.push(i);
			                }
			            }

			            var jqxhr = jQuery.get(url, {
			                action: "newsletters",
			                subaction: "subscribe",
			                email_lists: emailLists,
			                email: email,
			                tracking_id: event.params.tracking_id,
			                security: nonce
			            }, function (data) {
			                if (!data.success){
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, false, data.data.message, object)
			                }
			                else{
			                    // When the email was added - set the cookie
			                    pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('newsletter', 'y');
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, true, "");
			                }
			            });
			            break;
			    }
			}]);

			// Read all values from cookie
			var cookieValues = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();

			for (var i in cookieValues) {
			    // Set custom variables from cookie
			    tp.push(['setCustomVariable', i, cookieValues[i]]);
			}



		</script>

  <meta class="swiftype" name="content" data-type="text" content="SpaceX is setting up to launch Inmarsat-5 Flight 4, a mission that will put a communications satellite into geostationary orbit for commercial satellite operator Inmarsat. SpaceX's window lasts 49 minutes, and opens at 7:21 PM ET (4:21 PM PT) on Tuesday, with another window opening at the same time tomorrow in case of any issues resulting in a scrub. The launch payload is the fourth satellite in Inmarsat's Global Xpress (GX) constellation of craft, which aims to provide globe-spacing high-speed mobile broad band using the Ka-band spectrum. The GX network first started offering service nearly two years ago, but this fourth unit adds additional load capacity for the overall network, and some redundancy in case anything goes wrong with one of the other satellites in the constellation. For SpaceX, the launch is significant because it's the heaviest orbital payload a Falcon 9 rocket has every carried to date, which is why SpaceX won't be attempting to recover the first stage of the…">

	}

        <script>
		  window.fbAsyncInit = function() {
		    FB.init({
		      appId      : '1678638095724206',
		      xfbml      : true,
		      version    : 'v2.6'
		    });
			FB.Event.subscribe('xfbml.render', function() {
				jQuery('.fb-messenger-loading').detach()
			});
		  };

		  (function(d, s, id){
		     var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
		     if (d.getElementById(id)) {return;}
		     js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id;
		     js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_US/sdk.js";
		     fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
		   }(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));

		   function getCookie(name) {
		      var matches = document.cookie.match(new RegExp(
		        "(?:^|; )" + name.replace(/([\.$?*|{}\(\)\[\]\\\/\+^])/g, '\\$1') + "=([^;]*)"
		      ));
		      return matches ? decodeURIComponent(matches[1]) : undefined;
		   }

		   window.onload = function() {
		     var gravity_guid = getCookie('grvinsights');
		     var btn = document.getElementById('fb-send-to-messenger');
		     if (btn != undefined && btn != null) {
			   btn.setAttribute('data-ref', gravity_guid)
			 }
		   }

		</script>

        <h1 class="alpha tweet-title">Watch SpaceX’s Inmarsat-5 Flight 4 satellite launch live right here</h1> 
        <div class="title-left"> 
         <div class="byline">
           Posted 
          <time datetime="2017-05-15" class="timestamp">10 hours ago</time> by 
          <a href="/author/darrell-etherington/" title="Posts by Darrell Etherington" onclick="s_objectID='river_author';" rel="author">Darrell Etherington</a> 
          <span class="twitter-handle">(<a href="https://twitter.com/etherington" rel="external">@etherington</a>)</span>
         </div> 
         <!-- Begin: Social Share Icons --> 
         <div class="social-share social-share-inline"> 
          <ul class="inline-list social-share-list" id="social-share" data-permalink="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/watch-spacexs-inmarsat-5-flight-4-satellite-launch-live-right-here/" data-shortlink="http://tcrn.ch/2pP2fba" data-sharetitle="Watch SpaceX’s Inmarsat-5 Flight 4 satellite launch live right&nbsp;here" data-post-id="1490693" data-twitter-hash=""> 
           <li class="total-shares"> <h5 class="total-shares-count">0</h5><br> <small>SHARES</small> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#comments" rel="external" class="comment icon-comment launch-social-load"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="facebook icon-facebook"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="twitter icon-twitter"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="linkedin icon-linkedin"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="google-plus icon-google-plus"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="reddit icon-reddit"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="stumbleupon icon-stumbleupon"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="email icon-email"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="flipboard icon-flipboard"></a> </li> 
          </ul> 
         </div> 
         <div class="social-share social-share-fixed"> 
          <div class="less"> 
           <a class="blank"></a> 
           <a class="icon-flipboard" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-stumbleupon" href="#"></a>

        <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/credithero-wants-to-help-fix-credit-scores-for-those-afraid-to-even-look/" class="next-link" data-omni-sm="art_nextstory"> 
         <div class="next-story-link">
          Next Story
         </div> 
         <div class="next-story-full"> 
          <h4 class="next-title">CreditHero wants to help fix credit scores for those afraid to even&nbsp;look</h4> 
         </div> </a> 
       </header> 
       <!-- End: Article Header --> 
       <!-- Begin: Article Body --> 
       <div class="l-two-col"> 
        <!-- Begin: Article Body - Main --> 
        <div class="l-main-container"> 
         <div class="l-main"> 
          <div class="article-entry text"> 
           <!-- Begin: Wordpress Article Content --> 
           <p><span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class="youtube-player" type="text/html" width="680" height="383" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ynMYE64IEKs?version=3&amp;rel=1&amp;fs=1&amp;autohide=2&amp;showsearch=0&amp;showinfo=1&amp;iv_load_policy=1&amp;wmode=transparent" allowfullscreen="true" style="border:0;"></iframe></span> </p> 
           <p id="speakable-summary">SpaceX is setting up to launch Inmarsat-5 Flight 4, a mission that will put a communications satellite into geostationary orbit for commercial satellite operator Inmarsat. SpaceX’s window lasts 49 minutes, and opens at 7:21 PM ET (4:21 PM PT) on Tuesday, with another window opening at the same time tomorrow in case of any issues resulting in a scrub.</p> 
           <p>The launch payload is the fourth satellite in Inmarsat’s Global Xpress (GX) constellation of craft, which aims to provide globe-spacing high-speed mobile broad band using the Ka-band spectrum.</p> 
           <p>The GX network first started offering service nearly two years ago, but this fourth unit adds additional load capacity for the overall network, and some redundancy in case anything goes wrong with one of the other satellites in the constellation.</p>
           <div>
            <div id="adsDivd213bae967" class="native-ad-mobile"></div>
           </div> 
           <p>For SpaceX, the launch is significant because it’s the heaviest orbital payload a Falcon 9 rocket has every carried to date, which is why SpaceX won’t be attempting to recover the first stage of the rocket as it usually does. The Falcon 9’s rocket requires a different kind of configuration to maximize its load capacity, which results in a rocket that’s fully expanded via the launch process.</p> 
           <p>Today’s launch takes place from LC-39A, the launch facility at Kennedy Space Center in Florida that SpaceX is leasing, and that was used by NASA for historic launches including multiple Apollo launches, as well as many Space Shuttle missions over the years. The launch live stream should go live via the embed above starting around 20 minutes or so prior to launch.</p> 
           <!-- End: Wordpress Article Content --> 
          </div> 
          <div id="social-after-wrapper" class="cf social-share social-share-inline"> 
           <ul class="inline-list social-share-list" id="social-after" data-permalink="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/watch-spacexs-inmarsat-5-flight-4-satellite-launch-live-right-here/" data-shortlink="http://tcrn.ch/2pP2fba" data-sharetitle="Watch SpaceX’s Inmarsat-5 Flight 4 satellite launch live right&nbsp;here" data-post-id="1490693"> 
            <li class="total-shares"> <h5 class="total-shares-count">0</h5><br> <small>SHARES</small> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="facebook icon-facebook"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="twitter icon-twitter"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="linkedin icon-linkedin"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="google-plus icon-google-plus"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="stumbleupon icon-stumbleupon"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="reddit icon-reddit"></a> </li>

         <div class="section aside crunchbase-cluster collapse"> 
          <h3 class="section-title collapse-title">Crunchbase</h3> 
          <div class="collapse-body"> 
           <ul class="crunchbase-accordion"> 
            <!-- Begin: Crunchbase Card --> 
            <li class="data-card crunchbase-card active" data-crunchbase-url="https://crunchbase.com/organization/space-exploration-technologies/"> <h4 class="card-title card-acc-handle"> <a class="cb-card-title-link" href="https://crunchbase.com/organization/space-exploration-technologies/"> SpaceX </a> </h4> 
             <div class="card-acc-panel"> 
              <ul class="card-info"> 
               <li> <strong class="key">Founded</strong> <span class="value">2002</span> </li> 
               <li class="cb-card-description full"> <strong class="key">Overview</strong> <span class="value">Space Exploration Technologies Corporation (SpaceX) is a space-transportation startup company founded by Elon Musk. It is developing the partially reusable launch vehicles Falcon 1 and Falcon 9. Originally based in El Segundo, SpaceX now operates out of Hawthorne, California, USA. SpaceX was founded in June 2002 by Musk who had invested $100 million of his own money in the company as of March 2006. …</span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Location</strong> <span class="value"> <a href="http://crunchbase.com/location/hawthorne/ed19e5bfbec449efd87e5979a1a7c0c8">Hawthorne, CA</a> </span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Categories</strong> <span class="value"> <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/aerospace/8a20023f3e3220bbb6abe824a0386367">Aerospace</a>, <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/transportation/95642ff023e979a3612b50de99f06305">Transportation</a>, <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/space-travel/b59073949837f1907ecaa27462666650">Space Travel</a> </span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Founders</strong> <span class="value"><a href="https://crunchbase.com/person/person/elon-musk" target="_blank">Elon Musk</a></span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Website</strong> <span class="value"> <a href="http://www.spacex.com" target="_blank">http://www.spacex.com</a> </span> </li> 
               <li class="full profile"> <a href="https://crunchbase.com/organization/space-exploration-technologies" target="_blank">Full profile for SpaceX</a> </li>

        <h4 class="h-alt crunchboard-listings-subhead">Job Listings</h4>

  <script type="application/ld+json">
		{"@context":"http:\/\/schema.org","@type":"Article","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2017\/05\/15\/watch-spacexs-inmarsat-5-flight-4-satellite-launch-live-right-here\/","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Darrell Etherington"},"headline":"Watch SpaceX's Inmarsat-5 Flight 4 launch","articleBody":"\n\nSpaceX is setting up to launch Inmarsat-5 Flight 4, a mission that will put a communications satellite into geostationary orbit for commercial satellite operator Inmarsat. SpaceX's window lasts 49 minutes, and opens at 7:21 PM ET (4:21 PM PT) on Tuesday, with another window opening at the same time tomorrow in case of any issues resulting in a scrub.\n\nThe launch payload is the fourth satellite in Inmarsat's Global Xpress (GX) constellation of craft, which aims to provide globe-spacing high-speed mobile broad band using the Ka-band spectrum.\n\nThe GX network first started offering service nearly two years ago, but this fourth unit adds additional load capacity for the overall network, and some redundancy in case anything goes wrong with one of the other satellites in the constellation.\n\nFor SpaceX, the launch is significant because it's the heaviest orbital payload a Falcon 9 rocket has every carried to date, which is why SpaceX won't be attempting to recover the first stage of the rocket as it usually does. The Falcon 9's rocket requires a different kind of configuration to maximize its load capacity, which results in a rocket that's fully expanded via the launch process.\n\nToday's launch takes place from LC-39A, the launch facility at Kennedy Space Center in Florida that SpaceX is leasing, and that was used by NASA for historic launches including multiple Apollo launches, as well as many Space Shuttle missions over the years. The launch live stream should go live via the embed above starting around 20 minutes or so prior to launch.","datePublished":"2017-05-15T21:49:09+00:00","mainEntityOfPage":"True","image":{"@list":["https:\/\/tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com\/2017\/05\/c_4ogwcvoaav4uk-jpg-large.jpeg"]},"speakable":{"@type":"SpeakableSpecification","cssSelector":[".alpha","#speakable-summary"]}}	</script>

			var oldonload = window.onload;
			if (typeof window.onload != 'function') {
				window.onload = func;
			} else {
				window.onload = function () {

			a.src=src;var b=document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];b.parentNode.insertBefore(a,b)})("https://dashboard.tinypass.com/xbuilder/experience/load?aid=Fy7FpgyUxA");

  <script>
			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
				// Get all existing values from the cookie
				var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
				// Set the value
				cookieValue[name] = value;

				// Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
				var d = new Date();
				d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
				var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();


									var domain = 'techcrunch.com';
				
				// Write the cookie value
				document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=."+domain;
			}

						

			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
			    // Get all existing values from the cookie
			    var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
			    // Set the value
			    cookieValue[name] = value;

			    // Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
			    var d = new Date();
			    d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
			    var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();

			    // Write the cookie value
			    document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=.tcpreprod.com";
			}

			/**
			 * Read values from cookie and convert them from json
			 * @param specificName (optional) Name specific value from the set
			 * @returns {*} If specificName is specified - returns single value, otherwise returns JSON object with all values
			 */
			function pianoReadCustomVariableCookie(specificName) {
			    var cookieValue;
			    try {
			        // Try to get the cookie value with regexp
			        var match = document.cookie.match(new RegExp('(^| )__pcvc=([^;]+)'));
			        if (match) {
			            // If cookie with this name was found - try to parse the JSON value
			            cookieValue = JSON.parse(match[2]);
			        }
			    }
			    catch (e) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (!cookieValue) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (typeof specificName != "undefined") {
			        // Get the specific value from the set
			        if (typeof cookieValue[specificName] != "undefined") {
			            return cookieValue[specificName];
			        }
			        return null;
			    }
			    return cookieValue;
			}

			/**
			 * Function to send data upstream to Piano template
			 * @param iframeId - Element id of the Piano iframe
			 * @param success - true/false. Status of the message
			 * @param message - Error message text
			 * @param object - Additional data, like the the field that triggered the error
			 */
			function sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, success, message, object) {
			    var iframe = jQuery('#' + iframeId);

			    if (iframe.length) {
			        iframe[0].contentWindow.postMessage({
			            piano: {
			                success: success,
			                message: message,
			                object: object
			            }
			        }, '*');
			    }
			}

			tp = window.tp || [];

			tp.push(["addHandler", "customEvent", function (event, b, c, d) {
			    switch (event.eventName) {
			        // Don't show me this again
			        case 'dont-show':
			            pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('dontshow', 'y');
			            tp.offer.close();
			            break;

			        case 'tc-signup-newsletters':
			            console.log(event);
			            var email = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.email != 'undefined') && (event.params.email.length > 0)) {
			                email = event.params.email;
			            }

			            var object = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.object != 'undefined') && (event.params.object.length > 0)) {
			                object = event.params.object;
			            }

			            var list = [];
			            if ((typeof event.params.list != 'undefined') && (event.params.list.length > 0)) {
			                list = JSON.parse(event.params.list);
			            }

			            var iframeId;

			            // We are parsing the params object sent from the template to find out which iframe triggered it
			            params = JSON.parse(event.params.params);
			            // And here's the iframeId we're looking for
			            iframeId = params.iframeId;

			            //grab the security string from the from the form
			            //on the page, needed for check in the backend
			            var $form = jQuery('.form-newsletters');
			            var url = '/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php';
			            var nonce = $form.data('nonce');


			            if (email == undefined || email == '') {
			                return;
			            }

			            var emailLists = [];
			            for (var i in list){
			                if (list[i]){
			                    emailLists.push(i);
			                }
			            }

			            var jqxhr = jQuery.get(url, {
			                action: "newsletters",
			                subaction: "subscribe",
			                email_lists: emailLists,
			                email: email,
			                tracking_id: event.params.tracking_id,
			                security: nonce
			            }, function (data) {
			                if (!data.success){
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, false, data.data.message, object)
			                }
			                else{
			                    // When the email was added - set the cookie
			                    pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('newsletter', 'y');
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, true, "");
			                }
			            });
			            break;
			    }
			}]);

			// Read all values from cookie
			var cookieValues = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();

			for (var i in cookieValues) {
			    // Set custom variables from cookie
			    tp.push(['setCustomVariable', i, cookieValues[i]]);
			}



		</script>

  <meta class="swiftype" name="timestamp" data-type="date" content="2017-05-15 14:45:44"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="content" data-type="text" content="With apps like Robinhood and services like Wealthfront for investing, and Credit Karma to check your credit score regularly, it might seem like financial services are finally getting more palatable and mainstream. But to Nicole Sanchez, people still need to have decent credit to get to the point where they'll use those services — and that's a huge hurdle to cross. That's why she and her co-founders started CreditHero, a service geared toward helping people better understand their credit score and how to meaningfully improve it that launched at TechCrunch Disrupt NY 2017. By taking a more conversational approach, Sanchez and her team hope they might create a warmer experience (even with a bot) that will encourage people to not only understand how to improve their credit, but feel like they can even look at their credit score without freaking out. There's a lot of hype around building conversational user interfaces, but Sanchez thinks that using this to have a meaningful chat about a…">

That’s why Nicole Sanchez and her co-founders started CreditHero, a service to help people understand their credit score — and how to improve…">

	var setAdblockerCookie = function(adblocker) {
	    var d = new Date();
	    d.setTime(d.getTime() + 60 * 60 * 24 * 30 * 1000);
	    document.cookie = "__adblocker=" + (adblocker ? "true" : "false") + "; expires=" + d.toUTCString() + "; path=/";
	}

      <div class="modal-body"> 
       <h2>Hi!</h2> 
       <p> You are about to activate our Facebook Messenger news bot. Once subscribed, the bot will send you a digest of trending stories once a day. You can also customize the types of stories it sends you. </p> 
       <p> Click on the button below to subscribe and wait for a new Facebook message from the TC Messenger news bot. </p> 
       <p> Thanks,<br> TC Team </p> 
       <div class="fb-messenger-loading"></div> 
       <div class="fb-messenger-iframe"> 
        <div class="fb-send-to-messenger" id="fb-send-to-messenger" messenger_app_id="1678638095724206" page_id="8062627951" color="blue" size="large" data-ref="tcnav"></div> 
        <script>
		  window.fbAsyncInit = function() {
		    FB.init({
		      appId      : '1678638095724206',
		      xfbml      : true,
		      version    : 'v2.6'
		    });
			FB.Event.subscribe('xfbml.render', function() {
				jQuery('.fb-messenger-loading').detach()
			});
		  };

		  (function(d, s, id){
		     var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
		     if (d.getElementById(id)) {return;}
		     js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id;
		     js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_US/sdk.js";
		     fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
		   }(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));

		   function getCookie(name) {
		      var matches = document.cookie.match(new RegExp(
		        "(?:^|; )" + name.replace(/([\.$?*|{}\(\)\[\]\\\/\+^])/g, '\\$1') + "=([^;]*)"
		      ));
		      return matches ? decodeURIComponent(matches[1]) : undefined;
		   }

		   window.onload = function() {
		     var gravity_guid = getCookie('grvinsights');
		     var btn = document.getElementById('fb-send-to-messenger');
		     if (btn != undefined && btn != null) {
			   btn.setAttribute('data-ref', gravity_guid)
			 }
		   }

		</script> 
       </div>

         <!-- End: Article Eyebrows --> 
         <h1 class="alpha tweet-title">CreditHero wants to help fix credit scores for those afraid to even look</h1> 
         <div class="title-left"> 
          <div class="byline">
            Posted 
           <time datetime="2017-05-15" class="timestamp">10 hours ago</time> by 
           <a href="/author/matthew-lynley/" title="Posts by Matthew Lynley" onclick="s_objectID='river_author';" rel="author">Matthew Lynley</a> 
           <span class="twitter-handle">(<a href="https://twitter.com/mattlynley" rel="external">@mattlynley</a>)</span>
          </div> 
          <!-- Begin: Social Share Icons --> 
          <div class="social-share social-share-inline"> 
           <ul class="inline-list social-share-list" id="social-share" data-permalink="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/credithero-wants-to-help-fix-credit-scores-for-those-afraid-to-even-look/" data-shortlink="http://tcrn.ch/2pOxMdf" data-sharetitle="CreditHero wants to help fix credit scores for those afraid to even&nbsp;look" data-post-id="1489355" data-twitter-hash="#TCDisrupt"> 
            <li class="total-shares"> <h5 class="total-shares-count">0</h5><br> <small>SHARES</small> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#comments" rel="external" class="comment icon-comment launch-social-load"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="facebook icon-facebook"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="twitter icon-twitter"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="linkedin icon-linkedin"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="google-plus icon-google-plus"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="reddit icon-reddit"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="stumbleupon icon-stumbleupon"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="email icon-email"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="flipboard icon-flipboard"></a> </li> 
           </ul> 
          </div> 
          <div class="social-share social-share-fixed"> 
           <div class="less"> 
            <a class="blank"></a> 
            <a class="icon-flipboard" href="#"></a> 
            <a class="icon-stumbleupon" href="#"></a> 
            <a class="icon-reddit" href="#"></a> 
            <a class="icon-email" href="#"></a> 
           </div> 
           <div class="shown"> 
            <a class="icon-facebook" href="#"></a> 
            <a class="icon-twitter" href="#"></a> 
            <a class="icon-linkedin" href="#"></a> 
            <a class="icon-whatsapp" href="#"></a> 
            <a class="icon-email" href="#"></a> 
           </div> 
          </div> 
          <!-- End: Social Share Icons --> 
         </div> 
         <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/wannacry-ransomware-is-still-spreading-fast-but-kill-switch-defenses-hold-for-now/" class="next-link" data-omni-sm="art_nextstory"> 
          <div class="next-story-link">
           Next Story
          </div> 
          <div class="next-story-full"> 
           <h4 class="next-title">WannaCry ransomware is still spreading fast, but ‘kill switch’ defenses hold for&nbsp;now</h4> 
          </div> </a> 
        </header> 
        <!-- End: Article Header --> 
        <!-- Begin: Article Body --> 
        <div class="l-two-col"> 
         <!-- Begin: Article Body - Main --> 
         <div class="l-main-container"> 
          <div class="l-main"> 
           <div class="article-entry text"> 
            <!-- Begin: Wordpress Article Content --> 
            <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/147a1308.jpg?w=738" class=""> 
            <p id="speakable-summary">With apps like Robinhood and services like Wealthfront for investing, and Credit Karma to check your credit score regularly, it might seem like financial services are finally getting more palatable and mainstream. But to Nicole Sanchez, people still need to have decent credit to get to the point where they’ll use those services — and that’s a huge hurdle to cross.</p> 
            <p>That’s why she and her co-founders started <a target="_blank" href="http://www.getcredithero.com" rel="noopener noreferrer">CreditHero</a>, a service geared toward helping people better understand their credit score and how to meaningfully improve it that launched at TechCrunch Disrupt NY 2017. By taking a more conversational approach, Sanchez and her team hope they might create a warmer experience (even with a bot) that will encourage people to not only understand how to improve their credit, but feel like they can even look at their credit score without freaking out. There’s a lot of hype around building conversational user interfaces, but Sanchez thinks that using this to have a meaningful chat about a difficult subject may be the best approach for such a hairy topic.</p> 
            <p>The process starts with a conversation that tries to do a quick diagnosis of what the person is concerned with, and build a sort of rapport with the user. After getting details out through that conversation, users then sign up, link their credit report and get a “credit prescription.” That process is based on user behavior to create a more customized experience for every user — and continue building up that trust.</p> 
            <p>“One in two people have subprime credit, it’s the majority of Americans,” co-founder Nicole Sanchez said.&nbsp;“Credit monitoring services are great, but if most&nbsp;haven’t checked, there’s still a massive opportunity. What we discovered is most people had not checked because&nbsp;they were afraid of what they were going to see. We talk about how financial distress is the new normal, but it really is. Most people aren’t in a secure situation.”</p> 
            <p></p>
            <div class="aside aside-related-articles"> 
             <h2>Related Articles</h2> 
             <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/12/time-is-running-out-to-exhibit-at-disrupts-hardware-alley/">Time is running out to exhibit at Disrupt's Hardware Alley</a> 
             <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/11/meet-cubas-first-internet-entrepreneurs-at-disrupt-new-york/">Meet Cuba's first internet entrepreneurs at Disrupt New York</a> 
             <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/11/your-2017-disrupt-ny-startup-battlefield-final-round-judges/">Your 2017 Disrupt NY Startup Battlefield final round judges</a> 
             <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/11/bootstrapping-hardware-lets-meet-at-disrupt-new-york/">Bootstrapping hardware? Let's meet at Disrupt New York</a> 
            </div>Part of the origin story stems back to an event the team hosted at a co-working office. At the end, Sanchez asked the attendees to text a number if they felt like they needed help with their credit. The response was “overwhelming,” she said, and showed a clear need for something that would help people improve their credit — that didn’t clearly exist just yet. Their goal was to build something that would work for people who weren’t technically savvy and just needed a way to get to the point where they could get a credit card for emergencies, or eventually make it to getting a decent loan for a house.
            <p></p> 
            <p>That’s part of the reason why, for now, the company doesn’t have an app. Instead, it’s a mobile web interface, which makes it more accessible to a wider array of people who might not have access to the best devices or internet connections, Sanchez said. The goal is to very quickly establish a trust&nbsp;with the user and guide them to the best suggestions to improve their score on their terms and based on their behavior.</p>
            <div>
             <div id="adsDivacc5b65879" class="native-ad-mobile"></div>
            </div> 
            <p>“The first thing we get a sense of is how they feel about credit scores,” Sanchez said. “We find most people are either confused or concerned, but just asking that question&nbsp;establishes comfort. The next thing we want to talk about is goals. Do they want to lower debt, buy a home. Talking&nbsp;in an aspirational way is important. There’s a lot of behavioral economics that goes into it. This is someone who is probably distressed.”</p> 
            <div class="slideshow slideshowify"> 
             <ol>
              <li> 
               <div class="image">
                <img data-thumb="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/147a1310.jpg?w=80&amp;h=60&amp;crop=1" data-full-size-image="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/147a1310.jpg" data-large-size-image="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/147a1310.jpg?w=1&amp;h=1" data-trigger-notification="1" data-scalable="false" alt="" data-src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/147a1310.jpg?w=1&amp;h=1" data-tc-lazyload="deferred" src="https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/assets/images/1x1.png" width="1" height="1">
               </div> <h3 class="title">credithero</h3> 
               <div class="caption"></div>

               </div> <h3 class="title">credithero</h3> 
               <div class="caption"></div> 
               <div class="credit"></div> </li>
              <li> 
               <div class="image">
                <img data-thumb="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-credithero-8359.jpg?w=80&amp;h=60&amp;crop=1" data-full-size-image="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-credithero-8359.jpg" data-large-size-image="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-credithero-8359.jpg?w=1&amp;h=1" data-trigger-notification="1" data-scalable="false" alt="" data-src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-credithero-8359.jpg?w=1&amp;h=1" data-tc-lazyload="deferred" src="https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/assets/images/1x1.png" width="1" height="1">
               </div> <h3 class="title">tcdisrupt-ny17-credithero-8359</h3> 
               <div class="caption"></div> 
               <div class="credit"></div> </li>
              <li> 
               <div class="image">
                <img data-thumb="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/147a1309.jpg?w=80&amp;h=60&amp;crop=1" data-full-size-image="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/147a1309.jpg" data-large-size-image="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/147a1309.jpg?w=1&amp;h=1" data-trigger-notification="1" data-scalable="false" alt="" data-src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/147a1309.jpg?w=1&amp;h=1" data-tc-lazyload="deferred" src="https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/assets/images/1x1.png" width="1" height="1">
               </div> <h3 class="title">CreditHero presents at Startup Battlefield at TechCrunch Disrupt NY 2017</h3> 
               <div class="caption">
                CreditHero presents at Startup Battlefield at TechCrunch Disrupt NY 2017
               </div> 
               <div class="credit"></div> </li>
             </ol> 
             <div class="enter-wrapper"> 
              <a class="enter" href="#">&nbsp;<span class="enter-text">View Slideshow</span></a> 
             </div> 
             <div class="controls"> 
              <a class="prev icon-arrow-left" href="#"><span class="is-vishidden">Previous</span></a> 
              <a class="next icon-arrow" href="#"><span class="is-vishidden">Next</span></a> 
              <a class="exit" href="#">Exit</a> 
             </div> 
            </div> 
            <p>Many users are looking to buy a home or refinance, which first requires establishing a good credit score, Sanchez said. Just by guiding them through recommendations, CreditHero users are able to boost their scores by 50 points within the first six weeks or so, which helps establish a good amount of trust, she said. Over the next few months they can then continue working toward building a stronger score. The company currently doesn’t monetize its service, though it seems like there are natural pathways to that monetization, like lead-generation.</p> 
            <p>There are certainly going to be challenges. All of the companies mentioned above, with a foothold in the fintech industry and in the mindshare around it, could go after a similar problem. Credit Karma already owns the experience around your credit score, and it seems like there are plenty of ways to fiddle with the user experience to build a similar product. Sanchez and CreditHero hope to establish a user base that has a lot of trust in that the results will help it grow, rather than being seen as a simple utility.</p> 
            <p>“Credit 1.0 was all around filling the&nbsp;information gap,” Sanchez said. “Ten years ago, Credit Karma came out, and you could get your credit score for free. That was why they were very new. They made a splash and built this large organization. NerdWallet came out targeting the top end of the segment, they came in with editorial. We’re gonna add more info to make you most informed on all the offers you have. The next innovation in fintech&nbsp;is really around the execution gap, how do I get from point A to point B. Okay, I have this score, how do I get there. That’s where CreditHero sits.”</p> 
            <div class="vdb_player vdb_56df4e9de4b0c9c31d626c18564f313b67b6231408bc51ee" vdb_params=""> 
             <script type="text/javascript" src="//delivery.vidible.tv/jsonp/pid=56df4e9de4b0c9c31d626c18/vid=591a24f692fdde0c0d89666d/564f313b67b6231408bc51ee.js"></script> 
            </div>

          <li> <a href="https://www.crunchboard.com/jobs/2144431-senior-full-stack-react-node-java-technical-instructor-at-codepath" onclick="s_objectID='rr_crunchboard';" target="_blank"> <h3>Senior full-stack React/Node/Java technical instructor at CodePath (Sunnyvale, CA / Remote)</h3> </a> </li>

  <script type="application/ld+json">
		{"@context":"http:\/\/schema.org","@type":"Article","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2017\/05\/15\/credithero-wants-to-help-fix-credit-scores-for-those-afraid-to-even-look\/","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Matthew Lynley"},"headline":"CreditHero wants to fix credit scores for","articleBody":"With apps like Robinhood and services like Wealthfront for investing, and Credit Karma to check your credit score regularly, it might seem like financial services are finally getting more palatable and mainstream. But to Nicole Sanchez, people still need to have decent credit to get to the point where they'll use those services \u2014 and that's a huge hurdle to cross.\n\nThat's why she and her co-founders started CreditHero, a service geared toward helping people better understand their credit score and how to meaningfully improve it that launched at TechCrunch Disrupt NY 2017. By taking a more conversational approach, Sanchez and her team hope they might create a warmer experience (even with a bot) that will encourage people to not only understand how to improve their credit, but feel like they can even look at their credit score without freaking out. There's a lot of hype around building conversational user interfaces, but Sanchez thinks that using this to have a meaningful chat about a difficult subject may be the best approach for such a hairy topic.\n\nThe process starts with a conversation that tries to do a quick diagnosis of what the person is concerned with, and build a sort of rapport with the user. After getting details out through that conversation, users then sign up, link their credit report and get a \"credit prescription.\" That process is based on user behavior to create a more customized experience for every user \u2014 and continue building up that trust.\n\n\"One in two people have subprime credit, it's the majority of Americans,\" co-founder Nicole Sanchez said.\u00a0\"Credit monitoring services are great, but if most\u00a0haven't checked, there's still a massive opportunity. What we discovered is most people had not checked because\u00a0they were afraid of what they were going to see. We talk about how financial distress is the new normal, but it really is. Most people aren't in a secure situation.\"\n\nPart of the origin story stems back to an event the team hosted at a co-working office. At the end, Sanchez asked the attendees to text a number if they felt like they needed help with their credit. The response was \"overwhelming,\" she said, and showed a clear need for something that would help people improve their credit \u2014 that didn't clearly exist just yet. Their goal was to build something that would work for people who weren't technically savvy and just needed a way to get to the point where they could get a credit card for emergencies, or eventually make it to getting a decent loan for a house.\n\nThat's part of the reason why, for now, the company doesn't have an app. Instead, it's a mobile web interface, which makes it more accessible to a wider array of people who might not have access to the best devices or internet connections, Sanchez said. The goal is to very quickly establish a trust\u00a0with the user and guide them to the best suggestions to improve their score on their terms and based on their behavior.\n\n\"The first thing we get a sense of is how they feel about credit scores,\" Sanchez said. \"We find most people are either confused or concerned, but just asking that question\u00a0establishes comfort. The next thing we want to talk about is goals. Do they want to lower debt, buy a home. Talking\u00a0in an aspirational way is important. There's a lot of behavioral economics that goes into it. This is someone who is probably distressed.\"\n\n\n\nMany users are looking to buy a home or refinance, which first requires establishing a good credit score, Sanchez said. Just by guiding them through recommendations, CreditHero users are able to boost their scores by 50 points within the first six weeks or so, which helps establish a good amount of trust, she said. Over the next few months they can then continue working toward building a stronger score. The company currently doesn't monetize its service, though it seems like there are natural pathways to that monetization, like lead-generation.\n\nThere are certainly going to be challenges. All of the companies mentioned above, with a foothold in the fintech industry and in the mindshare around it, could go after a similar problem. Credit Karma already owns the experience around your credit score, and it seems like there are plenty of ways to fiddle with the user experience to build a similar product. Sanchez and CreditHero hope to establish a user base that has a lot of trust in that the results will help it grow, rather than being seen as a simple utility.\n\n\"Credit 1.0 was all around filling the\u00a0information gap,\" Sanchez said. \"Ten years ago, Credit Karma came out, and you could get your credit score for free. That was why they were very new. They made a splash and built this large organization. NerdWallet came out targeting the top end of the segment, they came in with editorial. We're gonna add more info to make you most informed on all the offers you have. The next innovation in fintech\u00a0is really around the execution gap, how do I get from point A to point B. Okay, I have this score, how do I get there. That's where CreditHero sits.\"\n\n","datePublished":"2017-05-15T21:45:44+00:00","mainEntityOfPage":"True","image":{"@list":["https:\/\/tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com\/2017\/05\/147a1308.jpg"]},"speakable":{"@type":"SpeakableSpecification","cssSelector":[".alpha","#speakable-summary"]}}	</script> 
  <script type="text/javascript">

			{flush: true}

	* Plugin: getVisitNum - version 3.0

	+"var s=this,e=new Date,cval,cvisit,ct=e.getTime(),d;if(!tp){tp='m';}"
	+"if(tp=='m'||tp=='w'||tp=='d'){eo=s.endof(tp),y=eo.getTime();e.setTi"
	+"me(y);}else {d=tp*86400000;e.setTime(ct+d);}if(!c){c='s_vnum';}if(!"

	+"'),str=cval.substring(i+4,cval.length),k;}cvisit=s.c_r(c2);if(cvisi"

	+"var t=new Date;t.setHours(0);t.setMinutes(0);t.setSeconds(0);if(x=="
	+"'m'){d=s.dimo(t.getMonth(),t.getFullYear())-t.getDate()+1;}else if("
	+"x=='w'){d=7-t.getDay();}else {d=1;}t.setDate(t.getDate()+d);return "
	+"t;");

  <script type="text/javascript">
		/* <![CDATA[ */
		function addLoadEvent(func) {
			var oldonload = window.onload;
			if (typeof window.onload != 'function') {
				window.onload = func;
			} else {
				window.onload = function () {
					oldonload();
					func();
				}
			}
		}
		/* ]]> */
	</script>
