  <script>
			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
				// Get all existing values from the cookie
				var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
				// Set the value
				cookieValue[name] = value;

				// Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
				var d = new Date();
				d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
				var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();


									var domain = 'techcrunch.com';
				
				// Write the cookie value
				document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=."+domain;
			}

						

			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
			    // Get all existing values from the cookie
			    var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
			    // Set the value
			    cookieValue[name] = value;

			    // Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
			    var d = new Date();
			    d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
			    var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();

			    // Write the cookie value
			    document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=.tcpreprod.com";
			}

			/**
			 * Read values from cookie and convert them from json
			 * @param specificName (optional) Name specific value from the set
			 * @returns {*} If specificName is specified - returns single value, otherwise returns JSON object with all values
			 */
			function pianoReadCustomVariableCookie(specificName) {
			    var cookieValue;
			    try {
			        // Try to get the cookie value with regexp
			        var match = document.cookie.match(new RegExp('(^| )__pcvc=([^;]+)'));
			        if (match) {
			            // If cookie with this name was found - try to parse the JSON value
			            cookieValue = JSON.parse(match[2]);
			        }
			    }
			    catch (e) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (!cookieValue) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (typeof specificName != "undefined") {
			        // Get the specific value from the set
			        if (typeof cookieValue[specificName] != "undefined") {
			            return cookieValue[specificName];
			        }
			        return null;
			    }
			    return cookieValue;
			}

			/**
			 * Function to send data upstream to Piano template
			 * @param iframeId - Element id of the Piano iframe
			 * @param success - true/false. Status of the message
			 * @param message - Error message text
			 * @param object - Additional data, like the the field that triggered the error
			 */
			function sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, success, message, object) {
			    var iframe = jQuery('#' + iframeId);

			    if (iframe.length) {
			        iframe[0].contentWindow.postMessage({
			            piano: {
			                success: success,
			                message: message,
			                object: object
			            }
			        }, '*');
			    }
			}

			tp = window.tp || [];

			tp.push(["addHandler", "customEvent", function (event, b, c, d) {
			    switch (event.eventName) {
			        // Don't show me this again
			        case 'dont-show':
			            pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('dontshow', 'y');
			            tp.offer.close();
			            break;

			        case 'tc-signup-newsletters':
			            console.log(event);
			            var email = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.email != 'undefined') && (event.params.email.length > 0)) {
			                email = event.params.email;
			            }

			            var object = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.object != 'undefined') && (event.params.object.length > 0)) {
			                object = event.params.object;
			            }

			            var list = [];
			            if ((typeof event.params.list != 'undefined') && (event.params.list.length > 0)) {
			                list = JSON.parse(event.params.list);
			            }

			            var iframeId;

			            // We are parsing the params object sent from the template to find out which iframe triggered it
			            params = JSON.parse(event.params.params);
			            // And here's the iframeId we're looking for
			            iframeId = params.iframeId;

			            //grab the security string from the from the form
			            //on the page, needed for check in the backend
			            var $form = jQuery('.form-newsletters');
			            var url = '/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php';
			            var nonce = $form.data('nonce');


			            if (email == undefined || email == '') {
			                return;
			            }

			            var emailLists = [];
			            for (var i in list){
			                if (list[i]){
			                    emailLists.push(i);
			                }
			            }

			            var jqxhr = jQuery.get(url, {
			                action: "newsletters",
			                subaction: "subscribe",
			                email_lists: emailLists,
			                email: email,
			                tracking_id: event.params.tracking_id,
			                security: nonce
			            }, function (data) {
			                if (!data.success){
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, false, data.data.message, object)
			                }
			                else{
			                    // When the email was added - set the cookie
			                    pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('newsletter', 'y');
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, true, "");
			                }
			            });
			            break;
			    }
			}]);

			// Read all values from cookie
			var cookieValues = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();

			for (var i in cookieValues) {
			    // Set custom variables from cookie
			    tp.push(['setCustomVariable', i, cookieValues[i]]);
			}



		</script>

  <meta class="swiftype" name="url" data-type="enum" content="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/wannacry-ransomware-is-still-spreading-fast-but-kill-switch-defenses-hold-for-now/"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="timestamp" data-type="date" content="2017-05-15 14:45:02"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="content" data-type="text" content="The WannaCry ransomware sweeping the world hasn't stopped its progress, but quick action by cybersecurity professionals has at least partially limited the damage it does as it goes. Over the weekend a &quot;kill switch&quot; was discovered by accident, which doesn't stop the malware from spreading, but at least prevents it from activating the code that encrypts and ransoms your data. Researchers at Check Point spotted a new variant of WannaCry that used a different kill switch domain (it pings it and if it finds it isn't registered, it activates the ransomware; for more details, check out the original post on this behavior). Of course they immediately registered it, preventing the new, mutant malware from activating. A side benefit of doing so is that the researchers get a ping whenever the ransomware infects a new computer, and in a blog post they revealed that a new infection was popping up every second. Although those computers won't have their data ransomed, it's not difficult to create…">

	var setAdblockerCookie = function(adblocker) {
	    var d = new Date();
	    d.setTime(d.getTime() + 60 * 60 * 24 * 30 * 1000);
	    document.cookie = "__adblocker=" + (adblocker ? "true" : "false") + "; expires=" + d.toUTCString() + "; path=/";
	}

	}(this,this.jQuery));
}
/* ]]> */
</script> 
   </div>

      <div class="modal-body"> 
       <h2>Hi!</h2> 
       <p> You are about to activate our Facebook Messenger news bot. Once subscribed, the bot will send you a digest of trending stories once a day. You can also customize the types of stories it sends you. </p> 
       <p> Click on the button below to subscribe and wait for a new Facebook message from the TC Messenger news bot. </p> 
       <p> Thanks,<br> TC Team </p> 
       <div class="fb-messenger-loading"></div> 
       <div class="fb-messenger-iframe"> 
        <div class="fb-send-to-messenger" id="fb-send-to-messenger" messenger_app_id="1678638095724206" page_id="8062627951" color="blue" size="large" data-ref="tcnav"></div> 
        <script>
		  window.fbAsyncInit = function() {
		    FB.init({
		      appId      : '1678638095724206',
		      xfbml      : true,
		      version    : 'v2.6'
		    });
			FB.Event.subscribe('xfbml.render', function() {
				jQuery('.fb-messenger-loading').detach()
			});
		  };

		  (function(d, s, id){
		     var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
		     if (d.getElementById(id)) {return;}
		     js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id;
		     js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_US/sdk.js";
		     fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
		   }(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));

		   function getCookie(name) {
		      var matches = document.cookie.match(new RegExp(
		        "(?:^|; )" + name.replace(/([\.$?*|{}\(\)\[\]\\\/\+^])/g, '\\$1') + "=([^;]*)"
		      ));
		      return matches ? decodeURIComponent(matches[1]) : undefined;
		   }

		   window.onload = function() {
		     var gravity_guid = getCookie('grvinsights');
		     var btn = document.getElementById('fb-send-to-messenger');
		     if (btn != undefined && btn != null) {
			   btn.setAttribute('data-ref', gravity_guid)
			 }
		   }

		</script> 
       </div> 
      </div>

         <div class="tag-item"> 
          <a href="https://techcrunch.com/tag/ransomware/" class="tag" data-omni-sm="art_articlecategory">ransomware</a> 
          <div class="links" id="tc-tag-item-ransomware"> 
           <ul class="recirc-river river-small g g-1-2-1"> 
            <li> 
             <div class="block-small"> 
              <a class="block-wrapper" href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/13/that-global-ransomware-attack-was-halted-apparently-by-accident/"> <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2015/12/gigster-hackers.jpg?w=150" alt="That global ransomware attack was halted apparently by&nbsp;accident"> 
               <div class="block-content"> 
                <h3>That global ransomware attack was halted apparently by&nbsp;accident</h3> 
                <div class="block-meta"> 
                 <div class="byline"> 
                  <time datetime="2017-05-13 07:57:00"></time> 
                 </div> 
                </div> 
               </div> </a> 
             </div> </li> 
            <li> 
             <div class="block-small"> 
              <a class="block-wrapper" href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/04/06/f-secure-buys-little-flocker-to-upgrade-its-mac-security-play/"> <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2016/04/p1010215.jpg?w=150" alt="F-Secure buys Little Flocker to upgrade its Mac security&nbsp;play"> 
               <div class="block-content"> 
                <h3>F-Secure buys Little Flocker to upgrade its Mac security&nbsp;play</h3> 
                <div class="block-meta"> 
                 <div class="byline"> 
                  <time datetime="2017-04-06 01:42:02"></time>

             </div> </li> 
            <li> 
             <div class="block-small"> 
              <a class="block-wrapper" href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/02/13/researchers-simulate-a-ransomware-attack-on-industrial-controls/"> <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2016/12/gettyimages-85641887.jpg?w=150" alt="Researchers simulate a ransomware attack on industrial&nbsp;controls"> 
               <div class="block-content">

        <!-- End: Article Eyebrows --> 
        <h1 class="alpha tweet-title">WannaCry ransomware is still spreading fast, but ‘kill switch’ defenses hold for now</h1> 
        <div class="title-left"> 
         <div class="byline">
           Posted 
          <time datetime="2017-05-15" class="timestamp">10 hours ago</time> by 
          <a href="/author/devin-coldewey/" title="Posts by Devin Coldewey" onclick="s_objectID='river_author';" rel="author">Devin Coldewey</a>
         </div> 
         <!-- Begin: Social Share Icons --> 
         <div class="social-share social-share-inline"> 
          <ul class="inline-list social-share-list" id="social-share" data-permalink="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/wannacry-ransomware-is-still-spreading-fast-but-kill-switch-defenses-hold-for-now/" data-shortlink="http://tcrn.ch/2qp8xzv" data-sharetitle="WannaCry ransomware is still spreading fast, but ‘kill switch’ defenses hold for" data-post-id="1490728" data-twitter-hash=""> 
           <li class="total-shares"> <h5 class="total-shares-count">0</h5><br> <small>SHARES</small> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#comments" rel="external" class="comment icon-comment launch-social-load"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="facebook icon-facebook"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="twitter icon-twitter"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="linkedin icon-linkedin"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="google-plus icon-google-plus"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="reddit icon-reddit"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="stumbleupon icon-stumbleupon"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="email icon-email"></a> </li> 
           <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="flipboard icon-flipboard"></a> </li> 
          </ul> 
         </div> 
         <div class="social-share social-share-fixed"> 
          <div class="less"> 
           <a class="blank"></a> 
           <a class="icon-flipboard" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-stumbleupon" href="#"></a> 
           <a class="icon-reddit" href="#"></a>

        </div> 
        <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/apteligent-acquired-by-vmware/" class="next-link" data-omni-sm="art_nextstory"> 
         <div class="next-story-link">
          Next Story
         </div> 
         <div class="next-story-full"> 
          <h4 class="next-title">App analytics company Apteligent acquired by&nbsp;VMware</h4> 
         </div> </a> 
       </header> 
       <!-- End: Article Header --> 
       <!-- Begin: Article Body --> 
       <div class="l-two-col"> 
        <!-- Begin: Article Body - Main --> 
        <div class="l-main-container"> 
         <div class="l-main"> 
          <div class="article-entry text"> 
           <!-- Begin: Wordpress Article Content --> 
           <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2016/04/ransomware.png?w=738" class=""> 
           <p id="speakable-summary">The WannaCry ransomware sweeping the world hasn’t stopped its progress, but quick action by cybersecurity professionals has at least partially limited the damage it does as it goes.</p> 
           <p>Over the weekend a “kill switch” was <a target="_blank" href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/13/that-global-ransomware-attack-was-halted-apparently-by-accident/" rel="noopener noreferrer">discovered by accident</a>, which doesn’t stop the malware from spreading, but at least prevents it from activating the code that encrypts and ransoms your data.</p> 
           <p></p>
           <div class="aside aside-related-articles"> 
            <h2>Related Articles</h2> 
            <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/14/microsofts-response-to-widespread-cyber-attacks-may-make-you-wannacry/">Microsoft's response to widespread cyberattacks may make you WannaCry</a> 
            <a href="https://techcrunch.com/gallery/top-six-tips-to-help-avoid-ransomware/">Top six tips to help avoid ransomware</a> 
            <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/12/ransomware-based-on-leaked-nsa-tools-spreads-to-dozens-of-countries/">Ransomware based on leaked NSA tools spreads to dozens of countries</a> 
           </div>Researchers at Check Point spotted a new variant of WannaCry that used a different kill switch domain (it pings it and if it finds it isn’t registered, it activates the ransomware; for more details, 
           <a target="_blank" href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/13/that-global-ransomware-attack-was-halted-apparently-by-accident/" rel="noopener noreferrer">check out the original post on this behavior</a>). Of course they immediately registered it, preventing the new, mutant malware from activating.
           <p></p> 
           <p>A side benefit of doing so is that the researchers get a ping whenever the ransomware infects a new computer, <a target="_blank" href="http://blog.checkpoint.com/2017/05/15/wannacry-new-kill-switch-new-sinkhole/" rel="noopener noreferrer">and in a blog post</a> they revealed that a new infection was popping up <em>every second.</em></p>
           <div>
            <div id="adsDivacc5b65879" class="native-ad-mobile"></div>
           </div> 
           <p>Although <em>those</em> computers won’t have their data ransomed, it’s not difficult to create a new variant (or 10) that may infect at a similar rate using kill switches that haven’t been activated — if they include kill switches at all.</p> 
           <p>The only real solution here is for vulnerable machines to be inoculated. Considering Microsoft took the rare step of issuing a patch for old, unsupported versions of Windows that are nevertheless found in the wild, there’s no excuse for not doing so.</p> 
           <!-- End: Wordpress Article Content --> 
           <small>Featured Image: Bryce Durbin</small> 
          </div> 
          <div id="social-after-wrapper" class="cf social-share social-share-inline"> 
           <ul class="inline-list social-share-list" id="social-after" data-permalink="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/wannacry-ransomware-is-still-spreading-fast-but-kill-switch-defenses-hold-for-now/" data-shortlink="http://tcrn.ch/2qp8xzv" data-sharetitle="WannaCry ransomware is still spreading fast, but ‘kill switch’ defenses hold for" data-post-id="1490728"> 
            <li class="total-shares"> <h5 class="total-shares-count">0</h5><br> <small>SHARES</small> </li>

  <script type="application/ld+json">
		{"@context":"http:\/\/schema.org","@type":"Article","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2017\/05\/15\/wannacry-ransomware-is-still-spreading-fast-but-kill-switch-defenses-hold-for-now\/","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Devin Coldewey"},"headline":"WannaCry spreading fast but blocked faster","articleBody":"The WannaCry ransomware sweeping the world hasn't stopped its progress, but quick action by cybersecurity professionals has at least partially limited the damage it does as it goes.\n\nOver the weekend a \"kill switch\" was discovered by accident, which doesn't stop the malware from spreading, but at least prevents it from activating the code that encrypts and ransoms your data.\n\nResearchers at Check Point spotted a new variant of WannaCry that used a different kill switch domain (it pings it and if it finds it isn't registered, it activates the ransomware; for more details, check out the original post on this behavior). Of course they immediately registered it, preventing the new, mutant malware from activating.\n\nA side benefit of doing so is that the researchers get a ping whenever the ransomware infects a new computer, and in a blog post they revealed that a new infection was popping up every second.\n\nAlthough those computers won't have their data ransomed, it's not difficult to create a new variant (or 10) that may infect at a similar rate using kill switches that haven't been activated \u2014 if they include kill switches at all.\n\nThe only real solution here is for vulnerable machines to be inoculated. Considering Microsoft took the rare step of issuing a patch for old, unsupported versions of Windows that are nevertheless found in the wild, there's no excuse for not doing so.","datePublished":"2017-05-15T21:45:02+00:00","mainEntityOfPage":"True","image":{"@list":["https:\/\/tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com\/2016\/04\/ransomware.png"]},"speakable":{"@type":"SpeakableSpecification","cssSelector":[".alpha","#speakable-summary"]}}	</script>

					url = ("https:" === document.location.protocol) ? "https://s3.amazonaws.com/" : "http://";

	/*                                                                 
	* Plugin: getVisitNum - version 3.0
	*/
	var s = window.s_265;
	window.s_265.getVisitNum=new Function("tp","c","c2",""
	+"var s=this,e=new Date,cval,cvisit,ct=e.getTime(),d;if(!tp){tp='m';}"

	+"c2){c2='s_invisit';}cval=s.c_r(c);if(cval){var i=cval.indexOf('&vn="
	+"'),str=cval.substring(i+4,cval.length),k;}cvisit=s.c_r(c2);if(cvisi"
	+"t){if(str){e.setTime(ct+1800000);s.c_w(c2,'true',e);return str;}els"
	+"e {return 'unknown visit number';}}else {if(str){str++;k=cval.substri"
	+"ng(0,i);e.setTime(k);s.c_w(c,k+'&vn='+str,e);e.setTime(ct+1800000);"
	+"s.c_w(c2,'true',e);return str;}else {s.c_w(c,e.getTime()+'&vn=1',e)"
	+";e.setTime(ct+1800000);s.c_w(c2,'true',e);return 1;}}");
	s.dimo=new Function("m","y",""
	+"var d=new Date(y,m+1,0);return d.getDate();");
	s.endof=new Function("x",""
	+"var t=new Date;t.setHours(0);t.setMinutes(0);t.setSeconds(0);if(x=="
	+"'m'){d=s.dimo(t.getMonth(),t.getFullYear())-t.getDate()+1;}else if("
	+"x=='w'){d=7-t.getDay();}else {d=1;}t.setDate(t.getDate()+d);return "
	+"t;");
</script>

		function addLoadEvent(func) {
			var oldonload = window.onload;
			if (typeof window.onload != 'function') {
				window.onload = func;
			} else {
				window.onload = function () {
					oldonload();
					func();
				}
			}

  <script>
			(function(src){var a=document.createElement("script");a.type="text/javascript";a.async=true;
			a.src=src;var b=document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];b.parentNode.insertBefore(a,b)})("https://dashboard.tinypass.com/xbuilder/experience/load?aid=Fy7FpgyUxA");

  <script>
			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
				// Get all existing values from the cookie
				var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
				// Set the value
				cookieValue[name] = value;

				// Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
				var d = new Date();
				d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
				var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();


									var domain = 'techcrunch.com';
				
				// Write the cookie value
				document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=."+domain;
			}

						

			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
			    // Get all existing values from the cookie
			    var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
			    // Set the value
			    cookieValue[name] = value;

			    // Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
			    var d = new Date();
			    d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
			    var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();

			    // Write the cookie value
			    document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=.tcpreprod.com";
			}

			/**
			 * Read values from cookie and convert them from json
			 * @param specificName (optional) Name specific value from the set
			 * @returns {*} If specificName is specified - returns single value, otherwise returns JSON object with all values
			 */
			function pianoReadCustomVariableCookie(specificName) {
			    var cookieValue;
			    try {
			        // Try to get the cookie value with regexp
			        var match = document.cookie.match(new RegExp('(^| )__pcvc=([^;]+)'));
			        if (match) {
			            // If cookie with this name was found - try to parse the JSON value
			            cookieValue = JSON.parse(match[2]);
			        }
			    }
			    catch (e) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (!cookieValue) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (typeof specificName != "undefined") {
			        // Get the specific value from the set
			        if (typeof cookieValue[specificName] != "undefined") {
			            return cookieValue[specificName];
			        }
			        return null;
			    }
			    return cookieValue;
			}

			/**
			 * Function to send data upstream to Piano template
			 * @param iframeId - Element id of the Piano iframe
			 * @param success - true/false. Status of the message
			 * @param message - Error message text
			 * @param object - Additional data, like the the field that triggered the error
			 */
			function sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, success, message, object) {
			    var iframe = jQuery('#' + iframeId);

			    if (iframe.length) {
			        iframe[0].contentWindow.postMessage({
			            piano: {
			                success: success,
			                message: message,
			                object: object
			            }
			        }, '*');
			    }
			}

			tp = window.tp || [];

			tp.push(["addHandler", "customEvent", function (event, b, c, d) {
			    switch (event.eventName) {
			        // Don't show me this again
			        case 'dont-show':
			            pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('dontshow', 'y');
			            tp.offer.close();
			            break;

			        case 'tc-signup-newsletters':
			            console.log(event);
			            var email = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.email != 'undefined') && (event.params.email.length > 0)) {
			                email = event.params.email;
			            }

			            var object = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.object != 'undefined') && (event.params.object.length > 0)) {
			                object = event.params.object;
			            }

			            var list = [];
			            if ((typeof event.params.list != 'undefined') && (event.params.list.length > 0)) {
			                list = JSON.parse(event.params.list);
			            }

			            var iframeId;

			            // We are parsing the params object sent from the template to find out which iframe triggered it
			            params = JSON.parse(event.params.params);
			            // And here's the iframeId we're looking for
			            iframeId = params.iframeId;

			            //grab the security string from the from the form
			            //on the page, needed for check in the backend
			            var $form = jQuery('.form-newsletters');
			            var url = '/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php';
			            var nonce = $form.data('nonce');


			            if (email == undefined || email == '') {
			                return;
			            }

			            var emailLists = [];
			            for (var i in list){
			                if (list[i]){
			                    emailLists.push(i);
			                }
			            }

			            var jqxhr = jQuery.get(url, {
			                action: "newsletters",
			                subaction: "subscribe",
			                email_lists: emailLists,
			                email: email,
			                tracking_id: event.params.tracking_id,
			                security: nonce
			            }, function (data) {
			                if (!data.success){
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, false, data.data.message, object)
			                }
			                else{
			                    // When the email was added - set the cookie
			                    pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('newsletter', 'y');
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, true, "");
			                }
			            });
			            break;
			    }
			}]);

			// Read all values from cookie
			var cookieValues = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();

			for (var i in cookieValues) {
			    // Set custom variables from cookie
			    tp.push(['setCustomVariable', i, cookieValues[i]]);
			}



		</script> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="author" data-type="string" content="Ryan Lawler"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="author" data-type="string" content="Ron Miller"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="post_id" data-type="integer" content="1490688"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="title" data-type="string" content="App analytics company Apteligent acquired by VMware"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="object_type" data-type="string" content="post"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="url" data-type="enum" content="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/apteligent-acquired-by-vmware/"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="timestamp" data-type="date" content="2017-05-15 14:35:36"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="content" data-type="text" content="VMware announced today that it has acquired&nbsp;Apteligent, a startup that will allow&nbsp;it to provide more tools to customers building and optimizing mobile apps. Originally named Crittercism, Apteligent was founded to provide&nbsp;mobile app performance and analytics data to customers. Over time, Apteligent moved more and more into the enterprise as a way for developers to understand not just crash reporting or network insights, but also to analyze user behavior and improve the user experience of their apps. Terms of the acquisition weren't disclosed, but Apteligent had&nbsp;raised nearly $50 million since being founded in 2011, with a list of investors that include Scale Venture Partners, GV, Shasta Ventures, KPCB, &nbsp;AngelPad and AOL Ventures. Strategic investors include Accenture and (yes) VMware, which apparently liked the company so much it just bought it outright. The deal should add a new component to its product suite. VMware bought mobile device management company AirWatch in 2014.…"> 
  <meta class="swiftype" name="excerpt" data-type="text" content="VMware announced today that it has acquired Apteligent, a startup that will allow it to provide more tools to customers building and optimizing mobile apps.">

       <button type="button" class="close" data-dismiss="modal">×</button> 
       <div class="modal-tc-logo"> 
        <svg version="1.1" id="Layer_1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" x="0px" y="0px" width="180px" height="90px" viewbox="0 0 180 90" enable-background="new 0 0 180 90" xml:space="preserve"> 
         <polygon fill="#3E433E" points="90,0 90,30 60,30 60,90 30,90 30,30 0,30 0,0 " /> 
         <rect x="120" fill="#3E433E" width="60" height="30" /> 
         <polygon fill="#3E433E" points="180,60 180,90 90,90 90,30 120,30 120,60 " /> 
        </svg> 
       </div> 
      </div> 
      <div class="modal-body"> 
       <h2>Hi!</h2> 
       <p> You are about to activate our Facebook Messenger news bot. Once subscribed, the bot will send you a digest of trending stories once a day. You can also customize the types of stories it sends you. </p> 
       <p> Click on the button below to subscribe and wait for a new Facebook message from the TC Messenger news bot. </p> 
       <p> Thanks,<br> TC Team </p> 
       <div class="fb-messenger-loading"></div> 
       <div class="fb-messenger-iframe"> 
        <div class="fb-send-to-messenger" id="fb-send-to-messenger" messenger_app_id="1678638095724206" page_id="8062627951" color="blue" size="large" data-ref="tcnav"></div> 
        <script>
		  window.fbAsyncInit = function() {
		    FB.init({
		      appId      : '1678638095724206',
		      xfbml      : true,
		      version    : 'v2.6'
		    });
			FB.Event.subscribe('xfbml.render', function() {
				jQuery('.fb-messenger-loading').detach()
			});
		  };

		  (function(d, s, id){
		     var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
		     if (d.getElementById(id)) {return;}
		     js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id;
		     js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_US/sdk.js";
		     fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
		   }(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));

		   function getCookie(name) {
		      var matches = document.cookie.match(new RegExp(
		        "(?:^|; )" + name.replace(/([\.$?*|{}\(\)\[\]\\\/\+^])/g, '\\$1') + "=([^;]*)"
		      ));
		      return matches ? decodeURIComponent(matches[1]) : undefined;
		   }

		   window.onload = function() {
		     var gravity_guid = getCookie('grvinsights');
		     var btn = document.getElementById('fb-send-to-messenger');
		     if (btn != undefined && btn != null) {
			   btn.setAttribute('data-ref', gravity_guid)
			 }
		   }

		</script> 
       </div> 
      </div> 
     </div>

        <h1 class="alpha tweet-title">App analytics company Apteligent acquired by VMware</h1> 
        <div class="title-left"> 
         <div class="byline">
           Posted 
          <time datetime="2017-05-15" class="timestamp">10 hours ago</time> by 
          <a href="/author/ryan-lawler/" title="Posts by Ryan Lawler" onclick="s_objectID='river_author';" rel="author">Ryan Lawler</a> 
          <span class="twitter-handle">(<a href="https://twitter.com/ryanlawler" rel="external">@ryanlawler</a>)</span>, 
          <a href="/author/ron-miller/" title="Posts by Ron Miller" onclick="s_objectID='river_author';" rel="author">Ron Miller</a> 
          <span class="twitter-handle">(<a href="https://twitter.com/ron_miller" rel="external">@ron_miller</a>)</span>
         </div> 
         <!-- Begin: Social Share Icons --> 
         <div class="social-share social-share-inline"> 
          <ul class="inline-list social-share-list" id="social-share" data-permalink="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/apteligent-acquired-by-vmware/" data-shortlink="http://tcrn.ch/2ra9A8Y" data-sharetitle="App analytics company Apteligent acquired by&nbsp;VMware" data-post-id="1490688" data-twitter-hash="">

        <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/using-tech-to-uproot-systemic-racism/" class="next-link" data-omni-sm="art_nextstory"> 
         <div class="next-story-link">

          <h4 class="next-title">Using tech to uproot systemic&nbsp;racism</h4>

       <!-- End: Article Header --> 
       <!-- Begin: Article Body --> 
       <div class="l-two-col"> 
        <!-- Begin: Article Body - Main --> 
        <div class="l-main-container"> 
         <div class="l-main"> 
          <div class="article-entry text"> 
           <!-- Begin: Wordpress Article Content --> 
           <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/gettyimages-606916257.jpg?w=738" class=""> 
           <p id="speakable-summary"><a target="_blank" href="http://www.vmware.com" rel="noopener noreferrer">VMware</a> announced <a target="_blank" href="https://www.vmware.com/company/acquisitions/apteligent.html" rel="noopener noreferrer">today that it has acquired</a>&nbsp;<a target="_blank" href="http://www.apteligent.com/" rel="noopener noreferrer">Apteligent</a>, a startup that will allow&nbsp;it to provide more tools to customers building and optimizing mobile apps.</p> 
           <p>Originally <a target="_blank" href="https://techcrunch.com/2014/04/09/crittercism-accenture-30m/" rel="noopener noreferrer">named Crittercism</a>, Apteligent was founded to provide&nbsp;mobile app performance and analytics data to customers. Over time, Apteligent moved more and more into the enterprise as a way for developers to understand not just crash reporting or network insights, but also to analyze user behavior and improve the user experience of their apps.</p> 
           <p>Terms of the acquisition weren’t disclosed, but Apteligent had&nbsp;raised nearly $50 million since being founded in 2011, with a list of investors that include Scale Venture Partners, GV, Shasta Ventures, KPCB, &nbsp;AngelPad and AOL Ventures. Strategic investors include Accenture and (yes) VMware, which apparently liked the company so much it just bought it outright.</p> 
           <p>The deal should add a new component to its product suite. VMware bought mobile device management company <a target="_blank" href="https://techcrunch.com/2014/01/22/vmwares-1-5b-airwatch-buy-all-about-mobile-workplace/">AirWatch</a> in 2014. With&nbsp;the Apteligent deal, VMware will&nbsp;be able to provide a more robust set of capabilities to its mobile analytics customers.</p>
           <div>
            <div id="adsDivacc5b65879" class="native-ad-mobile"></div>
           </div> 
           <p>Ray Wang, principal analyst at Constellation Research says this about enhancing VMware’s mobile play, taking advantage of some of its previous acquisitions:</p> 
           <p>“Apteligent adds to the investments in end user computing such as analytics, performance management, crash churn, Xamarin SDK and digital workspace. The goal here is to build on mobile and the AirWatch investment,” Wang told TechCrunch.</p> 
           <!-- End: Wordpress Article Content --> 
           <small>Featured Image: Guido Mieth/Getty Images</small> 
          </div> 
          <div id="social-after-wrapper" class="cf social-share social-share-inline"> 
           <ul class="inline-list social-share-list" id="social-after" data-permalink="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/apteligent-acquired-by-vmware/" data-shortlink="http://tcrn.ch/2ra9A8Y" data-sharetitle="App analytics company Apteligent acquired by&nbsp;VMware" data-post-id="1490688"> 
            <li class="total-shares"> <h5 class="total-shares-count">0</h5><br> <small>SHARES</small> </li>

         <!-- Begin: Crunchbase Shoal --> 
         <div class="section aside crunchbase-cluster collapse"> 
          <h3 class="section-title collapse-title">Crunchbase</h3> 
          <div class="collapse-body"> 
           <ul class="crunchbase-accordion"> 
            <!-- Begin: Crunchbase Card --> 
            <li class="data-card crunchbase-card active" data-crunchbase-url="https://crunchbase.com/organization/crittercism/"> <h4 class="card-title card-acc-handle"> <a class="cb-card-title-link" href="https://crunchbase.com/organization/crittercism/"> Apteligent </a> </h4> 
             <div class="card-acc-panel"> 
              <ul class="card-info"> 
               <li> <strong class="key">Founded</strong> <span class="value">2011</span> </li> 
               <li class="cb-card-description full"> <strong class="key">Overview</strong> <span class="value">Crittercism, based in San Francisco, California, is the company behind the world’s first mobile application performance management (mAPM) solution. The company’s flagship product monitors every aspect of mobile app performance, allowing Developers, IT Operations and Product Managers to deliver high performing, highly reliable, highly resourceful mobile apps. Crittercism provides a real-time …</span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Location</strong> <span class="value"> <a href="http://crunchbase.com/location/san-francisco/528f5e3c90d111115d1c2e4ff979d58e">San Francisco, CA</a> </span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Categories</strong> <span class="value"> <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/apps/af3332489c7e50c5168ae91b86595a17">Apps</a>, <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/it-management/b8f58a18453350fb93a9b4f5579318c1">IT Management</a>, <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/enterprise-software/d38b3f26abc46f7bb29db952021a1b14">Enterprise Software</a>, <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/mobile/e907cf2a842d8a30a0b107d9de4a8178">Mobile</a> </span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Founders</strong> <span class="value"><a href="https://crunchbase.com/person/person/robert-kwok" target="_blank">Robert Kwok</a>, <a href="https://crunchbase.com/person/person/andrew-levy" target="_blank">Andrew Levy</a></span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Website</strong> <span class="value"> <a href="https://www.apteligent.com" target="_blank">https://www.apteligent.com</a> </span> </li> 
               <li class="full profile"> <a href="https://crunchbase.com/organization/crittercism" target="_blank">Full profile for Apteligent</a> </li> 
              </ul> 
             </div> </li> 
            <!-- End: Crunchbase Card --> 
            <!-- Begin: Crunchbase Card --> 
            <li class="data-card crunchbase-card" data-crunchbase-url="https://crunchbase.com/organization/vmware/"> <h4 class="card-title card-acc-handle"> <a class="cb-card-title-link" href="https://crunchbase.com/organization/vmware/"> VMware </a> </h4> 
             <div class="card-acc-panel"> 
              <ul class="card-info"> 
               <li> <strong class="key">Founded</strong> <span class="value">1998</span> </li> 
               <li class="cb-card-description full"> <strong class="key">Overview</strong> <span class="value">VMware, Inc. provides virtualization solutions. The company was founded in 1998 and is headquartered in Palo Alto, California. Its virtualization platform products include _Player_ that enables individuals to run virtual machines on their desktops; _Fusion_, a desktop virtualization product for users of Intel-based Apple Macintosh computers; _Workstation_ for software developers and enterprise IT …</span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Location</strong> <span class="value"> <a href="http://crunchbase.com/location/palo-alto/0d81d68c9c59f14f01163ad9ce7145ca">Palo Alto, CA</a> </span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Categories</strong> <span class="value"> <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/cloud-infrastructure/42a1e8f706c8864ed8c8432e57b6a0db">Cloud Infrastructure</a>, <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/cloud-management/ae47d4bcfe64963806b8ffdf91a9f82a">Cloud Management</a>, <a class="" href="http://crunchbase.com/category/enterprise-software/d38b3f26abc46f7bb29db952021a1b14">Enterprise Software</a> </span> </li> 
               <li class="full"> <strong class="key">Website</strong> <span class="value"> <a href="http://www.vmware.com" target="_blank">http://www.vmware.com</a> </span> </li>

  <script type="application/ld+json">
		{"@context":"http:\/\/schema.org","@type":"Article","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2017\/05\/15\/apteligent-acquired-by-vmware\/","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Ryan Lawler, Ron Miller"},"headline":"Apteligent acquired by VMware","articleBody":"VMware announced today that it has acquired\u00a0Apteligent, a startup that will allow\u00a0it to provide more tools to customers building and optimizing mobile apps.\n\nOriginally named Crittercism, Apteligent was founded to provide\u00a0mobile app performance and analytics data to customers. Over time, Apteligent moved more and more into the enterprise as a way for developers to understand not just crash reporting or network insights, but also to analyze user behavior and improve the user experience of their apps.\n\nTerms of the acquisition weren't disclosed, but Apteligent had\u00a0raised nearly $50 million since being founded in 2011, with a list of investors that include Scale Venture Partners, GV, Shasta Ventures, KPCB, \u00a0AngelPad and AOL Ventures. Strategic investors include Accenture and (yes) VMware, which apparently liked the company so much it just bought it outright.\n\nThe deal should add a new component to its product suite. VMware bought mobile device management company AirWatch in 2014. With\u00a0the Apteligent deal, VMware will\u00a0be able to provide a more robust set of capabilities to its mobile analytics customers.\n\nRay Wang, principal analyst at Constellation Research says this about enhancing VMware's mobile play, taking advantage of some of its previous acquisitions:\n\n\"Apteligent adds to the investments in end user computing such as analytics, performance management, crash churn, Xamarin SDK and digital workspace. The goal here is to build on mobile and the AirWatch investment,\" Wang told TechCrunch.","datePublished":"2017-05-15T21:35:36+00:00","mainEntityOfPage":"True","image":{"@list":["https:\/\/tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com\/2017\/05\/gettyimages-606916257.jpg"]},"speakable":{"@type":"SpeakableSpecification","cssSelector":[".alpha","#speakable-summary"]}}	</script>

	+"if(tp=='m'||tp=='w'||tp=='d'){eo=s.endof(tp),y=eo.getTime();e.setTi"
	+"me(y);}else {d=tp*86400000;e.setTime(ct+d);}if(!c){c='s_vnum';}if(!"

		/* <![CDATA[ */
		function addLoadEvent(func) {
			var oldonload = window.onload;
			if (typeof window.onload != 'function') {
				window.onload = func;
			} else {
				window.onload = function () {
					oldonload();
					func();
				}
			}

			a.src=src;var b=document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];b.parentNode.insertBefore(a,b)})("https://dashboard.tinypass.com/xbuilder/experience/load?aid=Fy7FpgyUxA");

  <script>
			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
				// Get all existing values from the cookie
				var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
				// Set the value
				cookieValue[name] = value;

				// Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
				var d = new Date();
				d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
				var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();


									var domain = 'techcrunch.com';
				
				// Write the cookie value
				document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=."+domain;
			}

						

			/**
			 * Sets cookie for later use in custom variables
			 * @param name custom variable's name
			 * @param value custom variable's value
			 */
			function pianoSetCustomVariableCookie(name, value) {
			    // Get all existing values from the cookie
			    var cookieValue = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();
			    // Set the value
			    cookieValue[name] = value;

			    // Get cookie expiration date in 3 years
			    var d = new Date();
			    d.setTime(d.getTime() + (94608000000));
			    var expires = "expires=" + d.toUTCString();

			    // Write the cookie value
			    document.cookie = "__pcvc=" + JSON.stringify(cookieValue) + ";" + expires + ";path=/;domain=.tcpreprod.com";
			}

			/**
			 * Read values from cookie and convert them from json
			 * @param specificName (optional) Name specific value from the set
			 * @returns {*} If specificName is specified - returns single value, otherwise returns JSON object with all values
			 */
			function pianoReadCustomVariableCookie(specificName) {
			    var cookieValue;
			    try {
			        // Try to get the cookie value with regexp
			        var match = document.cookie.match(new RegExp('(^| )__pcvc=([^;]+)'));
			        if (match) {
			            // If cookie with this name was found - try to parse the JSON value
			            cookieValue = JSON.parse(match[2]);
			        }
			    }
			    catch (e) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (!cookieValue) {
			        // By default - set value as empty object
			        cookieValue = {};
			    }
			    if (typeof specificName != "undefined") {
			        // Get the specific value from the set
			        if (typeof cookieValue[specificName] != "undefined") {
			            return cookieValue[specificName];
			        }
			        return null;
			    }
			    return cookieValue;
			}

			/**
			 * Function to send data upstream to Piano template
			 * @param iframeId - Element id of the Piano iframe
			 * @param success - true/false. Status of the message
			 * @param message - Error message text
			 * @param object - Additional data, like the the field that triggered the error
			 */
			function sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, success, message, object) {
			    var iframe = jQuery('#' + iframeId);

			    if (iframe.length) {
			        iframe[0].contentWindow.postMessage({
			            piano: {
			                success: success,
			                message: message,
			                object: object
			            }
			        }, '*');
			    }
			}

			tp = window.tp || [];

			tp.push(["addHandler", "customEvent", function (event, b, c, d) {
			    switch (event.eventName) {
			        // Don't show me this again
			        case 'dont-show':
			            pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('dontshow', 'y');
			            tp.offer.close();
			            break;

			        case 'tc-signup-newsletters':
			            console.log(event);
			            var email = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.email != 'undefined') && (event.params.email.length > 0)) {
			                email = event.params.email;
			            }

			            var object = '';
			            if ((typeof event.params.object != 'undefined') && (event.params.object.length > 0)) {
			                object = event.params.object;
			            }

			            var list = [];
			            if ((typeof event.params.list != 'undefined') && (event.params.list.length > 0)) {
			                list = JSON.parse(event.params.list);
			            }

			            var iframeId;

			            // We are parsing the params object sent from the template to find out which iframe triggered it
			            params = JSON.parse(event.params.params);
			            // And here's the iframeId we're looking for
			            iframeId = params.iframeId;

			            //grab the security string from the from the form
			            //on the page, needed for check in the backend
			            var $form = jQuery('.form-newsletters');
			            var url = '/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php';
			            var nonce = $form.data('nonce');


			            if (email == undefined || email == '') {
			                return;
			            }

			            var emailLists = [];
			            for (var i in list){
			                if (list[i]){
			                    emailLists.push(i);
			                }
			            }

			            var jqxhr = jQuery.get(url, {
			                action: "newsletters",
			                subaction: "subscribe",
			                email_lists: emailLists,
			                email: email,
			                tracking_id: event.params.tracking_id,
			                security: nonce
			            }, function (data) {
			                if (!data.success){
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, false, data.data.message, object)
			                }
			                else{
			                    // When the email was added - set the cookie
			                    pianoSetCustomVariableCookie('newsletter', 'y');
			                    sendPostMessageToPiano(iframeId, true, "");
			                }
			            });
			            break;
			    }
			}]);

			// Read all values from cookie
			var cookieValues = pianoReadCustomVariableCookie();

			for (var i in cookieValues) {
			    // Set custom variables from cookie
			    tp.push(['setCustomVariable', i, cookieValues[i]]);
			}



		</script>

  <script>
	var setAdblockerCookie = function(adblocker) {
	    var d = new Date();
	    d.setTime(d.getTime() + 60 * 60 * 24 * 30 * 1000);
	    document.cookie = "__adblocker=" + (adblocker ? "true" : "false") + "; expires=" + d.toUTCString() + "; path=/";
	}
	var script = document.createElement("script");
	script.setAttribute("async", true);
	script.setAttribute("src", "//www.npttech.com/advertising.js");
	script.setAttribute("onerror", "setAdblockerCookie(true);");
	script.setAttribute("onload", "setAdblockerCookie(false);");
	document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(script);
</script>

/* <![CDATA[ */
if (ads.isMobile()) {
	(function(window,$){
		window.TechCrunch.loader.on('tc_ads_wrapper_omniture', function(){
			if ( !window.ads.isAdPageSet ){
				if ( typeof window.adSetAdURL == 'function' ) {
					window.adSetAdURL('/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/_uac/adpage.html');
					window.ads.isAdPageSet = true;
				}
				if ( typeof window.adsResizePortrait === 'function' ) {
					window.adsResizePortrait('1');
				}
				window.console.log('ADS WIDTH:');
				window.console.log(ads);
			}
			window.adSetOthAT('kventryid=1490556;kvcmsid=tcr:1490556;kvugc=0;kvsubj=981465:981523:981525:6425097:982065:6258476:6321138:6378649;kvent=3485143:3689467:6354567');
			window.htmlAdWH('93484974', "320", "50", 'f', 'adsDiv862eea6f65');
		});
	}(this,this.jQuery));
}
/* ]]> */
</script> 
   </div>

       <h2>Hi!</h2> 
       <p> You are about to activate our Facebook Messenger news bot. Once subscribed, the bot will send you a digest of trending stories once a day. You can also customize the types of stories it sends you. </p>

       <div class="fb-messenger-iframe"> 
        <div class="fb-send-to-messenger" id="fb-send-to-messenger" messenger_app_id="1678638095724206" page_id="8062627951" color="blue" size="large" data-ref="tcnav"></div> 
        <script>
		  window.fbAsyncInit = function() {
		    FB.init({
		      appId      : '1678638095724206',
		      xfbml      : true,
		      version    : 'v2.6'
		    });
			FB.Event.subscribe('xfbml.render', function() {
				jQuery('.fb-messenger-loading').detach()
			});
		  };

		  (function(d, s, id){
		     var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
		     if (d.getElementById(id)) {return;}
		     js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id;
		     js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_US/sdk.js";
		     fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
		   }(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));

		   function getCookie(name) {
		      var matches = document.cookie.match(new RegExp(
		        "(?:^|; )" + name.replace(/([\.$?*|{}\(\)\[\]\\\/\+^])/g, '\\$1') + "=([^;]*)"
		      ));
		      return matches ? decodeURIComponent(matches[1]) : undefined;
		   }

		   window.onload = function() {
		     var gravity_guid = getCookie('grvinsights');
		     var btn = document.getElementById('fb-send-to-messenger');
		     if (btn != undefined && btn != null) {
			   btn.setAttribute('data-ref', gravity_guid)
			 }
		   }

		</script> 
       </div>

	(function(window,$){
		window.TechCrunch.loader.on('tc_ads_wrapper_omniture', function(){
			if ( !window.ads.isAdPageSet ){
				if ( typeof window.adSetAdURL == 'function' ) {
					window.adSetAdURL('/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/_uac/adpage.html');
					window.ads.isAdPageSet = true;
				}
				if ( typeof window.adsResizePortrait === 'function' ) {
					window.adsResizePortrait('1');
				}
				window.console.log('ADS WIDTH:');
				window.console.log(ads);
			}
			window.adSetOthAT('kventryid=1490556;kvcmsid=tcr:1490556;kvugc=0;kvsubj=981465:981523:981525:6425097:982065:6258476:6321138:6378649;kvent=3485143:3689467:6354567');

    <div class="title"> 
     <h1 class="alpha"> <a href="https://techcrunch.com/events/disrupt-ny-2017/"> Disrupt NY 2017 </a> </h1> 
     <p class="event-banner-info"> May&nbsp;15&nbsp;-&nbsp;17,&nbsp;2017 | <a href="https://www.google.com/maps?q=299+South+Street%2C+New+York%2C+NY+10002" target="_blank"> Pier&nbsp;36,&nbsp;New&nbsp;York,&nbsp;NY </a> </p>

    <article class="article lc"> 
     <div class="l-two-col-expose"> 
      <!-- Begin: Article Content - Body Right Column --> 
      <div class="l-main-container"> 
       <div class="l-main"> 
        <!-- Begin: Article Header --> 
        <header class="article-header page-title"> 
         <!-- Begin: Article Eyebrows --> 
         <div class="tags"> 
          <div class="tag-item"> 
           <a href="https://techcrunch.com/events/disrupt-ny-2017/" class="tag" data-omni-sm="art_articlecategory">Disrupt NY 2017</a> 
           <div class="links" id="tc-tag-item-disrupt-ny-2017"> 
            <ul class="recirc-river river-small g g-1-2-1"> 
             <li> 
              <div class="block-small"> 
               <a class="block-wrapper" href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/recordgram-thinks-your-phone-is-the-new-recording-studio/"> <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8922.jpg?w=150" alt="RecordGram thinks your phone is the new recording&nbsp;studio"> 
                <div class="block-content"> 
                 <h3>RecordGram thinks your phone is the new recording&nbsp;studio</h3> 
                 <div class="block-meta"> 
                  <div class="byline"> 
                   <time datetime="2017-05-15 15:06:18"></time> 
                  </div> 
                 </div> 
                </div> </a> 
              </div> </li> 
             <li> 
              <div class="block-small"> 
               <a class="block-wrapper" href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/credithero-wants-to-help-fix-credit-scores-for-those-afraid-to-even-look/"> <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/147a1308.jpg?w=150" alt="CreditHero wants to help fix credit scores for those afraid to even&nbsp;look"> 
                <div class="block-content"> 
                 <h3>CreditHero wants to help fix credit scores for those afraid to even&nbsp;look</h3> 
                 <div class="block-meta"> 
                  <div class="byline"> 
                   <time datetime="2017-05-15 14:45:44"></time> 
                  </div> 
                 </div> 
                </div> </a> 
              </div> </li> 
             <li>

         <!-- End: Article Eyebrows --> 
         <h1 class="alpha tweet-title">Using tech to uproot systemic racism</h1> 
         <div class="title-left"> 
          <div class="byline">
            Posted 
           <time datetime="2017-05-15" class="timestamp">10 hours ago</time> by 
           <a href="/author/jonathan-shieber/" title="Posts by Jonathan Shieber" onclick="s_objectID='river_author';" rel="author">Jonathan Shieber</a> 
           <span class="twitter-handle">(<a href="https://twitter.com/jshieber" rel="external">@jshieber</a>)</span>
          </div> 
          <!-- Begin: Social Share Icons --> 
          <div class="social-share social-share-inline"> 
           <ul class="inline-list social-share-list" id="social-share" data-permalink="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/using-tech-to-uproot-systemic-racism/" data-shortlink="http://tcrn.ch/2rjqFdj" data-sharetitle="Using tech to uproot systemic&nbsp;racism" data-post-id="1490556" data-twitter-hash="#TCDisrupt"> 
            <li class="total-shares"> <h5 class="total-shares-count">0</h5><br> <small>SHARES</small> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#comments" rel="external" class="comment icon-comment launch-social-load"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="facebook icon-facebook"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="twitter icon-twitter"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="linkedin icon-linkedin"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="google-plus icon-google-plus"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="reddit icon-reddit"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="stumbleupon icon-stumbleupon"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="email icon-email"></a> </li> 
            <li> <a href="#" rel="external" class="flipboard icon-flipboard"></a> </li> 
           </ul> 
          </div> 
          <div class="social-share social-share-fixed"> 
           <div class="less"> 
            <a class="blank"></a> 
            <a class="icon-flipboard" href="#"></a> 
            <a class="icon-stumbleupon" href="#"></a> 
            <a class="icon-reddit" href="#"></a> 
            <a class="icon-email" href="#"></a> 
           </div> 
           <div class="shown"> 
            <a class="icon-facebook" href="#"></a>

            <a class="icon-linkedin" href="#"></a> 
            <a class="icon-whatsapp" href="#"></a> 
            <a class="icon-email" href="#"></a> 
           </div> 
          </div> 
          <!-- End: Social Share Icons --> 
         </div> 
         <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/05/15/sunrise-health/" class="next-link" data-omni-sm="art_nextstory"> 
          <div class="next-story-link">
           Next Story
          </div> 
          <div class="next-story-full"> 
           <h4 class="next-title">Sunrise gives mental health patients AI-guarded group&nbsp;chat</h4> 
          </div> </a> 
        </header> 
        <!-- End: Article Header --> 
        <!-- Begin: Article Body --> 
        <div class="l-two-col"> 
         <!-- Begin: Article Body - Main --> 
         <div class="l-main-container"> 
          <div class="l-main"> 
           <div class="article-entry text"> 
            <!-- Begin: Wordpress Article Content --> 
            <img src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8518.jpg?w=738" class=""> 
            <p id="speakable-summary">Rejecting the backlash against <a target="_blank" href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QDydKwmrHFo" rel="noopener noreferrer">hashtag activism</a>, Brittany Packnett defended the work of the armchair activists on Twitter and other social media who have brought needed attention to social justice issues.</p> 
            <p>Set against a backdrop in which just last week another young black kid&nbsp;<a target="_blank" href="http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/happened-night-jordan-edwards-fatally-shot-article-1.3150363" rel="noopener noreferrer">was shot and killed</a> by police, Packnett, co-founder&nbsp;of <a target="_blank" href="https://www.joincampaignzero.org/" rel="noopener noreferrer">Campaign Zero,&nbsp;</a>defended the use of social media like Twitter and affirmed its ability to influence legislation and have a profound affect on social justice movements.</p> 
            <p>“We call it Campaign Zero because we believe we can live in a world where police don’t kill people,” says Packnett of the organization’s mission.&nbsp;“It is perfectly possible to have the police not kill anybody.”</p> 
            <p>And social media activism is an important component of making that vision a reality, says Packnett.</p> 
            <p><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1490692" src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/screen-shot-2017-05-15-at-5-00-35-pm.png?w=1024&amp;h=527" alt="" width="1024" height="527" srcset="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/screen-shot-2017-05-15-at-5-00-35-pm.png?w=1024&amp;h=527 1024w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/screen-shot-2017-05-15-at-5-00-35-pm.png?w=150&amp;h=77 150w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/screen-shot-2017-05-15-at-5-00-35-pm.png?w=300&amp;h=154 300w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/screen-shot-2017-05-15-at-5-00-35-pm.png?w=768&amp;h=395 768w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/screen-shot-2017-05-15-at-5-00-35-pm.png?w=680&amp;h=350 680w, https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/screen-shot-2017-05-15-at-5-00-35-pm.png 1415w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px"></p> 
            <p>“If protest is the act of telling the truth out loud, in public, there are lots of ways you can take the spirit of protest anywhere,” Packnett says. “We need every single tool we have at our disposal to win this thing.”</p> 
            <p>For that reason, Packnett rejects the notion that folks can’t help bend the arc of history toward justice even from the comfort of their couches. “You helped Ferguson be the most-used hashtag in 10&nbsp;years of Twitter… we need people who couldn’t necessarily get up off of the couch to do that.”</p> 
            <p>And hashtag activism gets real results, according to Packnett. “Hashtag activism has gotten folks fired and hashtag activism has gotten folks charged… hashtag activism has gotten laws changed.”</p> 
            <p>Still, the whole point of Campaign Zero is to make local activism as easy as possible. The organization is a focal point and a resource for presenting platforms for social change that can be taken to local legislators.</p> 
            <p>It’s about empowerment and it’s about using the new technological tools to tackle an old problem. “Police violence is not a new problem,” Packnett notes. “Black bodies were never served or protected… they were always controlled.”</p>
            <div>
             <div id="adsDivacc5b65879" class="native-ad-mobile"></div>
            </div>

                <img data-thumb="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8517.jpg?w=80&amp;h=60&amp;crop=1" data-full-size-image="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8517.jpg" data-large-size-image="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8517.jpg?w=1&amp;h=1" data-trigger-notification="1" data-scalable="false" alt="" data-src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8517.jpg?w=1&amp;h=1" data-tc-lazyload="deferred" src="https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/assets/images/1x1.png" width="1" height="1">
               </div> <h3 class="title">Brittany Packnett (Campaign Zero) at TechCrunch Disrupt NY 2017</h3> 
               <div class="caption">
                Brittany Packnett (Campaign Zero) at TechCrunch Disrupt NY 2017
               </div> 
               <div class="credit"></div> </li>
              <li> 
               <div class="image">
                <img data-thumb="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8518.jpg?w=80&amp;h=60&amp;crop=1" data-full-size-image="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8518.jpg" data-large-size-image="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8518.jpg?w=1&amp;h=1" data-trigger-notification="1" data-scalable="false" alt="" data-src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8518.jpg?w=1&amp;h=1" data-tc-lazyload="deferred" src="https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/assets/images/1x1.png" width="1" height="1">
               </div> <h3 class="title">Brittany Packnett (Campaign Zero) at TechCrunch Disrupt NY 2017</h3> 
               <div class="caption">
                Brittany Packnett (Campaign Zero) at TechCrunch Disrupt NY 2017
               </div> 
               <div class="credit"></div> </li>
              <li> 
               <div class="image">
                <img data-thumb="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8521.jpg?w=80&amp;h=60&amp;crop=1" data-full-size-image="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8521.jpg" data-large-size-image="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8521.jpg?w=1&amp;h=1" data-trigger-notification="1" data-scalable="false" alt="" data-src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2017/05/tcdisrupt-ny17-8521.jpg?w=1&amp;h=1" data-tc-lazyload="deferred" src="https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/themes/vip/techcrunch-2013/assets/images/1x1.png" width="1" height="1">
               </div> <h3 class="title">Brittany Packnett (Campaign Zero) at TechCrunch Disrupt NY 2017</h3> 
               <div class="caption">
                Brittany Packnett (Campaign Zero) at TechCrunch Disrupt NY 2017
               </div> 
               <div class="credit"></div> </li>
             </ol> 
             <div class="enter-wrapper"> 
              <a class="enter" href="#">&nbsp;<span class="enter-text">View Slideshow</span></a> 
             </div> 
             <div class="controls"> 
              <a class="prev icon-arrow-left" href="#"><span class="is-vishidden">Previous</span></a> 
              <a class="next icon-arrow" href="#"><span class="is-vishidden">Next</span></a> 
              <a class="exit" href="#">Exit</a> 
             </div> 
            </div> 
            <p>It’s also important to place this history of police violence in the broader context of social injustice. Packnett calls it a branch on a larger tree that is rooted in systemic racism and oppression.</p> 
            <p>“Our mission is not to break off one particular branch of the system. It’s to uproot the entire tree.”</p> 
            <p>That mission became clear to Packnett in the wake of Michael Brown’s murder in Ferguson, Mo. It was in the protests that followed in that small Missouri town that the resistance movement was formed (primarily through online activism).</p> 
            <p>“The first venture was the Ferguson Protest newsletter,” she said. “We had 16,000 subscribers worldwide in just a couple of weeks.”</p> 
            <p>Indeed, technology and tech companies have a crucial role to play, not just in disseminating information but in becoming new exemplars of how American culture can change.</p> 
            <p>Tech companies have a responsibility to hold themselves up to the high standards that they espouse, says Packnett. She called for tech companies to not just tout their diversity numbers when those employees are only filing the most junior positions at those businesses. Instead, companies should be looking to have diverse hires take on more senior roles.</p> 
            <p>“What if everything you did was devoted to a sense of equity?” Packnett asked of the industry.</p> 
            <p>In an industry that claims to be different from the rest of the world, in an industry that looks to change the way the world works, Packnett issued a challenge to change its own practices.</p> 
            <p>Industries aren’t transformative unless they can actually transform themselves, and that includes not just boasting of diversity in hiring when everyone is working in junior positions. The industry should bring more people on in senior roles, said Packnett. “That’s the kind of commitment we’re looking for from the tech industry.”</p> 
            <div class="vdb_player vdb_56df4e9de4b0c9c31d626c18564f313b67b6231408bc51ee" vdb_params=""> 
             <script type="text/javascript" src="//delivery.vidible.tv/jsonp/pid=56df4e9de4b0c9c31d626c18/vid=5919ce7e92fdde0c0d85bb76/564f313b67b6231408bc51ee.js"></script> 
            </div> 
            <!-- End: Wordpress Article Content --> 
           </div>

         <li id="tc-accordion-item-hashtag-tag"> 
          <div class="loaded acc-handle"> 
           <a href="https://techcrunch.com/tag/hashtag/"> hashtag </a> 
          </div> </li> 
         <li id="tc-accordion-item-disrupt-ny-2017-tag"> 
          <div class="loaded acc-handle"> 
           <a href="https://techcrunch.com/tag/disrupt-ny-2017/"> Disrupt NY 2017 </a> 
          </div> </li>

          </div> </li>

          <div class="loaded acc-handle"> 
           <a href="https://techcrunch.com/tag/brittany-packnett/"> Brittany Packnett </a> 
          </div> </li> 
         <li id="tc-accordion-item-disrupt-ny-2017-category"> 
          <div class="loaded acc-handle"> 
           <a href="https://techcrunch.com/events/disrupt-ny-2017/"> Disrupt NY 2017 </a> 
          </div> </li> 
         <li class="active"> 
          <div class="acc-handle loaded">
           <a>Popular Posts</a>
          </div> 
          <div class="acc-panel"> 
           <div id="acc-native-ad"></div> 
           <script type="text/javascript">
			(function(window){
				try {
					window.TechCrunch.loader.on('tc_ads_wrapper_omniture', function() {
						if (!window.ads.isMobile()) {
							window.adSetInView('1');
							window.htmlAdWH('93484965', '320', '115', 'text', 'acc-native-ad');
							window.adSetInView('0');
						}
					});
				} catch (e) {
					// Assume this is just no ad placement for this page load
				}
			}(this));
		</script> 
           <ul class="recirc-river river-small" data-omni-sm-delegate="art_recircbottom"> 
            <div id="grv-personalization-14"></div> 
            <script>if( !ads.isMobile() ){ window.TechCrunch.loader.on( 'gravity-beacon', function(){ window.tc_loadGravityScript( 'recirculation-accordion' ); } ); }</script> 
           </ul> 
          </div> </li> 
        </ul> 
       </div> 
       <!-- End: Recirculation Accordion --> 
      </div> 
      <!-- End: Article Recirculation - Body Left Column --> 
     </div> 
    </article> 
    <!-- End: Article - Primary -->

  <script type="application/ld+json">
		{"@context":"http:\/\/schema.org","@type":"Article","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2017\/05\/15\/using-tech-to-uproot-systemic-racism\/","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Jonathan Shieber"},"headline":"Hashtag activism can make a difference","articleBody":"Rejecting the backlash against hashtag activism, Brittany Packnett defended the work of the armchair activists on Twitter and other social media who have brought needed attention to social justice issues.\n\nSet against a backdrop in which just last week another young black kid\u00a0was shot and killed by police, Packnett, co-founder\u00a0of Campaign Zero,\u00a0defended the use of social media like Twitter and affirmed its ability to influence legislation and have a profound affect on social justice movements.\n\n\"We call it Campaign Zero because we believe we can live in a world where police don\u2019t kill people,\" says Packnett of the organization's mission.\u00a0\"It is perfectly possible to have the police not kill anybody.\"\n\nAnd social media activism is an important component of making that vision a reality, says Packnett.\n\n\n\n\"If protest is the act of telling the truth out loud, in public, there are lots of ways you can take the spirit of protest anywhere,\" Packnett says. \"We need every single tool we have at our disposal to win this thing.\"\n\nFor that reason, Packnett rejects the notion that folks can't help bend the arc of history toward justice even from the comfort of their couches. \"You helped Ferguson be the most-used hashtag in 10\u00a0years of Twitter... we need people who couldn't necessarily get up off of the couch to do that.\"\n\nAnd hashtag activism gets real results, according to Packnett. \"Hashtag activism has gotten folks fired and hashtag activism has gotten folks charged... hashtag activism has gotten laws changed.\"\n\nStill, the whole point of Campaign Zero is to make local activism as easy as possible. The organization is a focal point and a resource for presenting platforms for social change that can be taken to local legislators.\n\nIt's about empowerment and it's about using the new technological tools to tackle an old problem. \"Police violence is not a new problem,\" Packnett notes. \"Black bodies were never served or protected... they were always controlled.\"\n\n\n\nIt's also important to place this history of police violence in the broader context of social injustice. Packnett calls it a branch on a larger tree that is rooted in systemic racism and oppression.\n\n\"Our mission is not to break off one particular branch of the system. It's to uproot the entire tree.\"\n\nThat mission became clear to Packnett in the wake of Michael Brown's murder in Ferguson, Mo. It was in the protests that followed in that small Missouri town that the resistance movement was formed (primarily through online activism).\n\n\"The first venture was the Ferguson Protest newsletter,\" she said. \"We had 16,000 subscribers worldwide in just a couple of weeks.\"\n\nIndeed, technology and tech companies have a crucial role to play, not just in disseminating information but in becoming new exemplars of how American culture can change.\n\nTech companies have a responsibility to hold themselves up to the high standards that they espouse, says Packnett. She called for tech companies to not just tout their diversity numbers when those employees are only filing the most junior positions at those businesses. Instead, companies should be looking to have diverse hires take on more senior roles.\n\n\"What if everything you did was devoted to a sense of equity?\" Packnett asked of the industry.\n\nIn an industry that claims to be different from the rest of the world, in an industry that looks to change the way the world works, Packnett issued a challenge to change its own practices.\n\nIndustries aren't transformative unless they can actually transform themselves, and that includes not just boasting of diversity in hiring when everyone is working in junior positions. The industry should bring more people on in senior roles, said Packnett. \"That's the kind of commitment we're looking for from the tech industry.\"\n\n","datePublished":"2017-05-15T21:35:10+00:00","mainEntityOfPage":"True","image":{"@list":["https:\/\/tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com\/2017\/05\/tcdisrupt-ny17-8518.jpg","https:\/\/tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com\/2017\/05\/screen-shot-2017-05-15-at-5-00-35-pm.png"]},"speakable":{"@type":"SpeakableSpecification","cssSelector":[".alpha","#speakable-summary"]}}	</script>

		function addLoadEvent(func) {
			var oldonload = window.onload;
			if (typeof window.onload != 'function') {
				window.onload = func;
			} else {
				window.onload = function () {
					oldonload();
